Title: BI Data Analyst
Description:
Working at GXO Logistics means working in a dynamic and international organization. An exciting environment with plenty of room for personal input and development. Employees at GXO Logistics are in charge of their own success. Whatever your position at GXO Logistics, you will face new challenges every day, allowing you to develop optimally. We support you in your development, so that you can contribute to the entrepreneurship of our organization.







What do you do as BI/Data Analyst




As a BI/Data Analyst you work on a daily basis on large and small projects for different customers in our logistics operations. At GXO you work at one of the largest Supply Chain organizations in the world. As a result, no workday is the same!

In this role, the focus is to transform data into insight that can help to improve the value of the business. You are responsible for building the company “Reporting system and KPI’s” to measure our business performances across our main warehousing and transportation services. Your responsibility is to develop and provide new business intelligence solutions, to analyze data, to deliver reporting solutions/packages/database solutions to include a range of reports, scorecards, dashboards and other solutions.

You will be working at the IT department, where IT is taking care of all GXO sites in Italy and Switzerland. In this role you will report directly to the IT Operations Director.







Your duties include:




Work closely with the Business/Operations to ensure that data pulled from WMSs and TMSs accurately reflects our GXO business processes and monitoring needs
Define reporting requirements
Creation and maintain the dashboards and KPIs used by our Operations
Primary support contact and expert for the Company BI and Data Analytics platforms
Enhancement of the existing reports/dashboards to improve performance and presentation
You are responsible to delivers reporting solutions by developing and creating new reports
In charge of the dentification, specification, querying, validation and delivery of standard and custom reports
You will develop, validate and provide ongoing support of operational and project-related reports, scripts and data analysis
You provide technical direction, guidance and assistance during project development, maintaining data integrity and quality control of delivered reports
Develop, maintain and optimize database modules and system components
You will influence business decisions by developing and institutionalizing data driven analytics




What we offer you




You will work in a dynamic organization where development and personal contribution are central
A job with a lot of responsibility, where no day is the same
Enterprising, open and informal organizational culture
Office available in a central area of Milan.




What do you have




You have a minimum of HBO work and thinking level
You have excellent knowledge of databases, BI and Data Analytics platforms, preferably in a 3PL environment
You have at least 5 years of experience in similar projects and organizations
You are independent, analytical and accurate, but you are also able to maintain a helicopter view
Experience in a complex, high demanding and fast-paced international environment, preferably in Supply Chain industry
You have excellent knowledge of Italian and English Language.




Your working environment




GXO Logistics offers advanced supply chain solutions for the world's most successful companies in many industries, as e-commerce, food & retail, fashion and luxury, pharma&beauty and industrial multinationals. In Italy and Switzerland GXO operates from 45 different locations with its headquarters in Trezzo sull’Adda (MI).

GXO is a leading provider of advanced supply chain solutions to the world's most successful companies. We help our customers manage their goods as efficiently as possible using our technology and services. Our greatest strength is our global team - energetic, innovative employees of all experience levels and talents who make GXO a great place to work.




Customer satisfaction, personal growth of employees and a safe working environment are crucial within GXO Logistics' business philosophy.




“We engineer faster, smarter, leaner supply chains.”




Customer satisfaction, employee personal growth and sustainability are central to GXO Logistics' business philosophy. Today, this ambitious company is one of the top 3 largest logistics service.







GXO

Logistics at full potential.

Logistics done differently.

Be part of something big.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Skill Farm Experts Are Invited to Apply for the Following Role:

Responsibilities:

Presidierai il Framework di Data Governance di Gruppo, contribuendo al suo miglioramento continuo anche tramite un impianto normativo adeguato e aggiornato rispetto alle best practice e agli standard di settore;

Sensibilizzerai verso l'adozione di un approccio Data Driven nel Gruppo, ossia l'utilizzo sistematico del dato per guidare i processi decisionali verso il raggiungimento di specifici risultati di business;

Promuoverai la creazione e la diffusione di una Data Culture di Gruppo contribuendo alla definizione di un programma di formazione sui dati.

Supporterai il Business della tua societˆ nel governo del patrimonio informativo e nell'identificazione di opportunitˆ di miglioramento dei processi aziendali attraverso l'utilizzo innovativo dei dati;

Lavorerai in stretta collaborazione con team multidisciplinari (Business, IT, Compliance, Risk) per contribuire a soddisfare le esigenze della tua societˆ tramite soluzioni data oriented.

Skills:

Esperienza di almeno 2-3 anni nella gestione di progettualitˆ relative al governo/gestione/certificazione/qualitˆ del dato maturata in data driven company;

Laurea in Matematica, Ingegneria o Economia;

Conoscenza di strumenti e tecnologie di gestione dei dati quali database relazionali, Data Warehouse (es. Synapse/Fabric, Oracle), Data Lakehouse (es. Synapse/Fabric), tool di Data Governance (es. Purview, Informatica), tool di Business Intelligence (es. PowerBI);

Buone competenze di project management;

Buone capacitˆ relazionali che ti hanno consentito di interfacciarti efficacemente con interlocutori sia tecnici sia di business;

Spiccate capacitˆ analitiche e di problem solving.

Title: JUNIOR DATA ANALYST - INSURANCE
HTML:
Just On Business Spa (JOB) è un'agenzia per il lavoro specializzata nella ricerca e selezione, amministrazione e formazione del personale, presente sul mercato da oltre vent'anni.

Selezioniamo per Azienda leader nella comparazione, promozione e intermediazione online un JUNIOR DATA ANALYST - INSURANCE

La risorsa avrà il compito di supportare il team nella definizione e realizzazione di progetti strategici con l'obiettivo di garantire il miglior livello di servizio per rispondere alla crescente domanda dei Clienti.

Si Occuperà, Inoltre, Di

  • Sviluppo ed implementazione di modelli quantitativi e dashboard;
  • Supporto la direzione Insurance nell'ottimizzazione dei processi esistenti e nello sviluppo di nuove attività/processi/linee di business;
  • Lavorerai in sinergia con le diverse funzioni aziendali per sviluppare, testare ed ottimizzare i processi.

REQUISITI

  • Neolaureato STEM o statistica;
  • Ottime capacità analitiche e propensione all'implementazione di modelli matematici e predittivi;
  • Precisione e attenzione nell'esecuzione delle attività;
  • Conoscenza avanzata di Microsoft Excel;
  • Proattività, predisposizione al lavoro in team;
  • Conoscenza di R o Python, Tableau e SQL verranno considerati un plus.

LUOGO DI LAVORO: MILANO, ZONA MM GAMBARA

L'annuncio è rivolto a tutte le persone, senza distinzione di sesso, in riferimento al D. Lgs. 198/2006.

Settore: Informatica

Ruolo: IT/Technology

Tipo di occupazione: Apprendistato

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Lifesciences Consultants is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Junior HR Data Analyst to join our Team. This role will focus on supporting HR operations and analytics, particularly in generating data reports and monitoring internal processes.




Key Responsibilities

- Data Reporting & Analysis: assist in preparing and maintaining HR data reports.

- Administrative Support: maintain HR databases and records, ensuring data accuracy and completeness.

- Collaboration: work closely with HR Team and Managers to gather data and support plans’ development; provide status updates.

- Process Improvement: help streamline HR operations by identifying inefficiencies and recommending improvements.




Qualifications

- Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Economics or related field.

- Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other data management tools.

- Strong organizational and multitasking skills.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- High attention to detail and ability to work with sensitive information.

- Prior experience in the role is a plus.




What We Offer

- Opportunity for professional growth and development.

- A collaborative and supportive work environment.

- Exposure to diverse HR functions and hands-on experience.

Title: Data Analyst in Marketing (Relocation to Tallinn)
Description:
As a Data Analyst in a Marketing team, you’ll play a central role in Bolts Global's marketing operations - helping us decide where we focus our time and money.




If you are passionate about data analysis, A/B testing, and impacting the way decisions are made that affect millions of customers and millions of euros in marketing spend - you’ll be at the right place in Bolt!




About the role

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Marketing team, you’ll ensure we’re making the best decisions. You’ll work closely with our teams to measure the impact of millions of euros spent on advertising brand campaigns, to identify the marketing communications that have the highest performance, and to recommend to our global and local teams serving the 30+ countries the best ways to spend their time and budgets.




In your job, you’ll be working closely with our marketing and business management teams as well as our industry partners (Google, Meta, TikTok, etc.)




Your daily adventures will include:

Conduct in-depth analysis of marketing investments to recommend the optimal budget allocations between channels, markets, and specific campaigns - following the existing frameworks.
Collaborate with marketing specialists and managers to design and analyze A/B tests for marketing communications initiatives with minimal supervision
Provide data-driven insights and recommendations to the marketing teams and leadership supporting day-to-day operations, business reviews and strategic decision-making
Support the stakeholders with ad-hoc analysis and bring visibility by building dashboards and reports.




About you:

Bachelors/Master’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or Business
At least 2 years of experience dealing with large volumes of data
Outstanding SQL skills and a solid grasp of Python/R for data analysis
Fluent with at least one of the BI tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik, DataStudio, Metabase, etc) and data visualization in general
Good understanding of statistics for A/B testing and experimentation
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations
Fluent in English
Extra bonus, but not required - experience with marketing and consumer analytics, marketing mix modeling, and/or Bayesian statistics




Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!




Why you’ll love it here:

Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.




*Some perks may differ depending on your location.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.

Write the next chapter of your ABB story.

This position reports to

Pricing Specialist

Your role and responsibilities

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work closely with sales, marketing and product functions providing data and statistics to support existing and potential products, systems, and/or services strategy. Each day, you will support the implementation, development and maintenance of region statistics (costs, sales, prices, orders, etc.) through big data tools like PowerBI. You will support sales with statistics and scorecard tracking and provide computing expertise to the organization. You will also showcase your expertise by working with the team on new development dashboards.

The work model for the role is:

This role contributes to the Electrification - Installation Products Business Line in Sesto San Giovanni (MI).

You will be mainly accountable for:


Constructing and fitting statistical, machine learning, or optimization models and developing appropriate advanced statistical methods
Designing database systems
Ensuring high-quality analysis and extracting data from sales/financial tools to support KPI tracking
Assisting in the development of statistical analysis tools
Collaborating with internal stakeholders to understand business challenges and develop analytical solutions
Supporting regional teams in the best use of tracking system and monitoring ongoing data quality.
Suggesting improvements concerning statistics creation and maintenance.
Documenting, reviewing and updating all documents on tools and database setup


You will join a dynamic and talented team, where you will be able to thrive.


Qualifications For The Role


Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or similar
Extensive knowledge of Excel, PowerBI - DAX and Power Query. R and Phyton are a plus
You are passionate about data management and structures. Knowledge of costs and profitability KPIs is preferred
You enjoy working in a team and you have a good interpersonal attitude
You are goal-oriented, precise in following procedures and have a problem solving attitude
You are at ease communicating in both Italian and English languages


What's in it for you?


Work in a company with a strong technology legacy and deeply rooted in local communities
Bring your knowledge and expertise, make the difference in technology
Flexibility: we have hybrid work options, make the best out of them!


More about us

ABB Installation Products Division (formerly Thomas&Betts), helps manage the connection, protection and distribution of electrical power from source to socket. The Division’s products are engineered to provide ease of installation and perform in demanding and harsh conditions, helping to ensure safety and continuous operation for utilities, businesses and people around the world. The Commercial Essentials product segment includes electrical junction boxes, commercial fittings, strut and cable tray metal framing systems for commercial and residential construction. The Premier Industrial product segment includes multiple product lines, such as Ty-Rap® cable ties, T&B Liquidtight Systems® protection products, PVC coated and nylon conduit systems, power connection and grounding systems, and cable protection systems of conduits and fittings for harsh and industrial applications. The Division also manufactures solutions for medium-voltage applications used in the utility market under its marquee brands including Elastimold™ reclosers and switchgear, capacitor switches, current limiting fuses, Homac™ distribution connectors, Hi-Tech Valiant™ full-range current limiting fuse for fire mitigation, faulted current indicators and distribution connectors, cable accessories and apparatus with products for overhead and underground distribution. Manufacturing includes made-to-stock and custom-made solutions.

We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

For further info: Davide Lippiello, Talent Partner


92793677

Title: Digital Analytics Consultant - Milan
Description:
About the Company

Rapid shifts in technology have dramatically changed the way people interact and engage with brands. fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands leverage data to improve marketing, media, and customer experience through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.

As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +400 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York.

About the Role

We are looking for a Digital Analytics Consultant to join our new Milan-based consulting team. This is a varied role which spans across website architecture, UX analysis, media advisory and digital strategy. As a Consultant at 55, you will be working on marketing analytics and marketing activations as opposed to setting up and optimising campaigns, so we therefore are seeking applicants with some prior experience in marketing or web analytics.

Working as part of a small, collaborative team, you will play a key role in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple, big brand clients across industries such as luxury, automotive, retail and beauty. These projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation and media-mix optimisation and you will be required to promote a customer-centric vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions.

You will report to the Head of office and work alongside other Consultants and technical experts such as Tracking Specialists, Cloud Engineers and Innovation Experts. Led by the Senior Consultant, you will contribute to the timely & professional delivery of our projects. Examples of the sort of project work you will be part of delivering within the first year of your role include but are not limited to; the creation and monitoring of complex dashboards aimed at aggregating findings from numerous data sources; the evaluation of client's existing marketing channel mix and the recommendation of the most suitable attribution model; the implementation of cookie consent management solutions to obtain users consent for data collection, martech audience review and architecture recommendation. This is an exciting, hands-on role within a company that puts collaboration and knowledge sharing at the heart of everything we do.

Responsibilities

Within your first year at fifty-five, you will be taking on the following core tasks and responsibilities, amongst others:

Delivering high quality outcomes for a variety of projects in the Ad Tech and Web Analytics space, working in a client-facing position, supported by a team of technical specialists
Meeting client's requirements within the agreed deadlines, keeping track of the necessary tasks for each project and liaising with the relevant owners internally and externally; foreseeing and escalating issues / risks as appropriate
Developing a sharp, operational expertise regarding web analytics and media-buy topics

Progressing in your journey at fifty-five, you will be given the opportunity to grow in your role through first-hand exposure to multiple disciplines and, if interested, you might be selected to take a specialist path.


Our Ideal Candidate

Educated to degree level
Approximately 1 year of experience in web / marketing analytics (preferably as a business analyst/ data analyst/ marketing analyst, or with experience in paid media buying)
Familiarity with the Google stack
Analytical mindset, keen to apply data to challenges
Detail oriented, proactive and self-motivated, good organisation is paramount
A confident presenter
Curious and eager to learn, able to challenge and recommend solutions to problems
Flexible, versatile and works well under pressure
Collaborative, works well in a team, understands that the sum of our parts is better than the individual
Strong interest in new marketing technologies & the digital industry
Interest in working in a small, growing team

If this sounds like you, please get in touch! We look forward to meeting you.

In return, we are pleased to offer you the following benefits:

Being part of a multicultural, dynamic and fast-growing team
Continuous (and certified) training on the digital ecosystem and technologies (initial training for all new employees, followed by recurring training sessions)
Phone allowance
The flexibility to work remotely for part of the week - this will continue post Covid
UnMind App subscription

fifty-five encourages diversity and is committed to guaranteeing equal treatment of all applications, regardless of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, state of health or political or religious opinion.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
The Data Analyst combines marketing and data management expertise. He / she is responsible for data analysis / research and for translating both internal and external data into valuable insights for other members of the Squad. He / she develops algorithms and analytical models using external and internal data to predict customer needs and relationships with markets, industries and the wider financial landscape.

He / she is responsible to develop analytical methods to build segmentations and to bring data culture through tribes. Take a leading role in implementing a fact-based culture by developing the concept of "analysis" from a simple function to a bank-level competence.




Key Responsibilities:

Provide relevant information and reporting of products/customers growth supporting the management team to define business action aiming to reach the Retail objectives
Support other Tribes and channels on the achievement of business performance targets and help the Bank in developing Customer relationship in efficient and profitable way
Provide analysis and useful insights to develop business strategy and customer interactions
As Business Translator data analyst support the bank in interacting with the more technical areas (Tribe Data Management) in order to guide it in an increasingly data-driven perspective
Help to orchestrate the customer commercial strategy by helping to develop a synergistic interaction between the different Tribes and keeping the focus on the customer
Implement analytical models and algorithms to develop commercial strategy and facilitate business growth




Soft Skills:

Professional expertise and marketing/customer relationship knowledge
Excellent analytical skills and problem solving
Investigative and learning ability
Teamwork
Planning and organizing
Oral skills and presentation




Technical, Language and other Specialized Skills:

Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Finance, Engineering or Business Studies (with strong quantitative profile)
Excellent Knowledge of SAS Base Programming Language
Good knowledge of Windows Office (Word, Excel, Power Point)
Reporting Tool expertise (e.g: SAS VA, IBM Cognos, Power BI, Qlik Sense) is a plus
English fluency




Work Experience:

5-10 years of experience in a similar role
Experience in banking or in a role related to Planning & Performance, Business Intelligence, Sales or Finance into a corporate Industries is a plus




About ING

ING offers many opportunities to build a diverse and rewarding career. You will be joining an international innovative digital bank, the first in Italy to adopt a fully flexible smart working model, and you will be working in a stimulating environment where you can grow both as an individual and as a professional. Our purpose - empowering people to stay a step ahead in life and in business - represents our belief in people’s potential. We don’t judge, coach or to tell people how to live their lives. We empower people and businesses to realize their own vision for a better future.

#doyourthing is our brand direction with us each and every day. It is how we articulate our purpose and our promise to make banking frictionless to the world.

‘do your thing’ is about people being free to live the life they want to live, knowing that they will make their world a little better for it.

Do you think you are "a step ahead"? Apply now!




The benefits of joining ING

In addition to being a part of a great team, working in a fun and innovative environment, we offer:

Super flexible smart working
Competitive base salaries and performance based bonuses
Diverse cultures & Innovative mindsets
International Environment
Commitment to sustainability
Lots of training development opportunities to help you grow
Lots of moments dedicated to physical and mental well-being
A special day off when it is your birthday: we call it #doyourbirthday!
And of course we can’t forget: free water & coffee at the office!




Our Commitment

Diversity is a fundamental element of our corporate culture, and we are fully committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment, based on mutual respect and the value of diversity, offering equal job opportunities to all qualified candidates.

Diversity is a fundamental element of our corporate culture, and we are fully committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment, based on mutual respect and the value of diversity, offering equal job opportunities to all qualified candidates.

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant - INTERNSHIP - Milano [CNS]
Description:
"Vuoi essere al centro di prospettive di crescita uniche? Entra nella practice Technology Consulting di PwC e diventa:"

Junior Data & Analytics Consultant

Your Perspectives

Prenderai parte a diversi progetti di trasformazione del business dei principali players in ambito Automotive & Industrial Manufacturing, Consumer Markets, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services, Telco & Media attraverso l’efficientamento e la reingegnerizzazione dei processi interni.

Grazie all’accesso alle vaste competenze del nostro network internazionale, potrai dare spazio alle tue idee e fornire il contributo innovativo che hai sempre desiderato.

Sarai coinvolto in progetti di consulenza e maturerai esperienza su tematiche di Data Warehouse, Big Data, Business Intelligence, Data Science, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence.

Aiuterai i nostri clienti ad esplorare nuove opportunità di business principalmente occupandoti di:


Costruzione di architetture Big Data, implementazione di soluzioni di Data Warehouse, analisi dei dati e rappresentazione degli stessi, attraverso l’utilizzo di tool dedicati
Valutazione delle strutture organizzative di presidio e gestione dei dati nelle organizzazioni
Attività e progetti in ambito Data Visualization;
Per la posizione di Data Scientist sarai coinvolto sia nella progettazione che nello sviluppo di Decision Support System basati su engine di Machine Learning, Deep Learning e Reinforcement Learning.


Your unique strengths


Hai conseguito o stai conseguendo una laurea magistrale in ambito economico-statistico, ingegneristico e informatico
Parli e scrivi in inglese fluentemente
Sei in grado di trovare soluzioni funzionali e innovative a progetti complessi
Hai una forte passione per il mondo IT e gli strumenti tecnologici non hanno segreti per te
Sai lavorare per obiettivi e metterti in gioco con passione
Sei un team worker e hai buone capacità relazionali e comunicative
Hai sempre la valigia pronta anche per un viaggio di lavoro e sei motivato

Title: Data Analyst - Field Marketing
Description:
Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?

Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.

Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!




Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.

Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.

Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile.

Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.




Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?

Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti.




Come?

> realizzando report su misura;

> utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);

> sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;

> collaborando con i colleghi del team.




Sei tu la persona giusta?

Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.




In più è fantastico se…

> ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;

> excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;

> hai una conoscenza base di SQL e PowerBI

> ti entusiasma lavorare in team;

> sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!




Altre informazioni

Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.

Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

Title: Digital Innovation & Data Analytics Specialist
Description:
WHAT WILL YOU DO?




Nel nostro team Digital Innovation & Data Analytics sarai coinvolto attivamente nel processo di innovazione digitale all'interno della nostra azienda, contribuendo alla trasformazione dei processi aziendali attraverso l'uso di metodologie di analisi di dati.




Opererai a stretto contatto con il management e le diverse funzioni interne per identificare opportunità di miglioramento e sviluppare soluzioni che ottimizzino l'efficienza operativa.




Parteciperai a progetti sfidanti, che ti permetteranno di seguire ogni fase del processo di digitalizzazione, dall'analisi funzionale all'implementazione e al testing delle tecnologie più avanzate, garantendo un impatto significativo sul nostro modo di operare e sui risultati aziendali.




In particolare, ti occuperai di:




creazione di modelli di reportistica e analisi periodica da esporre tramite dashboard in Excel o Power BI
raccolta, integrazione e analisi di dati provenienti da varie fonti e con vari strumenti per identificare pattern, tendenze e insight per creare valore
analisi funzionale e riprogettazione di processi aziendali esistenti, integrando soluzioni informatiche per aumentare l'efficienza e l'efficacia degli stessi
partecipazione attiva a User Acceptance Testing (UAT), facendo sì che le soluzioni implementate rispondano pienamente ai requisiti aziendali e alle aspettative degli utenti interni




YOU ARE THE RIGHT TALENT IF YOU BRING US:

sei laureato/a in Ingegneria Gestionale/Economia o hai un’esperienza analoga
hai una mentalità analitica che ti consente di approcciarti ai dati e alle situazioni in modo critico, identificando soluzioni e prendendo decisioni rapide e consapevoli
hai un'ottima conoscenza del Pacchetto MS Office, in particolare Excel/Power Query
hai una buona conoscenza di Power BI
hai una buona conoscenza del linguaggio SQL
proattività, flessibilità, innovazione, determinazione, organizzazione
sai lavorare in gruppo, collaborare, gestire progetti e compiti complessi




YOU FEEL WELCOMED EVERY DAY BECAUSE:

ti sentirai da subito parte della squadra, supportato nel proporre le tue idee e visioni
respirerai un dinamismo che dà energia, un concetto di collaborazione che fa crescere la professionalità di ognuno e la qualità del team
scoprirai una forma di ambizione che sposta sempre in avanti il punto di arrivo e rende appassionante il percorso per raggiungerlo
apprezzerai il supporto di un People Coach, che ti aiuterà a sviluppare il tuo potenziale e le tue competenze
troverai percorsi di carriera disegnati sulle tue ambizioni e capacità
sperimenterai i benefici della flessibilità e dello smart working




WE ARE QUALITY SEEKERS, CLIENT SUPPORTERS, TEAM BELIEVERS & PASSION PROMOTERS

Ci impegniamo per offrire al paese un modello di crescita sostenibile. Siamo appassionati di consulenza e di revisione ed è proprio la passione che ci ha resi una delle più importanti società mondiali in questo campo. Ci guida una motivazione forte, che si diffonde in ognuna delle nostre sedi in 164 Paesi e che troverai nei nostri 14 uffici in Italia. Amiamo il talento e le idee nuove e cresciamo grazie all’attenzione che riserviamo alla competenza delle persone e alla qualità delle relazioni: quelle all'interno della nostra società e quelle con i clienti e i fornitori.




MAKE YOUR CAREER DEEPLY SIGNIFICANT, JOIN US AND SHARE OUR PURPOSE.

BDO is an Equal Opportunity Employer, il presente annuncio garantisce le pari opportunità.

I candidati con l'invio del loro curriculum autorizzano BDO al trattamento dei dati ai sensi della vigente normativa.

La Società, nella sua qualità di Titolare del trattamento, informa il candidato circa il fatto che l’inoltro della candidatura per la posizione lavorativa di cui al suindicato annuncio costituisce autorizzazione al trattamento dei propri dati personali e, per l’effetto, invita il candidato medesimo a prendere visione dell’informativa sul trattamento dei dati personali ex art. 13 del Reg. UE n. 2016/679, raggiungibile al seguente link: urly.it/3tg7a

Title: Supply Data Analyst - Internship
Description:
Ogury is a global adtech company that delivers Personified Advertising solutions grounded in privacy to brands, agencies and publishers by focusing on targeting personas, not people.

We deliver relevant audiences at scale and on quality publisher inventory thanks to our exclusive data, which is meticulously collected and crafted from millions of self-declared customer surveys, enriched with billions of impactful data points, and refined by AI. This results in audience insights and performance not available through any other AdTech platform.

Founded in 2014, Ogury is a global organization with a diverse team of 500+ people across 17 countries.

At Ogury, our vision unites us all. But we know that it takes people from all walks of life to come together and make it happen. We embrace and celebrate what makes us different, creating a unique and winning culture where everyone feels safe, has access to the same opportunities, and is excited about bringing their most authentic self to work. Everyday.

Together we’re changing the face of adtech with values that inspire excellence, standards that encourage a leadership mindset, and an inclusive workplace where Ogurians are engaged and know they belong.

About The Role

Ogury is seeking a highly motivated Supply Data Analyst Intern to help our efforts towards data analysis. The intern will assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support our business decisions and strategic initiatives. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analysis and work within a dynamic and innovative tech environment.

What You Will Do


Data Collection and Cleaning: Assist in gathering data from multiple sources, including internal databases, spreadsheets, and third-party data systems. Perform data cleaning and preprocessing to ensure data integrity and accuracy. Help maintain data quality and support data management activities.
Data Analysis: Conduct basic statistical analyses and generate reports to identify trends and patterns. Support senior analysts with more complex data analysis tasks. Utilize tools such as Excel, SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Reporting and Visualization: Create data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Metabase as the main tool. Present analytical findings to team members and stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Support and Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. Assist in developing and implementing data collection systems and strategies to optimize data efficiency and quality.
Learning and Development: Stay current with industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analysis. Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance analytical skills and knowledge.


About You


Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Familiarity with Microsoft Excel; knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools such as Metabase is a plus.
Basic understanding of statistical methods and data analysis techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.Good communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with programming languages such as Python.
Understanding of data warehousing concepts and tools.
Experience with big data tools and technologies.

Title: Customer Base Analytics - Senior Manager
Description:
Responsabilità:




Il team di Customer Base Analytics ha un ruolo chiave nell’ambito dell’organizzazione CCO e di Base Management in particolare, in quanto fornisce la base analitica e data driven a tutta l’attività di gestione del parco clienti, assicurando il monitoraggio dei KPI rilevanti e gli strumenti per la segmentazione avanzata dei clienti.




La risorsa sarà responsabile del mondo Analytics per i Ricavi residenziali.

Inoltre, ricopre un ruolo fondamentale di Business Translator, permettendo la necessaria cross-fertilizzazione tra Business e l’ecosistema di Dati e Modelli







Attività principali:




Analisi descrittive e segmentazioni, anche con l’utilizzo di tecniche di Advanced Analytics, per la gestione della customer base e la massimizzazione dei relativi ricavi (ad esempio: stima benefici prodotti, creazione campioni di controllo, segmentazioni, analisi descrittive per generazione di insight, …)Interfaccia e coordinamento tra il Business e la direzione Data Platform&Analytics su use case complessi
Gestione della roadmap su tematiche di dati e use case complessi della direzione Base Management
Supporto alla creazione di una cultura aziendale diffusa data oriented e alla relativa automatizzazione
Presentazione end to end delle analisi e dei relativi insight, con esposizione C-level, vista la rilevanza delle attività e del loro impatto sui risultati di business
Gestione di un team di data analysts







Competenze e Requisiti:




Ottime capacità analitiche, di rappresentazione dei dati e di presentazione degli insight
Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di analisi e di rappresentazione dei dati e dei relativi tool di manipolazione ed estrazione dei dati (SQL/BigQuery GCP) e di visualizzazione (Tableau)
Forte orientamento data driven e quantitativo
La conoscenza delle tecniche di Advanced Analytics costituisce elemento preferenziale
Esperienze pregresse come data analyst costituiscono elemento preferenziale
Ottime capacità relazionali
Proattività e autonomia
Leadership orizzontale e spirito di collaborazione
Capacità organizzative
Positività e capacità di motivazione del team

Show more

  • Gestione di un team di data analysts



Competenze e Requisiti:


  • Ottime capacità analitiche, di rappresentazione dei dati e di presentazione degli insight
  • Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di analisi e di rappresentazione dei dati e dei relativi tool di manipolazione ed estrazione dei dati (SQL/BigQuery GCP) e di visualizzazione (Tableau)
  • Forte orientamento data driven e quantitativo
  • La conoscenza delle tecniche di Advanced Analytics costituisce elemento preferenziale
  • Esperienze pregresse come data analyst costituiscono elemento preferenziale
  • Ottime capacità relazionali
  • Proattività e autonomia
  • Leadership orizzontale e spirito di collaborazione
  • Capacità organizzative
  • Positività e capacità di motivazione del team

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
Stiamo cercando giovani talenti con la passione per i Media, l’Advertising e i Dati da inserire all’interno del team di “Business Intelligence & Insight” di GroupM la unit specializzata nell’elaborazione dei dati, la produzione di reportistiche e analisi di scenario, la scoperta di insight e lo sviluppo di soluzioni esclusive.

L’opportunità di stage prevede un percorso di crescita volto ad acquisire competenze relative al settore pubblicitario e dei media, attraverso il supporto e l’affiancamento in attività che vanno dalla pianificazione strategica alla misurazione delle campagne pubblicitarie.

Nello specifico la figura affiancherà il Digital Research Manager nelle seguenti attività:


Analisi e gestione database per validazione dati, intelligence interna e benchmarking
Elaborazione di reportistiche e presentazioni ad-hoc
Sviluppo di soluzioni proprietarie in ambito di ricerche e pianificazione
Monitoraggio dei trend emergenti legati al mondo della misurazione e delle ricerche
Supporto alle agenzie media nelle attività quotidiane (pianificazione strategica e consulenza)


REQUISITI


Laurea in discipline Economiche o Statistiche;
Passione per il mercato pubblicitario, i media, le ricerche e i sistemi di misurazione;
Forti competenze analitiche/numeriche e particolare attenzione ai dettagli;
Ottima capacità di gestione e utilizzo dei principali sistemi informatici, in particolare del pacchetto Office (Excel e PowerPoint);
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese.


LOCATION

Campus WPP Milano ((con possibilità di smart working per qualche giorno)

Siamo orgogliosi di avere un team composto da persone con background, esperienze e identità diverse. Crediamo che questa diversità sia un punto di forza. Questa posizione è dedicata anche alle persone appartenenti alle Categorie Protette ex l. 68/99


Show more

Title: BUSINESS DATA ANALYST
Description:
Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una persona da inserire come Business Data Analyst all’interno della struttura Energy Balance della Business Unit Mercato. 

La struttura si occupa dell’elaborazione delle chiusure gestionali mensili per determinare il gross margin Energia Elettrica e Gas di A2A Energia suddiviso per mercato e cluster (Grandi, PMI, Mass Market). Predispone i tracciati contabili e gestionali nonché la reportistica periodica per il management e monitoring dei KPI, analisi degli scostamenti tra consuntivo, budget e periodi precedenti.

Fornisce supporto a Vendite Grandi Clienti e Fatturazione per il calcolo relativo a contratti complessi (allocazione della produzione derivante da impianti a fonti rinnovabili non programmabili, gestione di bande orarie di importazione dall’estero, formule di indicizzazione oraria, ecc.) mediante lo sviluppo interno di algoritmi proprietari che si adattino alle richieste del cliente.

Gestisce le estrazioni e la preparazione dei dati funzionali alle dichiarazioni periodiche richieste dalla CSEA (Cassa per i Servizi Energetici e Ambientali).

Per quale società

L’inserimento avverrà in A2A Energia S.p.A. per le attività di Energy Balance della Business Unit Mercato che è finalizzata alla vendita al dettaglio di energia elettrica e di gas naturale ai clienti del mercato libero e alla commercializzazione ai clienti serviti in regime di tutela. Inoltre, si occupa di fornire servizi di efficienza energetica e di mobilità elettrica.

Ti occuperai di


Contribuire a definire le caratteristiche funzionali e tecniche dei prodotti, con i responsabili commerciali di riferimento e con i fornitori di servizi digitali;
Calcolare il valore economico della spesa per la materia prima per i grandi clienti con contratti complessi mediante lo sviluppo, se necessario, di appositi algoritmi informatici;
Elaborare grandi moli di dati relative ai consumi energetici orari, al fine di verificare la presenza di outliers, assenza di record, formati non conformi, integrità dei dati, ecc.;
Ricostruire/aggregare curve orarie di consumo secondo gli algoritmi definiti contrattualmente;
Creare e manutenere gli allegati di dettaglio secondo i formati richiesti dai clienti;
Predisporre la reportistica periodica ed eseguire analisi a supporto del management aziendale.


Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo


Laurea Magistrale in discipline informatiche, economico-statistiche o ingegneristiche
Competenze analitiche nella lavorazione ed interpretazione dei dati
Conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione quali a titolo esemplificativo R, Python, SQL
Conoscenza del pacchetto Office (Excel/Access)
Capacità di lettura e comprensione di documentazione contrattuale
Rappresenta un plus l’esperienza pregressa di 1-2 anni nel campo dell’analisi dati in aziende del settore Energy/Utility, TLC o in aziende di consulenza per clienti finali in questi settori
Rappresenta un plus la conoscenza degli applicativi Qlik View, Qlik Sense, Google Cloud Platform
Show more

Title: DATA ANALYST
HTML:
Synergie Italia SPA, filiale di Milano Cadorna, ricerca per azienda operante nel settore INFRASTRUTTURE un profilo da inserire come DATA ANALYST per la sede aziendale di Milano Sud.

Posizione:

La risorsa, inserita nella Direzione Esercizio e lavorando in sinergia con i colleghi, dovrà occuparsi della gestione economica dei contratti, della reportistica, del monitoraggio dei costi d’esercizio nonché dell’implementazione di una reportistica intradirezionale.

In particolare il profilo sarà coinvolto nelle seguenti attività:

  • Predisposizione di analisi, report e relazioni volte a monitorare l’andamento delle direzioni in capo alla Direzione Operations;
  • Predisposizione dei budget forecast e consuntivi periodici della direzione di riferimento;
  • Analisi delle performance della rete in concessione con i target fissati dal budget aziendale, per operare delle azioni correttive necessarie per il raggiungimento degli obiettivi prefissati;
  • Partecipazione a progetti a forte impatto innovativo di natura trasversale all’azienda e di interesse della Direzione.

Requisiti:

Per il ruolo stiamo cercando candidati in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:

  • Laurea Magistrale in Discipline Economiche, Statistiche o in Ingegneria Gestionale;
  • Esperienza pregressa nella mansione, maturata in realtà strutturate;
  • Ottima conoscenza MS office, con particolare riferimento ad Excel;
  • Dimestichezza con le analisi statistiche;
  • Propensione al lavoro per obiettivi, con scadenze ravvicinate, e al lavoro di squadra.

Altre informazioni:

Luogo di lavoro: Milano Sud

Orari di lavoro: Full Time 40H da Lunedì a Venerdì

Inserimento diretto in azienda a tempo indeterminato. Inquadramento e retribuzione saranno commisurati alle effettive capacità ed esperienze del/della candidato/a.

 L'offerta è rivolta a candidatə nel rispetto del Dlgs 198/2006 e dei Dlgs 215/2003 e 216/2003.

 Le persone interessate sono invitate a leggere l'informativa privacy ex artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. UE 2016/679.

 Aut. Min. Prot. N. 1207 – SG del 16/12/2004

Title: Junior Digital Analyst
HTML:
A proposito di fifty-five: 

fifty-five è una data-company di un nuovo genere che aiuta i brand a sfruttare i dati per migliorare il marketing, i media e l'esperienza del cliente grazie a una combinazione di servizi di consulenza e tecnologia specializzata, pilastro del Brandtech Group nel settore data e marketing, propone un'ampia gamma di servizi che fondono consulenza strategica, services cloud, expertise media e miglioramento della customer experience.

fifty-five conta più di 400 esperti digitali. Consulenti digitali, specialisti di tracking e media, ingegneri e data scientist lavorano in sinergia per fornire consulenze di marketing di alto livello e assistenza tecnica ai brand in tutti i settori, in tutto il mondo.

Come partner fidato degli inserzionisti nella gestione dei dati per la loro raccolta, attivazione e valorizzazione,  supportiamo le organizzazioni nel divenire realtà omnicanale efficaci attraverso la gestione dell'ecosistema digitale e l'integrazione con il mondo fisico.

Con sede a Parigi, operiamo su 3 fusi orari dai nostri 10 uffici situati a Parigi, Londra, Ginevra, Milano, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore e New York. Fifty-five attribuisce particolare importanza al benessere dei suoi collaboratori.

Contesto: 

Dopo una fase di onboarding approfondito nel nostro ufficio di Milano, utilizzerete la vostra expertise delle soluzioni di web analytics e dei tag management systems (TMS) per svolgere varie mansioni per i nostri clienti.

Mansioni: 

In qualità di Junior Digital Analyst, farete leva sulla vostra padronanza tecnica delle soluzioni di web analytics e dei tag manager (TMS) per svolgere varie mansioni per i nostri clienti.

Il vostro ruolo sarà di: 

  • Implementazione tecnica delle soluzioni tracking dei siti web/mobile o app del cliente, dalla raccolta delle esigenze alla raccolta effettiva dei dati di cui garantirete qualità e affidabilità; 
  • Gestire i progetti a contatto con il cliente (garantendo l'avanzamento delle missioni, pianificazione, strategia di test, consegne) sulle problematiche di raccolta dati Analytics e Media; 
  • Condividere le vostre conoscenze e competenze con i clienti e internamente; 
  • Mantenere un collegamento permanente con i diversi attori lato cliente/integratore;
  • Sviluppare un know-how operativo dettagliato (TMS & Analytics); 
  • Sviluppare nuove opportunità di business in collaborazione con i consulenti responsabili del conto; 
  • Partecipare alla definizione dei prodotti e degli strumenti interni dell'azienda; 
  • Partecipare alla concezione e al posizionamento dell'offerta tecnologica di fifty-five.


Profilo ricercato: 

Laureato/a in discipline STEM o economia , con 1 o 2 anni di esperienza nella gestione di progetti di Tracking / Misurazione / Web Analytics.

Competenze: 

  • Esperienza nella gestione progetti interfacciandosi con team digitali ed IT;
  • Conoscenza dei principali strumenti di web analytics  (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, AT Internet...); Tag Management System (GTM, Launch, Tealium, Commanders Act, ...)
  • Conoscenze di JavaScript (comprensione e sviluppo di logiche semplici) e Web in generale; 
  • Forte spirito analitico; 
  • Eccellente comunicazione orale e scritta; 
  • Grande passione per le tecnologie e il settore di internet; 
  • Competenze in ambiente mobile sono un plus; 
  • Conoscenze del funzionamento dei CMP sono un plus; 
  • Buona capacità di proporre soluzioni perfettamente in linea con le esigenze; 
  • Buon livello sia di italiano che di inglese.

I vantaggi di lavorare in fifty-five: 

  • Politica di smart working;
  • Particolare attenzione all'equilibrio vita privata / vita professionale nel rispetto del diritto alla disconnessione; 
  • Un ambiente multiculturale con collaboratori di oltre 20 nazionalità diverse; 
  • Valori interni incentrati sull'eccellenza, la benevolenza e la condivisione;
  • Formazione continua (e riconosciuta) sull'ecosistema, le tecnologie digitali e sulle soft skills (es: public speaking, gestione del team ecc.);
  • Possibilità di partecipare a progetti interni come Data Hive (un progetto "tech for good" promosso dai dipendenti di fifty-five, il cui scopo è mettere le loro conoscenze e competenze a disposizione di organizzazioni benefiche), DEI@55 (un gruppo di lavoro sui temi della diversità e dell'inclusione all'interno di fifty-five e della tecnologia più in generale), Sustainability@55 (un team che aiuta a implementare pratiche sostenibili internamente e presso i nostri clienti).

In fifty-five, siamo convinti che la diversità e l'inclusione siano vere forze. Ci impegniamo a garantire parità di trattamento di tutte le candidature ricevute, senza distinzione di genere, età, origine, orientamento sessuale, stato di salute o opinione politica o religiosa. Incontra il team di fifty-five!

Localizzazione: Corso Giacomo Matteotti 1, CAP 20121 Milano

Tipo di contratto: Contratto di lavoro a tempo pieno e indeterminato

Salario: in base all'esperienza

Title: Data Analyst in Marketing (Relocation to Tallinn)
Description:
As a Data Analyst in a Marketing team, you’ll play a central role in Bolts Global's marketing operations - helping us decide where we focus our time and money.




If you are passionate about data analysis, A/B testing, and impacting the way decisions are made that affect millions of customers and millions of euros in marketing spend - you’ll be at the right place in Bolt!




About the role

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Marketing team, you’ll ensure we’re making the best decisions. You’ll work closely with our teams to measure the impact of millions of euros spent on advertising brand campaigns, to identify the marketing communications that have the highest performance, and to recommend to our global and local teams serving the 30+ countries the best ways to spend their time and budgets.




In your job, you’ll be working closely with our marketing and business management teams as well as our industry partners (Google, Meta, TikTok, etc.)




Your daily adventures will include:

Conduct in-depth analysis of marketing investments to recommend the optimal budget allocations between channels, markets, and specific campaigns - following the existing frameworks.
Collaborate with marketing specialists and managers to design and analyze A/B tests for marketing communications initiatives with minimal supervision
Provide data-driven insights and recommendations to the marketing teams and leadership supporting day-to-day operations, business reviews and strategic decision-making
Support the stakeholders with ad-hoc analysis and bring visibility by building dashboards and reports.




About you:

Bachelors/Master’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics or Business
At least 2 years of experience dealing with large volumes of data
Outstanding SQL skills and a solid grasp of Python/R for data analysis
Fluent with at least one of the BI tools (Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, Qlik, DataStudio, Metabase, etc) and data visualization in general
Good understanding of statistics for A/B testing and experimentation
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations
Fluent in English
Extra bonus, but not required - experience with marketing and consumer analytics, marketing mix modeling, and/or Bayesian statistics




Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!




Why you’ll love it here:

Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 500+ cities across 45 countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.




*Some perks may differ depending on your location.

Title: Digital Analytics Consultant - Milan
Description:
About the Company

Rapid shifts in technology have dramatically changed the way people interact and engage with brands. fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands leverage data to improve marketing, media, and customer experience through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.

As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +400 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York.

About the Role

We are looking for a Digital Analytics Consultant to join our new Milan-based consulting team. This is a varied role which spans across website architecture, UX analysis, media advisory and digital strategy. As a Consultant at 55, you will be working on marketing analytics and marketing activations as opposed to setting up and optimising campaigns, so we therefore are seeking applicants with some prior experience in marketing or web analytics.

Working as part of a small, collaborative team, you will play a key role in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple, big brand clients across industries such as luxury, automotive, retail and beauty. These projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation and media-mix optimisation and you will be required to promote a customer-centric vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions.

You will report to the Head of office and work alongside other Consultants and technical experts such as Tracking Specialists, Cloud Engineers and Innovation Experts. Led by the Senior Consultant, you will contribute to the timely & professional delivery of our projects. Examples of the sort of project work you will be part of delivering within the first year of your role include but are not limited to; the creation and monitoring of complex dashboards aimed at aggregating findings from numerous data sources; the evaluation of client's existing marketing channel mix and the recommendation of the most suitable attribution model; the implementation of cookie consent management solutions to obtain users consent for data collection, martech audience review and architecture recommendation. This is an exciting, hands-on role within a company that puts collaboration and knowledge sharing at the heart of everything we do.

Responsibilities

Within your first year at fifty-five, you will be taking on the following core tasks and responsibilities, amongst others:

Delivering high quality outcomes for a variety of projects in the Ad Tech and Web Analytics space, working in a client-facing position, supported by a team of technical specialists
Meeting client's requirements within the agreed deadlines, keeping track of the necessary tasks for each project and liaising with the relevant owners internally and externally; foreseeing and escalating issues / risks as appropriate
Developing a sharp, operational expertise regarding web analytics and media-buy topics

Progressing in your journey at fifty-five, you will be given the opportunity to grow in your role through first-hand exposure to multiple disciplines and, if interested, you might be selected to take a specialist path.


Our Ideal Candidate

Educated to degree level
Approximately 1 year of experience in web / marketing analytics (preferably as a business analyst/ data analyst/ marketing analyst, or with experience in paid media buying)
Familiarity with the Google stack
Analytical mindset, keen to apply data to challenges
Detail oriented, proactive and self-motivated, good organisation is paramount
A confident presenter
Curious and eager to learn, able to challenge and recommend solutions to problems
Flexible, versatile and works well under pressure
Collaborative, works well in a team, understands that the sum of our parts is better than the individual
Strong interest in new marketing technologies & the digital industry
Interest in working in a small, growing team

If this sounds like you, please get in touch! We look forward to meeting you.

In return, we are pleased to offer you the following benefits:

Being part of a multicultural, dynamic and fast-growing team
Continuous (and certified) training on the digital ecosystem and technologies (initial training for all new employees, followed by recurring training sessions)
Phone allowance
The flexibility to work remotely for part of the week - this will continue post Covid
UnMind App subscription

fifty-five encourages diversity and is committed to guaranteeing equal treatment of all applications, regardless of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, state of health or political or religious opinion.

As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +400 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York.

About the Role

We are looking for a Digital Analytics Consultant to join our new Milan-based consulting team. This is a varied role which spans across website architecture, UX analysis, media advisory and digital strategy. As a Consultant at 55, you will be working on marketing analytics and marketing activations as opposed to setting up and optimising campaigns, so we therefore are seeking applicants with some prior experience in marketing or web analytics.

Working as part of a small, collaborative team, you will play a key role in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple, big brand clients across industries such as luxury, automotive, retail and beauty. These projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation and media-mix optimisation and you will be required to promote a customer-centric vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions.

You will report to the Head of office and work alongside other Consultants and technical experts such as Tracking Specialists, Cloud Engineers and Innovation Experts. Led by the Senior Consultant, you will contribute to the timely & professional delivery of our projects. Examples of the sort of project work you will be part of delivering within the first year of your role include but are not limited to; the creation and monitoring of complex dashboards aimed at aggregating findings from numerous data sources; the evaluation of client's existing marketing channel mix and the recommendation of the most suitable attribution model; the implementation of cookie consent management solutions to obtain users consent for data collection, martech audience review and architecture recommendation. This is an exciting, hands-on role within a company that puts collaboration and knowledge sharing at the heart of everything we do.

Responsibilities

Within your first year at fifty-five, you will be taking on the following core tasks and responsibilities, amongst others:

  • Delivering high quality outcomes for a variety of projects in the Ad Tech and Web Analytics space, working in a client-facing position, supported by a team of technical specialists
  • Meeting client's requirements within the agreed deadlines, keeping track of the necessary tasks for each project and liaising with the relevant owners internally and externally; foreseeing and escalating issues / risks as appropriate
  • Developing a sharp, operational expertise regarding web analytics and media-buy topics

Progressing in your journey at fifty-five, you will be given the opportunity to grow in your role through first-hand exposure to multiple disciplines and, if interested, you might be selected to take a specialist path.

Our Ideal Candidate

  • Educated to degree level
  • Approximately 1 year of experience in web / marketing analytics (preferably as a business analyst/ data analyst/ marketing analyst, or with experience in paid media buying)
  • Familiarity with the Google stack
  • Analytical mindset, keen to apply data to challenges
  • Detail oriented, proactive and self-motivated, good organisation is paramount
  • A confident presenter
  • Curious and eager to learn, able to challenge and recommend solutions to problems
  • Flexible, versatile and works well under pressure
  • Collaborative, works well in a team, understands that the sum of our parts is better than the individual
  • Strong interest in new marketing technologies & the digital industry
  • Interest in working in a small, growing team

If this sounds like you, please get in touch! We look forward to meeting you.

In return, we are pleased to offer you the following benefits:

  • Being part of a multicultural, dynamic and fast-growing team
  • Continuous (and certified) training on the digital ecosystem and technologies (initial training for all new employees, followed by recurring training sessions)
  • Phone allowance
  • The flexibility to work remotely for part of the week - this will continue post Covid
  • UnMind App subscription

fifty-five encourages diversity and is committed to guaranteeing equal treatment of all applications, regardless of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, state of health or political or religious opinion.

Title: Data Engineer – Data Platform & Analytics
Description:
As a member of the Data Platform & Analytics you will developing the best of breed big data analytics platform for Sky. You are never satisfied with a good enough solution, but you are always looking on better ways to solve problems, providing a world class data infrastructure and services.

You will work on complex, challenging and exciting enterprise-level data solutions/programmes which needs to be solved with simple and high quality solutions.




Main responsibilities include:

- Contribute to the overall system design/architecture and implementation, understanding requirements and problems to be solved and translating these into data engineering solutions.

- Develop and maintain the data flows, ingesting raw data from different sources or data platforms, transforming it through a set of tools into intuitive data models, KPI and allowing to act on this data.

- Help to foster innovation and good engineering practices (testing, continuous integration/delivery, pair programming, software design patterns, …)




Requirements:

- Excellent problem solving skills, creative and entrepreneurial

- Experience designing highly available, scalable and distributed end to end data flows

- Strong experience in the whole software development lifecycle, including code versioning systems (Git) and CI/CD

- Experience with OO programming (Scala, Java, Python, C++, …)

- Experience with relational databases (Oracle, MySQL, Postgres, …)

- Experience with scripting languages (Bash, Perl, Python, Ruby, …)

- Experience with “Big Data” technologies on Google Cloud, Amazon Web Services or Azure

Experience with Big Data platforms and engines (Apache Hadoop, Apache Kafka, Apache Spark,

- Computer science or technically related degree

- Professional knowledge of English language, written and spoken




Soft Skills:

- Able to work in a fast paced environment

- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Insurance
Description:
Sono attualmente alla ricerca, per un importantissimo gruppo Bancario e Assicurativo, di un Business Intelligence Analyst, il quale parteciperà alla definizione e gestione di progetti di integrazione e sviluppo.

Si ricercano i seguenti requisiti:


Esperienza di almeno 2/3 anni in ambito Business Intelligence (back end - front end);
Uso must have di Power BI, SQL.
Conoscenza di processi dei business, capacità di lavorare per obiettivi, time management, alta capacità di problem solving e buona resistenza allo stress.

Title: Data Science Internship
Description:
Skill Farm Experts Are Invited to Apply for the Following Role:

Responsibilities:

' Perform primary data analysis of our data.

' Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise, analyse, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

' Work with the team to improve data quality and data governance.

' Apply a mixture of qualitative and quantitative analysis techniques to produce business insights that improves customer experience and product offerings.

' Present findings to business owners and stakeholder.

' Translate business questions into data resolutions and stories for non-technical stakeholders.

Skills:

' Background studies in Data Analysis, Data Science, Statistics or similar roles

' Strong knowledge of and experience in (academic experience or internship) reporting packages (such as Tableau, Qlik etc), databases (SQL), programming (such as R, Python etc)

' Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyse datasets (using Excel, SPSS, SAS, R or Python etc)

' Technical expertise such as data models, data mining and segmentation techniques are desirable

' Precise, a keen eye for detail and for numbers

' A willingness to learn & upskill constantly, curious by nature

' Strong team player with a solution focused attitude

' Great opportunity to be a part of global organisation

' Our Analytics team is very ambitious, the analytics needs will very soon be transitioning to advanced analytics. So, there is a great opportunity to transition to Data Scientist role.

Title: Junior Data Engineer - Internship
Description:
Stiamo cercando un Junior Data Engineer per un'opportunità di stage. In questa posizione, lavorerai a stretto contatto con colleghi esperti per sviluppare e mantenere soluzioni di gestione dei dati, supportando la creazione di pipeline di dati efficienti e scalabili. Farai esperienza pratica nel campo dell'ingegneria dei dati, con la possibilità di imparare e crescere in un ambiente di lavoro stimolante.




Chi siamo?

🟢Siamo BID Company, una società di consulenza giovane e innovativa in ambito Advanced Analytics e Intelligenza Artificiale. Abilitiamo decisioni trasformando i dati in informazioni di valore attraverso il talento delle persone e l’utilizzo dell’AI.

Grazie alle competenze tecnologiche e statistiche, all'esperienza e alla conoscenza del mercato mettiamo a disposizione soluzioni innovative per aiutare i nostri clienti a vincere le sfide di business.




🕵🏻Chi stiamo cercando?

Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Matematica, Statistica o campi affini (o in fase di completamento).
Conoscenza di base dei linguaggi di programmazione (Python, Java, SQL).
Familiarità con i concetti di database relazionali e non relazionali.
Capacità di analisi e problem-solving.
Buone doti comunicative e capacità di lavorare in team.
Voglia di imparare e passione per il mondo dei dati.




🚀Nice to have

Conoscenza anche basilare del linguaggio SAS




💻Di che cosa ti occuperai?

Collaborare con il team per progettare e sviluppare pipeline di dati ETL
Supportare la manutenzione e l'ottimizzazione dei database aziendali.
Assistere nella gestione e nella pulizia dei dati per garantirne la qualità e l'integrità.
Contribuire all'implementazione di soluzioni di data warehousing.
Partecipare a progetti di analisi dei dati e fornire supporto tecnico per le decisioni aziendali basate sui dati.




✨Che cosa aspettarti?

Farai parte di un gruppo multidisciplinare di persone, con persone esperte che ti aiuteranno durante il tuo percorso professionale;
Intraprenderai un percorso di crescita personale, apprendendo concetti e nozioni di diverse tematiche e ambiti;
Avrai l'opportunità di lavorare in progetti sfidanti e creativi, in modo trasversale su diverse industry;
Troverai un ambiente simil startup, che dà molta attenzione al bilanciamento tra vita lavorativa e personale, con la possibilità di lavoro in smart working.




La sede di lavoro è Milano.




Siamo un'azienda meritocratica, diamo pari opportunità e apprezziamo la diversità. Non discriminiamo in base a etnia, colore, nazionalità di provenienza, sesso, orientamento sessuale, età, stato civile, o disabilità.




BID Company tratta i dati nel rispetto della normativa GDPR.

Candidandoti all’offerta di lavoro dichiari di aver preso visione all’informativa sulla privacy (https://bidcompany.it/informativa-sulla-privacy/)
