Title: Salesforce Data Analyst
HTML:
Brainfield Italia


Per importante società cliente operante nell’organizzazione di eventi fieristici internazionali per il settore beauty e cosmesi, stiamo attualmente ricercando un/una


Salesforce Data Analyst



Principali responsabilità


Riportando al Responsabile IT, il candidato si occuperà di:


  • Gestire l’importazione, esportazione e manipolazione dei dati all’interno di Salesforce tramite moduli come Data Loader, Data Inspector e, opzionalmente, Workbench;
  • Utilizzare quotidianamente SQL per l’analisi e la gestione di grandi volumi di dati, assicurando l’integrità e la qualità dei dati presenti nel CRM Salesforce;
  • Supportare i team interni (sales, marketing, amministrazione) nella gestione e ottimizzazione dei dati relativi a clienti e contatti;
  • Collaborare con il team di Marketing Cloud e con l’amministratore di Salesforce per garantire la corretta integrazione dei dati tra i diversi moduli del sistema;
  • Monitorare e risolvere eventuali problematiche relative ai flussi di dati, supportando il processo decisionale attraverso la fornitura di report e analisi dati;
  • Mantenere e migliorare i processi di caricamento dati, garantendo efficienza e precisione nelle operazioni quotidiane.


Caratteristiche professionali:


  • Esperienza consolidata di almeno 2 anni nella gestione di dati all’interno di Salesforce;
  • Ottima conoscenza degli strumenti Salesforce e dei principali strumenti di gestione dati;
  • Competenze avanzate nell’utilizzo di SQL per query e analisi dati;
  • Conoscenza approfondita di Data Loader e Data Inspector (Work Bench rappresenta un plus);
  • Capacità di lavorare in team e di interfacciarsi con diverse funzioni aziendali;
  • Orientamento ai dettagli, precisione e capacità di risolvere problemi in autonomia.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.

Write the next chapter of your ABB story.

This position reports to

Pricing Specialist

Your role and responsibilities

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work closely with sales, marketing and product functions providing data and statistics to support existing and potential products, systems, and/or services strategy. Each day, you will support the implementation, development and maintenance of region statistics (costs, sales, prices, orders, etc.) through big data tools like PowerBI. You will support sales with statistics and scorecard tracking and provide computing expertise to the organization. You will also showcase your expertise by working with the team on new development dashboards.

The work model for the role is:

This role contributes to the Electrification - Installation Products Business Line in Sesto San Giovanni (MI).

You will be mainly accountable for:


Constructing and fitting statistical, machine learning, or optimization models and developing appropriate advanced statistical methods
Designing database systems
Ensuring high-quality analysis and extracting data from sales/financial tools to support KPI tracking
Assisting in the development of statistical analysis tools
Collaborating with internal stakeholders to understand business challenges and develop analytical solutions
Supporting regional teams in the best use of tracking system and monitoring ongoing data quality.
Suggesting improvements concerning statistics creation and maintenance.
Documenting, reviewing and updating all documents on tools and database setup


You will join a dynamic and talented team, where you will be able to thrive.


Qualifications For The Role


Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or similar
Extensive knowledge of Excel, PowerBI - DAX and Power Query. R and Phyton are a plus
You are passionate about data management and structures. Knowledge of costs and profitability KPIs is preferred
You enjoy working in a team and you have a good interpersonal attitude
You are goal-oriented, precise in following procedures and have a problem solving attitude
You are at ease communicating in both Italian and English languages


What's in it for you?


Work in a company with a strong technology legacy and deeply rooted in local communities
Bring your knowledge and expertise, make the difference in technology
Flexibility: we have hybrid work options, make the best out of them!


More about us

ABB Installation Products Division (formerly Thomas&Betts), helps manage the connection, protection and distribution of electrical power from source to socket. The Division’s products are engineered to provide ease of installation and perform in demanding and harsh conditions, helping to ensure safety and continuous operation for utilities, businesses and people around the world. The Commercial Essentials product segment includes electrical junction boxes, commercial fittings, strut and cable tray metal framing systems for commercial and residential construction. The Premier Industrial product segment includes multiple product lines, such as Ty-Rap® cable ties, T&B Liquidtight Systems® protection products, PVC coated and nylon conduit systems, power connection and grounding systems, and cable protection systems of conduits and fittings for harsh and industrial applications. The Division also manufactures solutions for medium-voltage applications used in the utility market under its marquee brands including Elastimold™ reclosers and switchgear, capacitor switches, current limiting fuses, Homac™ distribution connectors, Hi-Tech Valiant™ full-range current limiting fuse for fire mitigation, faulted current indicators and distribution connectors, cable accessories and apparatus with products for overhead and underground distribution. Manufacturing includes made-to-stock and custom-made solutions.

We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

For further info: Davide Lippiello, Talent Partner


92793677

Title: Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.




LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS

You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have an analytical mindset.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.




You get even more bonus points if …

You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER

We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

HTML:
We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.


LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.


YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

  • Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
  • Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
  • Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
  • Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
  • Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
  • Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
  • Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.


YOUR SKILLS

  • You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
  • You have an analytical mindset.
  • You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
  • You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
  • You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.

You get even more bonus points if …

  • You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
  • You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
  • You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.


OUR OFFER

  • Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
  • Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Job Description

We believe that clothes — and how you make them — can make a difference.

Since 1853, we’ve been passionate about innovation to meet people’s needs. We invented the first blue jean. And we reinvented khaki pants. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines for our manufacturing partners. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do.

A company doesn’t last 160 years by standing still. It endures by reinventing itself, striving to delight its consumers, winning in the marketplace, and by remaining true to its values. We employ more than 17,000 people around the world – supporting great brands, including Levi’s®, Dockers® and Denizen®. Our employees are committed to progress, authenticity and collaboration.

We're seeking for a motivated, data-driven Intern to join us at the Analytics team in Brussels for our Merchandising Planning and Inventory Management (MPIM) Department.

About The Job


Being point of contact for analytics and data inquiries
Creating data pipelines, dashboards and reports for use across Europe’s business
Cooperating with cross-functional partners to reach resolutions on data topics and build data products
Performing data wrangling and exploration in support of predictive modelling
Providing assistance to the extended team


About You


You have excellent analytical and communication/presentation skills
You hold a Degree in Statistics / Mathematics / Engineering / Operational research / Econometrics
You have knowledge in SQL and/or R/Python
Self-motivated, problem solver, team player
Organized with meticulous attention to detail, ability to prioritize work to meet deadlines
You are flexible and able to perform in a fast-paced environment
Comfortable learning new tools. (Dataiku, Tableau, Excel, SAS etc.)


Start date: Asap for 6 months renewable.

What We Offer


Great work experience in an international, energetic and fun environment
Great opportunity to work for the world’s number one denim brand
Great compensation


LOCATION

Zaventem, Belgium

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My retail client within the fashion e-commerce sector in Brussels are looking for an experienced data analyst to join their team. The team work on a variety of business problems ranging from sales, supply chain and planning, so there is lots of scope to grow within the business!




Responsibilities:




- Collecting and interpreting data from multiple sources, both internal and external.

- Cleaning and validating data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and reliability.

- Analyzing complex datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools.

- Developing and maintaining databases, data systems, and dashboards for reporting purposes.

- Identifying trends, patterns, and correlations in data sets to support business objectives.

- Creating comprehensive reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.




Requirements:




• Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (data science, computer science, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

• Strong SQL skills

• Knowledge of GCP and BigQuery is a plus

• Excellent Python skills

• Experience with data visualisation is a plus




Salary Package:




• Up to €75,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance

• Hybrid working and flexible working hours

• Annual bonus. (depending on the company performance)

• Meal vouchers.




You can reach me on the following:




Email: joe.woodard@vividresourcing.com

Phone: +31203997864

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - 6 months contract - Remote - Pharma




Our Client - Global Pharma company is looking for a Data Analyst to support data standardization, KPI monitoring, and process improvement efforts across the global teams. In this role, you will collaborate with senior analysts, business stakeholders, and technical teams to manage user acceptance testing (UAT), analyze key performance indicators (KPIs), and contribute to the design of business reports. The ideal candidate will be detail-oriented with a foundational understanding of data analytics, strong communication skills, and a desire to learn and grow within a dynamic environment.




Key Responsibilities:




Understanding business requirements to ensure alignment with global data standards.
Assist in defining and executing UAT processes for KPI data analytics tools.
Help manage ticketing systems, identifying issues, logging evidence, and communicating findings to the analytics team and relevant stakeholders.
Assist in monitoring and analyzing market KPIs and targets on a regular basis.
Support senior team members in gathering and preparing KPI data for reporting purposes.
Contribute to monthly performance reviews by providing accurate and timely KPI insights.
Creation of user-friendly training materials and playbooks to assist global markets in adopting data tools and processes.
Participate in conducting training sessions and providing ongoing support to users to ensure understanding of data tools and adherence to established processes.
Design and enhancement of reports using tools like Power BI, Snowflake, and other data platforms.
UAT process for the Snowflake migration, ensuring smooth transitions and minimal disruption to data processes.
Collaborate with team members to validate data accuracy and integrity during the migration.




Qualifications:




2 - 3 years of experience in data analysis, business analysis, or a related role.
Data analysis and reporting tools such as Power BI, Snowflake, or similar platforms.
Understanding of data standardization practices and KPI tracking.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on attention to detail.
Ability to work well in a team environment, with strong communication and organizational skills.




Preferred Skills:




Some experience with UAT management or participation in testing and troubleshooting activities.
Experience in supporting training or developing user materials is a plus.
Knowledge of basic SQL, Excel, or other data querying tools is a plus.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

And Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues :-)




WHAT IS A DATA ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Benjamin, Data Analyst, you participate in the construction of the data strategy of our clients. You have a key role by helping them to deliver valuable insight based on their data. You are part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team.




YOUR TASKS :

You understand the business request
You dive into a large amount of data :
Collecting and interpreting data
Analyzing results
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets
Producing strategic data analysis and reporting to the business
You contribute to the selection and implementation of the different data analysis tools
In the end, you help the business to optimize the use of their data




HOW WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT:

You have at least 1-year experience in data analysis
You are passionate about data and you bring out concrete analysis to help the business
You are used to work with different data tools such as SQL, SAS, Python, R, Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI, …
You have an analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
You pay attention to details
You are fluent in French and English; good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOR?

A broad diversity of career options, you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with and experiment every day




We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nexeo is currently looking for a Data Analyst (Freelance or permanent) for a market leader in the banking industry in Belgium.




Nexeo Belgium is a consultancy company that supports its clients in the banking, finance and insurance sectors in all phases of their transformation projects: from business consulting to the implementation of IT solutions. 




As a consultant you will have the opportunity to be part of Nexeo:

International environment ( Offices in France, Belgium, Luxembourg, Switzerland & Canada)
+ 450 employees
over 20% growth each year




The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. 

 

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that the bank faces
Performs cleansing of data quality issues through the analysi
Monitors the data quality based on data quality dashboards, supports redesign & upgrade
Contributes to designing, monitoring and reporting on common reference tools
Contributes to raising awareness of the importance of data quality
Will be involved in all the topics related to Customer Data
Business Analysis
Work in collaboration with other technical teams to share data
Data extraction with SAS
Industrialize the process to run define periodicity
Document the project (functional and technical part)
Contribute to the achievement of the team objectives




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree
At least 3 years of experience in Data Analysis (focus data quality & data governance)
Understand data lifecycle and data usage
Working in Agile environnement (Jira & Scrum)
Good experience working with SQL Queries & SAS
English Fluent & French or Dutch native

Title: Junior Data Analyst | MySQL & PowerBI (1y contract | Remote)
HTML:
iubenda is a legal-tech scale-up founded in 2011, now trusted by over 110K clients in the EU, the US, and 100+ more Countries. We are leaders in our industry and operate on a global scale developing and releasing innovative tech solutions.
Our mission is to provide our clients with everything their business needs - to be compliant with legal, local, and regional requirements; so that they can focus on their core product. Recently, we have undertaken a new thrilling adventure, joining forces with team.blue (a worldwide leader in digital enablement). If you're excited to work at a company in a scaling-up environment providing SaaS solutions to ~1M users - and equally important - to join a team of friendly people with a culture based on continuous learning, transparency, and collaboration. Then, you're looking at the right place!

Your mission

We're looking for an enthusiastic Junior Data Analyst to join our Finance Team and be responsible for providing support in business KPIs optimization, and systems reconciliation. Will be in charge of:

  • Collection and analyses of data coming from different systems (i.e., data warehouse, databases, and web apps);
  • Drafting reports, presentations, and business analyses related also, but not only, to web analytics services through BI tools;
  • Taking care of churn and retention analysis, funnel optimization, A/B testing, customer scoring, and predictive modeling;
  • Interacting with different teams, especially the Software Development and Accounting ones.

Requirements


  • At least 1 year of experience in a similar role;
  • Sound knowledge of MySQL;
  • Sound knowledge of PowerBI or Tableau (aimed at creating and managing dashboards);
  • Good Excel skills (i.e., complex formulas and visual charts);
  • Familiarity with general economics concepts;
  • Full professional proficiency in English.

Added values


  • Familiarity with statistics, predictive models, and AI tools (such as ChatGPT, Gemini, etc.);
  • Sound knowledge of Python language (aimed at MySQL connections, CSV imports, connections with external sources, data processing, and data visualization);
  • Good knowledge of marketing tools such as Heap.io, Funnel.io, or similar (aimed at extracting data and creating and managing dashboards);
  • Proactive and willing to provide ideas and propose improvements;
  • Previous experience in a SaaS company.

Location

At iubenda we believe in full-remote. Accordingly, you will be completely free and entitled to work from wherever you prefer in the world. At the same time in case you prefer to work from an office, at your disposal you have our Italian (Milan and Bologna) and German (Berlin and Hamburg) offices, to allow you to follow a hybrid work model.

Benefits

REMOTE WORK - You can work 100% remotely or if you prefer, from one of our beautiful offices in Italy (Bologna and Milan), and Germany (Hamburg). We are used and fully structured to onboard people who prefer to work full-time remotely.
TRAVEL ALLOWANCE TO VISIT A COLLEAGUE - We'll provide you with a budget so that you can spend time with your teammates based on the other side of the world;
COMPANY RETREATS AND COWORKING GATHERINGS - Once a year, we get together in amazing destinations to work, bond, and enjoy team-building activities. We offer fully paid week-long gatherings to places like Venice, Sicily, and the Dolomites.
LEARNING BUDGET - We'll sponsor your professional growth by providing a budget for certifications, events, courses, and books;
ENGLISH CLASSES - We offer online English classes weekly, within working hours, and on several different levels. We know there's always room to improve;
WORK EQUIPMENT - We'll provide an equipment allowance so that you can perform at your best;
BRIGHT & COLLABORATIVE WORK ENVIRONMENT - You will be part of a multicultural team of talented and experienced colleagues. Along with that, you will find a team spirit, which you would rarely find elsewhere!
By applying, you hereby declare that you have read and understood our privacy policy (https://www.iubenda.com/privacy-policy/96274994).

Please send your CV in English.
Want to know more about iubenda? Check us out at:
iubenda.com | LinkedIn | Facebook |Twitter

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A leading financial institution is undergoing a digital transformation to deliver user-friendly digital capabilities. As a Data Analyst, you will be pivotal in the Data Delivery function, focusing on Finance, Compliance, and Risk. You will collaborate with Tech Leads, Data Engineers, BI developers, and Product Owners to ensure successful data product deliveries on a hybrid platform using AWS, Informatica, and Oracle technologies.




Key Responsibilities

Perform solution and impact analysis, define implementation and validation approaches.
Analyze data and processes to define functional and technical requirements.
Coordinate with data engineers and source systems for successful integration.
Support testing and validation activities to ensure data quality and compliance.




Competency Profile

Strong understanding of banking processes and experience in managing data requirements.
Proven experience with data analysis, mapping, and SQL for data validation.
Ability to translate business needs into technical requirements and specifications.
Experience working with Data Warehouses, ETL processes, and large-scale data systems.
Familiarity with AWS technologies (S3, Redshift) and cloud-based analytics platforms.
Experience with agile frameworks, preferably SAFe.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a structured and organized approach.

Show more

  • Experience working with Data Warehouses, ETL processes, and large-scale data systems.
  • Familiarity with AWS technologies (S3, Redshift) and cloud-based analytics platforms.
  • Experience with agile frameworks, preferably SAFe.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a structured and organized approach.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

About the European Climate Foundation

The European Climate Foundation (ECF) was founded in 2008 as a major philanthropic initiative to help tackle climate change by fostering the development of a low-carbon society at the national, European, and global level.

We support over 1,000 partner organisations to carry out activities that contribute to the public debate on climate action, drive urgent and ambitious policy in support of the objectives of the Paris Agreement and help deliver a socially responsible transition to a net-zero emissions economy and sustainable society in Europe and around the world.

Position

Context of the role

The ECF, amid significant growth, is transforming its structure, processes, and data management to become a more collaborative and adaptive organisation.

The ECF IT department is empowering the organisation to build digital capabilities and allow ECF to thrive in the digital era. The key capabilities are structured around cross-functional teams tackling key areas - Digital Workplace, Business Applications, Data & Analytics, and Cybersecurity.

The ECF Data Strategy encompasses internal and external data sets from a vast partner ecosystem, aiming to build robust data foundations, for data management, data governance, and innovation.

The ECF Data Team plays a pivotal role in making the ECF more data-driven. Leading the implementation of the Data Strategy, the team works on data architecture, engineering, analytics, and visualization across the organization. The Data Team guides the internal data community to enhance alignment and data literacy throughout ECF.

ECF primarily uses Azure Cloud to host its infrastructure and applications, while also leveraging other technology platforms for innovative data projects.

About The Role

As Data Analyst, you are involved in the capturing and analysis of business needs and translating them to data collections, visualisations and applications. You are responsible for the creation and the continuous improvement of strategic reports and dashboards. You are member of ECF Data Team, reporting to the Data Team Manager.

You are a team player and able to align different stakeholders, in complex environment, and provide a clear path for delivering quality reporting. You support various business stakeholders across ECF programmes & operations to embrace data driven approaches. You have the ability to map business requirements and effectively translate them to data products.

Key Responsibilities

Working closely with ECF business stakeholders (Programmes, Strategic Partnerships, Learning and Impact, Network Analysis Unit, Finance, Grants Management, HR, etc), you are responsible of:

Data engineering


Identify internal data sources (locations/systems/DB) across the organisation, as well as external data sources (open data APIs)
Be able to select relevant data sources (internal and/or external) for each request/dashboard/analysis
Build, maintain, and improve key datasets
Automate and improve the process of data gathering and cleaning
Translate business requirements and match them to processes and data flows



Data analysis


Create reports and prepare (data-driven) recommendations to business stakeholders
Collaborate with relevant stakeholders (business analysts, subject matter experts, data engineers, architects, managers, C-level, etc.) across the organisation to turn data into actionable insights
Engage in statistical analysis to identify trends in datasets and use data visualization to represent these trends.



Change and learning


Support the development of detailed knowledge and documentation about various data sources, within the overall master data management landscape at ECF
Formulate lessons learned and use them as a leverage for the teamwork & projects



Requirements

Experience and competencies


University degree in engineering, economics or statistics
At least 2 years of relevant professional experience
Proven experience with Python, Power BI, SQL, knowledge of DAX and Power Query are required
A first experience with the Azure cloud environment is a strong advantage
Experience with relational databases is an advantage
First experience working with agile methodologies
Attention to details and strong problem solver
Good active listening and communication skills
Written and verbal communications in English, another European language is an asset
Passionate about climate action with a genuine interest in the mission and values of the ECF



Other information

What We Offer


The unique opportunity to work as part of a highly dynamic, international team who combine their passion to make a difference with a rigorous and results-oriented approach to work;
A high level or professionalism and the ability to work on best-in-class processes and systems in an organisation already recognised as an operational reference in the sector;
A flexible work environment and a space to develop and challenge yourself;
A learning organisation based on trust and openness, whichadaptsthe knowledgetransfer to your learning speed
A permanent employment contract



Location

Brussels, Belgium. Only candidates with the right to work in their location will be considered.

Start date

As soon as possible

How To Apply

Please upload your :


CV (in English)
cover letter (in English).



All applications will be treated confidentially. We will store your information in our internal database unless you specifically request otherwise.

Diversitystatement

We are committed to diversity and inclusion in our organisation. We strongly encourage

candidates from disadvantaged or marginalised backgrounds to apply

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🔵 Capitole is still growing and we want to do it with you! 🚀




We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join the Market & Customer Analysis team. You will be instrumental in helping the business gain critical insights from customer data, shaping strategies to better serve our clients. You’ll work closely with internal stakeholders, helping to translate business needs into actionable data-driven solutions. In this role, you will harness your analytical expertise and business knowledge to provide meaningful insights that directly impact customer engagement and business outcomes.




🤖 Responsabilities and Requirements:

Analyze raw data using SAS EG, SQL, and other tools to support business decisions.
Translate business questions into hypotheses and provide data-driven conclusions.
Deliver clear, actionable recommendations through well-structured PowerPoint presentations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure data solutions align with business goals.
Provide data-backed insights that improve customer outcomes and drive business impact.
Maintain project documentation and ensure data integrity in all reports.
Address client data questions with solid evidence, supporting business needs.




🛠️ Technical Requirements:

Strong expertise in SAS EG and SQL for data capture, transformation, and analysis (6+ years required), with advanced Excel skills for data analysis and reporting.
Experienced in setting up ad hoc queries, generating reports, and working with relevant data sources.
Knowledge of Power BI or Tableau for data visualization is preferred.
Fluent in Dutch, French, and English.




🎉 Why Capitole?

🤝 Our employees come first. We believe in a different, more human model, placing people at the center of our company.




📜 Permanent contract or Freelancing
🚗 Company car
🏥 Health Insurance with DKV
🍽️ Meal voucher
🏠💼 Hybrid working: 2-3 days per week at the office. Brussels




Don't know us yet? Discover us!!




Home - Capitole Consulting







Don't hesitate to send us your profile, we are looking forward to meeting you! ☎📩

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance
Work in collaboration with the data engineers to define data models and data points
Light-weight data extraction, transformation, and load from different sources.
Analysis consolidation and Insight sharing, delivering data in a useful and appealing way to all stakeholders
Proactive participation with business to understand, identify data sources, perform analysis and build reports
Be a resource and advocate for data within the organization by teaching and empowering others to use data
Monitoring of the business pulse and extraction of key drivers to business growth.




Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or a related field
3+ Years of professional experience working with Data Analysis, Data Mining, Data Statistics, and other related working experience
Strong in analytics and problem-solving. Proficient in the use of SQL, R, Python, and other data analysis languages, able to extract core results or spot issues from data
Highly analytical mindset and experience in user behavioral research
Experience working with visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau Qlik Sense, or any other
Experience working in an Agile environment
Knowledgeable about performance analysis, experimentations, and statistical tests
Solid interpersonal skills and ability to work in a multicultural environment
Flexibility to grow in a fast-changing team and company
Excellence in presentation, spoken and written skills in English




Plus

Passion for language and education
Additional language skills aside from the required English
Experience working with Cloud computing platforms like AWS, GCP or any other
Experience working with Google Analytics
Experience in the internet industry

Title: Data Analyst - ING LEASE
Description:
Recruiter: Karima Fares

Description - External

About ING Lease Belgium:

ING Lease Belgium is a leading provider of B2B Leasing. We are dedicated to delivering top notch Leasing solutions to our clients with a commitment to innovation, customer service and data-driven decision making. As we continue to grow, we are seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our Data Squad.

As a smaller entity within ING Belgium, we pride ourselves on our agility, collaborative culture and ability to swiftly adapt to market changes.

The Team

The Lease Data Management is a cross-border (BE/NL) squad centered around our (data) customers, powered by technology and driven by smart, determined people.

Position Overview

We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst who will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets to provide insights that drive business decisions and shape our strategic roadmap.

Given our dynamic team and the variety of our challenges, the ideal candidate must be flexible and able to steer multiple data projects simultaneously supporting various domains (sales strategy, commercial performance, operational efficiency, regulatory reporting, …). He/She is a team-oriented individual with a strong analytical background and excellent problem-solving skills. He/she will play a critical role in transforming data into actionable insights that will guide our company’s strategic initiatives and support our long-term goals.

The candidate will receive guidance and support to work independently. He/she has strong communication skills and is able to interact with a variety of stakeholders, such as sales, operations, regulation, developers.

How to succeed?

We hire smart people like you for your potential and your ability to work as team and interact with your stakeholders. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.

Responsibilities


The position is composed of 2 parts:
80% Data Analyst
Collect business requirements from all stakeholders (sales, operations, IT, Product Control, …) using a variety of methods such as interviews, document analysis, workshops,and workflow analysis
Translate requirements into actionable stories for the Data Engineers. Ensure that the requirements are correctly implemented. Communicate effectively with business stakeholders to provide updates on data projects
Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights. Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data to support strategic business decisions. Present findings and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders.
20% Data Stewart:
In support of the CDO – Chief Data Officer - ensure that the GDPR regulations with regards to data are properly implemented
Take responsibility of the reporting towards the regulatory authorities (NBB & ECB) and within ING.

BEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES


Builds partnerships and works collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives. For example, readily involves others to accomplish goals; stays in touch and shares information; discourages "us versus them" thinking; shows appreciation for others' ideas and input.
Plans and prioritizes work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals. For example, outlines clear plans that put actions in a logical sequence; conveys some time frames. Aligns own work with relevant workgroups. Takes some steps to reduce bottlenecks and speed up the work.
Be curious, keep learning and stay eager to embrace innovations. Come with new ideas, look at our products and processes from a different angle and be an innovation ambassador within our organization


Education

master in Economics, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computing Sciences or related fields

Skills


Proficiency in Excel
Fluent in English, fluency in French and/or Dutch is a plus
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex findings in a clear and concise manner
Flexible and able to work on different subjects in different domains
(basic) knowledge of SQL and/or data visualization tools (Power BI, Cognos, Qliksense) is a plus
(basic) knowledge of statistical software (Python) is a plus


Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Qlik
Description:
Le département de Business Intelligence a pour objectif de conseiller/challenger et soutenir les différents acteurs du Groupe Rossel pour améliorer le chiffre d’affaire et les marges, au travers de l’exploitation de l’entièreté de la donnée disponible au sein du Groupe Rossel, tant en Belgique qu’en France.

Collecter, structurer, visualiser avec pour finalité l’analyse et l’interprétation de la donnée, pour améliorer la prise de décision et finalement le chiffre d’affaires et les marges de nos différentes Business Units.

Mission

Sous la responsabilité du Directeur Business Intelligence, vous aurez pour principales missions :

La création de rapport management dans notre environnement QlikSense Proposer différentes vues et reportings afin d’alimenter les différentes Business Units en informations pertinentes à la prise de décision S’assurer de l’uniformité de présentation de l’information aux travers des différents rapports management pour permettre l’analyse et la comparaison entre les différentes business units tant en Belgique qu’en France. Travailler en étroite collaboration avec l’équipe BI et les différents acteurs Business et IT, pour définir les priorités sur les projets à venir. Être force de proposition et d’analyses pour enrichir les réflexions métiers.

Votre Profil

Vous aimez les analyses et interprétations de données et tout le potentiel qui peut en sortir. Vous avez 0 à 3 ans d’expérience. Vous avez un diplôme en gestion, finance, mathématique ou une expérience en analyse des données. Vous avez la volonté de travailler sur des environnements de dashboarding. Vous avez une capacité à travailler en mode projet, avec une approche orientée résultats. Vous travaillez déjà dans Excel. Vous êtes sociable & communicatif. Vous avez un fort esprit d’équipe mais êtes capable de travailler de manière autonome.

Nous cherchons une personne motivée pour se joindre à notre équipe dynamique et motivée.
Show more

Title: Graduate SQL Data Analyst (Belgium/BXL)
Description:
Energetic environment




At Methis Consulting, you will join a young, energetic organisation, where you will have the opportunity to help companies in the energy and mobility sector and with the major challenges related to energy transition and public transport.

Interesting and relevant projects and roles with our clients
Ranging from a few months to several years (always in joint agreement)
Both pure business consulting and projects at the intersection of Business and Digital
Many opportunities to contribute to the further growth of Methis Belgium (e.g. marketing, team, knowledge sharing, development of the internal organisation)
Intensive cross BE-NE cooperation and knowledge sharing




What we are looking for:

Master's degree in a technology-oriented field (ICT, business analytics, AI, engineering, computer science)
Interest in the utilities sector (no experience reuired)
Affinity for technology with an interest in data analysis. Knowledge of SQL is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models, techniques for data mining, and segmentation.
Excellent organizational skills and can manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Perfectly fluent in English, Dutch/French and can express yourself in French/Dutch.




What we offer:

Methis Consulting aims to grow your career, and that includes an attractive package:

Market-based total compensation package
Mobility (company car or mobility budget)
Laptop and telephony




What do we stand for?

Industry Integration and Impact:

Purpose-Driven Roles: at Methis Consulting, you’ll integrate directly into our clients’ teams, bringing your expertise to key initiatives that shape the future of the energy market and public mobility. Your work will have a tangible impact on critical infrastructure and services offered by our clients.
High-Impact Assignments: you’ll work within leading companies, you'll gain first-hand experience with cutting-edge initiatives and technologies.




Professional Growth, Development, and Coaching:

Continuous Skill Enhancement: we are committed to your professional development. Through targeted training programs and access to industry-leading resources, you’ll continuously sharpen your skills and expand your expertise.
Accelerate program: a graduate programme to ensure you’ll get a training tailored to bridge the gap between your academic background and the skills and knowledge required to become a successful, multi-disciplined and impactful professional.
Coaching and Mentorship: our experienced consultants provide personalized coaching and mentorship, helping you navigate your career path, develop your strengths, and achieve your full potential within the consulting industry. We’ll have structure of informal and formal tools (e.g. annual-reviews, mid-year-reviews, walk-meetings) in place to interact with our management on your personal career evolution.
Diverse Assignments and Career Flexibility: with opportunities in business-, functional-, data-analysis, and project management, you’ll have the chance to diversify your experience and grow your skills across different roles, allowing for flexible career growth and exploration.
Personal growth opportunities: Methis Consulting offers you a career within consulting with promotion opportunities based on your experience and growth. There are no limitations in terms promotions slots; when you have the experience and skills to perform at the next level, you will get promoted.




Collaborative Culture & Entrepreneurship:

Collaboration culture: while you’ll complement client teams, Methis Consulting ensures that you remain closely connected to our collaborative and supportive internal culture. You’ll benefit from the collective knowledge and experience of our network of consultants, sharing insights and best practices to deliver great results.
Inclusive Entrepreneurship: we are a growing company whereby you have the opportunity to play an active role in marketing and communication, organizing events, knowledge management, sustainability, etc…...you contribute in function of your domains of interest.




Work-Life Balance and Flexibility:

Flexible Work Arrangements: recognizing the importance of balance, Methis Consulting offers flexible working conditions, including the ability to work remotely and adaptable hours, so you can maintain a healthy work-life integration while meeting client demands.
Well-Being Support: We prioritize your well-being with initiatives that focus on mental, physical, and emotional health, ensuring you have the support needed to excel in your role and in your personal life.




Client-Centric Approach:

Client Partnership Focus: at Methis Consulting, you’ll work alongside clients as a trusted partner, not just an external consultant. This close integration allows you to deeply understand their challenges and deliver solutions that are directly aligned with their strategic goals.
Zero bench Policy: We strive to have all consultants on project for 95% of their time. We do not have a bench of consultants that are without a project and optimize our recruitment in line with an in-depth knowledge of our client needs. This ensures that consultants can work on assignment as of the start.




Company with a thought-through CSR policy

Methis Consulting created a CSR-policy based on 3 main pillars: “Employee wellbeing & diversity”, “Environment” and “Human Wellbeing”. Together with our team and external partners (e.g. Go-Forest, Go-Ocean, Cunina) we want to make a positive impact on the world as a company.
While working on our client missions, you will contribute to the transition of the Energy market and making Public Transport more efficient.




Have we managed to trigger your interest? Visit www.methisconsulting.com or apply now!

Show more

Energetic environment


At Methis Consulting, you will join a young, energetic organisation, where you will have the opportunity to help companies in the energy and mobility sector and with the major challenges related to energy transition and public transport.

  • Interesting and relevant projects and roles with our clients
  • Ranging from a few months to several years (always in joint agreement)
  • Both pure business consulting and projects at the intersection of Business and Digital
  • Many opportunities to contribute to the further growth of Methis Belgium (e.g. marketing, team, knowledge sharing, development of the internal organisation)
  • Intensive cross BE-NE cooperation and knowledge sharing

Title: Data Analyst - Quality Expert
Description:
Data Analyst / Data Quality Expert

Unleash your data Quality enthusiasm!




Do you have the supernatural ability to turn raw data into gold? Are you passionate about data and convinced that data quality is the key enabler for organizations to create value from their data? If so, brace yourself, because LACO has a data-driven adventure tailor-made for you! As our Data Analyst /Data Quality expert, you'll be the Sherlock Holmes of numbers, deciphering business requirements like clues in a mystery novel. You'll be the architect of insights, sculpting data into strategies that steer the ship.




So step into the world of LACO, because we're not just your average Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company. We're the superheroes of many realms including Microsoft, SAS and Data Advisory, which earned us the rank of Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner. With a squad of over 120 consultants, we're on a mission to unravel the secrets of data and lead businesses from all walks of life through the digital wilderness. Join LACO, and you're not just an employee: you're family. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do, making every day at LACO a thrilling adventure.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst with focus on Quality at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:




Gather and analyse data from different sources to identify inconsistency and trends.
Identifying data quality issues and clearly communicate their business impact
Clean the data and identify the route causes of data quality issues
Design and build data quality controls to support data stewards and other business stakeholders
Build (Power BI) data quality dashboards to monitor the overall data quality
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI, data quality frameworks and data platforms
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Troubleshooting and resolving data quality issues by identifying root causes and implementing solutions.
Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS




You have a Bachelor's and/or Master's degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have good communication skills, used to work with business stakeholders.
You have an analytical mindset for analysing business requirements.
You have proven experience with data quality projects.
You have an extended experience with Business Glossary, Data Catalog, Data Lineage or Reporting Governance
You know all about the SQL
You have experience in Power BI, including DAX, data modeling techniques, minimum Star Schemas (Kimball) and others are nice to have.




You get even more bonus points if …




You have a good Experience with master data management
You are familiar with data quality tool like Azure Purview (Collibra, Informatica, Soda)
Python, Spark, PySpark, Spark SQL
Other Security protocols like CLS (column Level Security, Object Level Security)
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER




Receive an attractive salary package, including a company car, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Get involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
Guided by our expert LACO coaches, you'll have the support and motivation to grow and build a sustainable career.
We practice participative management, as we extend a warm invitation to you to embrace ownership and play an active role in shaping both your future and that of LACO.
Have a say in which project placement you’ll get, enabling you to work remotely, in the office, in a hybrid fashion, or based on your geographical preferences.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our one and only Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Don't let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our one and only Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success. Hurry up and smash that button, before your dream job becomes someone else's journey!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Wil jij werken bij een snelgroeiend techbedrijf en leider in innovatie? Bij I-care Group maak je deel uit van een dynamisch team dat wereldwijd een positieve impact heeft. Onze datagestuurde oplossingen maken industrieën productiever, veiliger en duurzamer. Met meer dan 800 technici en ingenieurs in 26 kantoren monitoren we wereldwijd dagelijks meer dan 300.000 machines. Wil jij continu leren en verantwoordelijkheid nemen in een stimulerende omgeving? We zoeken een enthousiaste Data Analyst voor ons online monitoring team, met kantoren in Mechelen, Gent, Geel of Heverlee. 

Functieomschrijving:

Ben jij een gepassioneerde en ambitieuze Data Analyst? Dan is deze rol op jouw lijf geschreven. Je krijgt de kans om geavanceerde predictieve onderhoudsprogramma's te ontwikkelen, te implementeren en te beheren voor onze klanten. Je duikt diep in de wereld van trillingsdata, waar je gebruikmaakt van de nieuwste Artificial Intelligence (AI) en draadloze systemen om potentiële storingen en defecten in industriële apparatuur en machines te voorspellen. En het beste van alles? Bij I-care investeren we in jouw groei en bieden we een uitgebreide interne opleiding, zodat je een echte specialist kunt worden en het verschil kunt maken voor onze klanten.

Wat worden jouw verantwoordelijkheden? 

Bij I-care draait het om Lifelong Learning. Elke dag krijg je de kans om je kennis en vaardigheden verder te ontwikkelen en bij te dragen aan innovatieve oplossingen voor industriële uitdagingen.
Met jouw expertise in trillingsanalyse speel je een cruciale rol in het vroegtijdig detecteren van potentiële storingen en defecten in machines, waardoor kostbare stilstand en reparaties worden voorkomen.
Door proactief onderhoud op basis van jouw analyse kunnen bedrijven hun operationele activiteiten optimaliseren en de betrouwbaarheid en productiviteit van hun installaties verhogen.
Je draagt niet alleen bij aan kostenbesparingen voor onze klanten, maar ook aan een veiligere werkomgeving door potentiële storingen en defecten tijdig te identificeren en aan te pakken.

Welk profiel heb je? 

Je bent in het bezit van een bachelor- of masterdiploma in een technisch, analytisch vakgebied. 
We zoeken iemand met uitstekende analytische vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe problemen op te lossen.
Communicatieve vaardigheden zijn essentieel, aangezien je effectief zult moeten communiceren met diverse belanghebbenden.
Heb je ervaring met trillingsanalyse en het interpreteren van trillingsgegevens? Dat is zeker een pluspunt!
En last but not least: we waarderen zelfstandigheid en proactiviteit enorm. Als jij kansen ziet voor procesverbetering en efficiëntie, dan moedigen we je aan om daar actief naar te streven.

Wat heeft I-care jou te bieden? 

Een open en eerlijke omgeving, waar medewerkers daadwerkelijk gewaardeerd worden om hun interesses, passie en betrokkenheid.
Een individueel groei- en leerplan dat past bij jouw interesses en waar zowel werknemer als werkgever baat bij hebben.
De mogelijkheid om intern begeleid en gecoacht te worden om je horizon te verruimen en kennis en vaardigheden op te doen in een werknemersvriendelijke omgeving.
Een aantrekkelijk en volledig verloningspakket in functie van je competenties en ervaring (Firmawagen, groeps-en hospitalisatieverzekering, dagvergoeding, gsm-vergoeding, internet at home, anciënniteitsdagen, ADV-dagen, flexibele werkuren, bonusregeling, cafetariaplan,...)
Je beste werkdag ooit!


Bij I-care geloven we dat iedereen iets anders en waardevols te bieden heeft om ons sterker te maken als groep en als mensen. Wij waarderen onze mensen om wie ze zijn en behandelen onze medewerkers gelijk ongeacht demografische factoren zoals leeftijd, geslacht, etniciteit, seksuele geaardheid, geloofsovertuiging of handicap.

Show more

Title: Deals Data Analyst
Description:
Line of Service

Advisory

Industry/Sector

Not Applicable

Specialism

Data Analytics

Management Level

Associate

Job Description & Summary

Leading with heart, living by values

PwC Advisory is a garden of possibilities, and you’re reaping the rewards. Where you want to make an impact is always up to you. With the full support of our Advisory teams, you’ll delve into the inner workings of companies to find the best solutions for any challenge they might have. From the excitement of deals to the complexities of consulting and the fascinating realm of risks and threats in forensics, you’ll help clients nurture trust and maintain their evolutionary edge, today and into the future. Now that’s making a difference.

Are you passionate about Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) and the data that drives business decisions? Do you want to transform business data into meaningful insights? If so, PwC's Deal Analytics team is the place for you!

In the dynamic world of M&A, data is a vital source of value creation. However, many companies struggle to leverage it effectively. This is where PwC’s Deal Analytics team excels. We harness data to provide critical insights for buyers and sellers, enhancing their understanding of historical performance and uncovering new opportunities. As a data analyst, you will be at the heart of that, engaging in a wide array of tasks:

What you will learn and do


Execute on exciting projects:
Harness the power of data and analytics to create (or break) a compelling story around a target business;
Unlock value potential after a deal;
Liaise with clients, advisors and/or other PwC teams to provide robust, data-driven insights (e.g. into business and value drivers)
Work across the entire data-lifecycle:
Extract, transform and load (ETL) client and alternative data using a variety of tools;
Automate manual processes to boost efficiency.
Utilize tools like Alteryx, R, or Python to conduct complex analyses
Create insightful visualizations using e.g. Power BI
Help our Deals Analytics team to further grow:
Coordinate our intern(s) and/or remote teams;
Contribute to development of new services; by building Proof-of-Concept solutions using new technology and techniques;
Be a digital accelerator for the broader Deals practice


Who You Are, What You’re Like


Earned a degree in a technology-related program, mathematics, statistics, civil or business engineering.
Worked as a data analyst/ data scientist/data engineer or BI-consultant/developer in a similar consulting environment with at least 1 year of relevant experience.
Possess an analytical mind with strong business acumen.
Skilled in communicating complex analyses effectively to diverse audiences.
Fluency in English; ideally also in Dutch and/or French.
Knowledgeable in basic financial, accounting, and commercial principles.
Experience in working a range of data tools like:
Visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau or equivalent;
ETL-tools such as Alteryx or equivalent;
R, Python or other scripting tools (with advanced analytical capabilities);
Excel, Power Tools


Life at PwC Belgium

Our culture and workplace are something we’re proud of. Here’s a sneak peek at some of the benefits you can look forward to.


Flexibility: flexible working hours so you can decide your most effective working pattern.
Infinite learning and growing: broad opportunities to learn every day and exciting career pathways that help you explore different disciplines or areas of expertise.
Rewards that matter to you: a flexible rewards plan gives you access to a wide range of benefits so you can make the choices that best fit your personal circumstances and lifestyle.
Diversity & inclusion: we believe that diversity makes PwC stronger. It helps us solve important problems and deliver added value to our clients. We encourage an inclusive culture where people can be the best versions of themselves. We organise various D&I initiatives, including an active employee-led Employee Resource Group (ERG) community, comprising 9 diversity groups with over 200 PwC employees aiming to make an impact within and beyond PwC.
A sustainable mobility offer: we offer a comprehensive mobility budget with a wide range of options (hybrid and electric cars, bike leasing, mobility card or loan reimbursement).
Well-being: an extensive health and well-being programme that includes access to professional sport coaching, individual sessions, sports communities and mental health resources. We encourage a healthy lifestyle with regular wellness challenges and various catering options at our cafeteria.
Team events such as Last Friday Drinks, quarterly themed parties, team-building days and celebrations, as well as time spent on community days and charity activities.
International PwC network: broad access to industry expertise, both locally and through our wider global network of member firms.
Supporting you in every phase of your life, including family friendly work schemes.


Looking for a career where you’ll really make a difference? Then we look forward to meeting you!

Education (if blank, degree and/or field of study not specified)

Degrees/Field of Study required:

Degrees/Field of Study preferred:

Certifications (if blank, certifications not specified)

Required Skills

Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Data Engineering

Optional Skills

Desired Languages (If blank, desired languages not specified)

Travel Requirements

Not Specified

Available for Work Visa Sponsorship?

No

Government Clearance Required?

No

Job Posting End Date

PwC Advisory is a garden of possibilities, and you’re reaping the rewards. Where you want to make an impact is always up to you. With the full support of our Advisory teams, you’ll delve into the inner workings of companies to find the best solutions for any challenge they might have. From the excitement of deals to the complexities of consulting and the fascinating realm of risks and threats in forensics, you’ll help clients nurture trust and maintain their evolutionary edge, today and into the future. Now that’s making a difference.

Are you passionate about Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) and the data that drives business decisions? Do you want to transform business data into meaningful insights? If so, PwC's Deal Analytics team is the place for you!

In the dynamic world of M&A, data is a vital source of value creation. However, many companies struggle to leverage it effectively. This is where PwC’s Deal Analytics team excels. We harness data to provide critical insights for buyers and sellers, enhancing their understanding of historical performance and uncovering new opportunities. As a data analyst, you will be at the heart of that, engaging in a wide array of tasks:

What you will learn and do

  • Execute on exciting projects:
    • Harness the power of data and analytics to create (or break) a compelling story around a target business;
    • Unlock value potential after a deal;
    • Liaise with clients, advisors and/or other PwC teams to provide robust, data-driven insights (e.g. into business and value drivers)
  • Work across the entire data-lifecycle:
    • Extract, transform and load (ETL) client and alternative data using a variety of tools;
    • Automate manual processes to boost efficiency.
    • Utilize tools like Alteryx, R, or Python to conduct complex analyses
    • Create insightful visualizations using e.g. Power BI
  • Help our Deals Analytics team to further grow:
    • Coordinate our intern(s) and/or remote teams;
    • Contribute to development of new services; by building Proof-of-Concept solutions using new technology and techniques;
    • Be a digital accelerator for the broader Deals practice

Who You Are, What You’re Like

  • Earned a degree in a technology-related program, mathematics, statistics, civil or business engineering.
  • Worked as a data analyst/ data scientist/data engineer or BI-consultant/developer in a similar consulting environment with at least 1 year of relevant experience.
  • Possess an analytical mind with strong business acumen.
  • Skilled in communicating complex analyses effectively to diverse audiences.
  • Fluency in English; ideally also in Dutch and/or French.
  • Knowledgeable in basic financial, accounting, and commercial principles.
  • Experience in working a range of data tools like:
    • Visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau or equivalent;
    • ETL-tools such as Alteryx or equivalent;
    • R, Python or other scripting tools (with advanced analytical capabilities);
    • Excel, Power Tools

Life at PwC Belgium

Our culture and workplace are something we’re proud of. Here’s a sneak peek at some of the benefits you can look forward to.

  • Flexibility: flexible working hours so you can decide your most effective working pattern.
  • Infinite learning and growing: broad opportunities to learn every day and exciting career pathways that help you explore different disciplines or areas of expertise.
  • Rewards that matter to you: a flexible rewards plan gives you access to a wide range of benefits so you can make the choices that best fit your personal circumstances and lifestyle.
  • Diversity & inclusion: we believe that diversity makes PwC stronger. It helps us solve important problems and deliver added value to our clients. We encourage an inclusive culture where people can be the best versions of themselves. We organise various D&I initiatives, including an active employee-led Employee Resource Group (ERG) community, comprising 9 diversity groups with over 200 PwC employees aiming to make an impact within and beyond PwC.
  • A sustainable mobility offer: we offer a comprehensive mobility budget with a wide range of options (hybrid and electric cars, bike leasing, mobility card or loan reimbursement).
  • Well-being: an extensive health and well-being programme that includes access to professional sport coaching, individual sessions, sports communities and mental health resources. We encourage a healthy lifestyle with regular wellness challenges and various catering options at our cafeteria.
  • Team events such as Last Friday Drinks, quarterly themed parties, team-building days and celebrations, as well as time spent on community days and charity activities.
  • International PwC network: broad access to industry expertise, both locally and through our wider global network of member firms.
  • Supporting you in every phase of your life, including family friendly work schemes.

Looking for a career where you’ll really make a difference? Then we look forward to meeting you!

Degrees/Field of Study preferred:

Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Data Engineering

Title: Azure Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms and cybersecurity. By combining creativity, tech and data insights, we empower our customers to transform their business and unlock the future.

With 25 years’ experience and 10,000 employees across Europe, the Middle East and Africa, Devoteam promotes responsible tech for people and works to create better change.

Join our global community of exceptional talents at Devoteam, where you’ll collaborate with multidisciplinary teams of data specialists, business consultants, solution architects, security experts, cloud engineers, developers, and more across over 20 countries in the EMEA region. As a member of our team, you’ll have the opportunity to work with the world’s leading partners, including AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow, driving innovation and advancing your career.


Job Description

If you like these keywords, you’ll love this role:

#data #azure #PowerBI #Reporting #Dashboarding #DataWarehouse #DataMart #StarSchema

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You’re a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.


Qualifications

For this position, we’re looking for all seniority levels. 

[Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
[Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
[Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake…)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
[Nice-to-have] You’re ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
[Nice-to-have] You’re either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
[Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203



If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don’t worry. Just apply. Together we’ll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.

Our promises to you

As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.


Additional Information

#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Why choose us?

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.
Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it’s okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.
Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.
Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.
Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation. 
Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.

At Devoteam, we combine strong values – respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.

>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!

At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.
  3. Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
