Title: Sales Data Analyst (m/f/*)
Description:
Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World

Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with curious, creative 3Mers.





The Impact You’ll Make in this Rol

eAs a Business Analyst, you will be part of the Consumer Business Group, responsible for the commercialization of worldwide leading brands including Scotch®, Scotch Blue™, Command™, Scotch-Brite™, Post-it®, 3M, Futuro™, Nexcare™, among others and you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world

.Here, you will make an impact by

:Determining Advanced Analysis and Insight Generation: Leveraging retailers and distributors' point of sales (POS) data, syndicated data, and shopper data to generate actionable insights
.Driving POS Growth and Mitigating Declines: Utilize your analytical expertise to develop strategies that enhance POS growth, while identifying and addressing potential declines through effective category management
.Playing a pivotal role in executing category management strategies. This involves deep dives into category performance, identifying growth opportunities, optimizing product assortment, and providing guidance on pricing and promotional strategies
.Influencing Partnership with Key Accounts: Build and maintain strong relationships with retailer/distributor key accounts within EMEA, influencing decision-making through data-driven insights and category management expertise
.Collaborating with all business analysts to implement Consumer Business Group global analytic strategies and tactics, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives




.
Your Skills and Experti

seTo set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualification

s:Bachelor’s or Master’s degree or higher from an accredited institution preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related fiel
d.Expert Experience in business analytics or a related relevant customer market with a preference for experience in the FMCG industr
y.Category Management demonstrated expertise and data-driven decision makin
g.Language Proficiency: Fluent in French AND English is a mu
stCommunication Skills: Excellent storytelling and presentation skills, capable of translating complex data into actionable insights. Proficiency in presenting to client




s.
Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role inclu

de:Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and data interpretation skills, with proficiency in Microsoft Power
BI.Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with planogramming software (e.g., JDA Space Planner), and an understanding of data modeling techniqu
es.Leadership Qualities: Proven leadership skills with the ability to influence key stakeholders and drive implementation of strategic initiativ




es.
Supporting Your Well-b

eing3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and sc




ope.
Resources fo

r YouFor more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers. If you have further questions please reach out to Max (our AI Virtual Assistant) via our Career




Page.

As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
(Junior) Data Analyst

Heb jij een passie voor data en ben je klaar om een verschil te maken in een vooruitstrevende organisatie? Voor een toonaangevend Belgisch aannemingsbedrijf dat actief is in zowel Vlaanderen als Brussel, zoeken we een enthousiaste (Junior) Data Analyst. Dit is jouw kans om deel uit te maken van een team dat data centraal stelt in hun bedrijfsstrategie. Klaar om met jouw inzichten het verschil te maken?

Wat ga je doen?

- Je speelt een sleutelrol in het beheren en verbeteren van de gegevensstromen binnen het Datawarehouse, waarbij je verschillende databronnen samenbrengt.
- Je creëert boeiende en gebruiksvriendelijke dashboards met Power BI, die direct waarde toevoegen aan de besluitvorming.
- Je werkt nauw samen met diverse afdelingen om hen te ondersteunen bij het analyseren van datapatronen en het ontdekken van nieuwe inzichten.
- Je bent het aanspreekpunt voor collega's bij vragen over rapportages en stuurt bij op basis van hun input om de rapportages voortdurend te verfijnen.
- Dankzij jouw analytische blik en oog voor detail maak je complexe gegevens begrijpelijk en bruikbaar voor het hele bedrijf.

Wie ben jij?

- Je hebt een Bachelor of Master in een data-gericht vakgebied of hebt al enige ervaring met data-analyse.
- Je kent de Microsoft BI tools (Power BI, SQL, SSIS, enz.) goed en weet hoe je deze kunt inzetten om data om te zetten in bruikbare inzichten.
- Je bent gedreven om met data de organisatie vooruit te helpen en processen efficiënter te maken.
- Jouw sterke analytische vaardigheden helpen je om patronen te herkennen en praktische oplossingen aan te dragen.
- Je beheerst de Nederlandse taal vloeiend, en kennis van Frans of Engels is een bijkomend voordeel.

Wat bieden wij jou?

- Een aantrekkelijk loonpakket met extra legale voordelen, waaronder een bedrijfswagen.
- Een afwisselende functie met ruimte om je eigen stempel te drukken op de manier waarop je werkt.
- Opleidingsmogelijkheden en trainingen om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak.
- Een vooruitstrevende werkomgeving waar innovatie centraal staat en waar jouw inbreng echt telt.

Ben jij klaar om jouw carrière een boost te geven en met data impact te maken? Aarzel niet langer en solliciteer nu voor deze uitdagende functie!

Show more

Title: Data Analyst – Data Management & Analytics
Description:
Capco – The Future. Now.

Capco is a distinctly and positively different place to work. Much more than consultants, we are active participants in the global financial services industry. Our passionate business and technology professionals enjoy a unique environment where they are actively encouraged to apply intellect, innovation, experience and teamwork. We are dedicated to fully supporting our clients as they respond to challenges and opportunities in: Banking, Capital Markets, Finance Risk & Compliance, Insurance, and Wealth and Investment Management. Experience Capco for yourself at capco.com

Let’s Talk About You

You want to Own Your Career. You’re serious about rising as far and as fast as your work and achievements can take you. And you’re ready to write the next chapter of your career story: a challenging and rewarding role as a Capco Data analyst Consultant.

Let’s Get Down To Business

We are looking for a data Consultant to join our Data team.

Responsibilities


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Show Us What You’ve Got

It will be very useful if you have some or all of the following skills and experience:


Professional experience of 2-8 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch and excellent knowledge of English


Professional experience is important. But it’s paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From Day One, your key skill will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an unfair advantage.

Now Take the Next Step

If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you.

What Do We Offer


An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a green mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture


Show more
HTML:
Capco – The Future. Now.

Capco is a distinctly and positively different place to work. Much more than consultants, we are active participants in the global financial services industry. Our passionate business and technology professionals enjoy a unique environment where they are actively encouraged to apply intellect, innovation, experience and teamwork. We are dedicated to fully supporting our clients as they respond to challenges and opportunities in: Banking, Capital Markets, Finance Risk & Compliance, Insurance, and Wealth and Investment Management. Experience Capco for yourself at capco.com

Let’s Talk About You

You want to Own Your Career. You’re serious about rising as far and as fast as your work and achievements can take you. And you’re ready to write the next chapter of your career story: a challenging and rewarding role as a Capco Data analyst Consultant.

Let’s Get Down To Business

We are looking for a data Consultant to join our Data team.

Responsibilities

  • Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
  • Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
  • Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
  • Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
  • Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
  • Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
  • Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis

Show Us What You’ve Got

It will be very useful if you have some or all of the following skills and experience:

  • Professional experience of 2-8 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
  • Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
  • Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
  • Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
  • Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
  • You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
  • Fluency in French or Dutch and excellent knowledge of English

Professional experience is important. But it’s paramount you share our belief in disruptive innovation that puts clients ahead in a tough market. From Day One, your key skill will be to perceive new and better ways of doing things to give your clients an unfair advantage.

Now Take the Next Step

If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you.

What Do We Offer

  • An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a green mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
  • Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts
  • A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
  • A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
  • A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
  • A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

Title: Data Analyst - Ethics & Business Integrity
Description:
Make your mark for patients

We are looking for a Data Analyst - Ethics & Business Integrity who is analytical, communicative, and self-motivated to join us in our Ethics & Business Integrity (E&BI) team, based in our headquarters office in Brussels, Belgium or in our office in Atlanta, United States.

About The Role

You will be working in a team that designs the compliance monitoring program, including data analysis, research, data management, and reporting, with a goal of enabling the E&BI Team to make informed decisions based on empirical evidence, promoting ethics and business integrity within the organization. Your focus will be on designing data analytics approaches to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of monitoring approaches.

Who You’ll Work With

You will collaborate with various E&BI teams, IT teams, and external partners/vendors to deliver comprehensive data insights and analytics supporting ethical practices and business integrity.

What You’ll Do


Identify opportunities for data-informed reporting and analytics within E&BI.
Assess relevant data sources availability across the organization.
Develop data analytics models to generate insights related to ethics and business integrity.
Deploy and evaluate data analytics solutions and communicate results effectively ….


Interested? For this role we’re looking for the following education, experience and skills


Excellent analytical skills for identifying trends and insights from data.
Experience with compliance monitoring approaches preferred.
Strong knowledge and interest in data (Data Visualization/BI Tools, Coding Languages & Tools).
Effective communication skills, including presentations and clear writing.
Ability to influence stakeholders to maximize the impact of ethics and integrity analytics.
Proven problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.


Are you ready to ‘go beyond’ to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

About Us

UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

Why work with us?

At UCB, we don’t just complete tasks, we create value. We aren’t afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected, and has equitable opportunities to do their best work. We ‘go beyond’ to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that’s on our patients, our employees, or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.

UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity and inclusion in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity.

Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on EMEA-Reasonable_Accommodation@ucb.com . Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments; we will not be able to support you through this channel.

Title: Data Visualization Lead
Description:
As Stephen Few states: “We are overwhelmed by information, not because there is too much, but because we haven't learned how to tame it.” Capgemini Insights & Data is looking for people who tame data in such a way that the most complex data can be easily interpreted.

We are looking for a Data Visualization Lead to help our clients in their digital transformations.




Key tasks & activities

You create insights into data with dashboards and storytelling ,creating compelling user experiences. You're in business teams or liaising with them to build value together
You advise on solution architecture, hosting models, license and lifecycle evolutions, etc, for data visualization technology ( PowerBI, Qlik, Tableau, …)
You provide thought leadership in the BI landscape, and share and develop this knowledge with our customers and teams
You develop technical solutions, design operating models and service approaches for BI projects and teams
You lead, develop and coach the data visualization team by setting out the strategy, development plan and executing it
You build a rich international network in our global Insights & Data business lines and delivery centers




Knowledge & Experience

You are customer focused, eager to connect with Business users and build value together
You master multiple data visualization tools ( PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik) in terms of front-end (dashboard creation), and back-end ( data wrangling, performance optimization, security and integration into other IT tools) and bring practical experience as well as certification
You have a keen understanding of data modeling
You master SQL and Python for Data
Professional working proficiency in Dutch & English.
Proven Leadership skills, with ability to lead and nurture our clients needs as well as our consultants
Integrate and work in an international/multi-cultural environment, on variable-sized projects




#GetTheFutureYouWant




At Capgemini, we believe in diversity, equal opportunities, and a workplace where everyone feels valued. We take good care of people and help them make progress by assigning challenging projects and providing ample opportunities for personal growth and learning. We are looking for experienced professionals ready for their next career move.

You will join the I&D team, an ambitious, collaborative, supportive environment—problem-solvers with a strong focus on exchanging best practices to deliver exceptional results with Data science. Here, the knowledge of each team member and their own expertise is valuable to enable effective decision-making, proactive planning, and smooth project execution.




In return, we offer an attractive salary with fringe benefits:

A hybrid or electric company car (or mobility budget)
Meal & eco vouchers
Group & health insurance
Flexible work hours & the opportunity to work from home (70% of the time)
32 vacation days & 45 workcation days (to work abroad)
Intensive training and certification at all levels to keep you up to date with the latest trends & technologies




Apply now! We'd love to hear from you.

For more information: contact liz.nzimbula@capgemini.com or visit www.capgemini.com

Show more

Title: Data analyst
Description:
Omschrijving

Je beschikt daarvoor over aantoonbare ervaring in (digital) analytics. Je hebt sterke analytische competenties, je werkt vanuit een agile en lean mindset, en kan die ook uitdragen naar de rest van de organisatie (vb stakeholders). Je kent alles van dit vakdomein, en weet het vooral goed naar de praktijk te brengen.

Je analyseert de verzamelde data, legt verbanden en genereert inzichten om zo de websites, apps en de digitale communicatie naar de eindgebruiker nog relevanter en effectiever te maken. Je bent pro-actief en creatief je bedenkt ook zelf interessante pistes voor analyses.

Profiel


Hogere opleiding (Master of Bachelor) met technische/engineering achtergrond of gelijkwaardig door ervaring met ICT- technologie waarvoor expertise gevraagd wordt
Je kan je inzichten vertalen naar actiegerichte adviezen om de digitale ervaring van onze mediagebruikers continu te verbeteren. Je geeft hierbij ook soms input voor AB testing en digitale personalisatie. Je meet, analyseert en rapporteert over de impact van content-, product- of marketinginitiatieven en stelt proactief optimalisaties voor.
Je kan cijfers doen spreken ahv duidelijke dashboards of rapporten en je kan je stakeholders overtuigen om datagedreven acties te ondernemen.
Je kan met BI tools (PowerBI, Metabase, Superset) overweg en SQL heeft geen geheimen voor jou.
Ervaring met AB-testing, conversie optimalisatie en social media analytics is een pluspunt
Ook ervaring in de media is mooi meegenomen



Aanbod

Je word deel van een groeiende KMO met ruimte voor initiatief en persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Wij zorgen ervoor dat je in een uitdagende maar aangename werkomgeving terecht komt met leuke collega's. Samen met jou stippelen we een carriereplan uit, met aandacht en budget voor bijkomende opleidingingen / certificaties. Je kan rekenen op een motiverend salaris, aangevuld met extralegale voordelen, inclusief bedrijfswagen (of alternatieve vergoeding).

(Freelance ook mogelijk)
Show more

Title: Internship Data Analytics
Description:
Smart and efficient – Bosch Home Comfort offers its customers throughout the world solutions for their room climate, domestic hot water and decentralized energy management requirements. For this Bosch Home Comfort applies highly efficient technologies which in many cases use renewable energies and make a significant contribution to implementing the energy transition.

Bosch Home Comfort, based in Wetzlar and Wernau/Stuttgart, manufactures in more than 120 engineering locations in in Europe, America and Asia and achieved sales of 5.5 billion euros in 2018. The product portfolio ranges from floor-standing and wall-hung gas and oil boilers and water heaters to solar thermal systems, heat pumps for heating and cooling and large-scale commercial and industrial systems such as industrial boilers, CHP and waste heat recovery systems for industrial processes.

Bosch Home Comfort Belgium, situated in Mechelen, is a pure sales country unit that operates under the brands Buderus and Bosch.

You will be working as a Data Analytics Intern in the Business Intelligence department at Bosch Home Comfort in Mechelen. Your main responsibility will be to further develop and maintain the 360-degree view of our customers, which will be used to steer the departments (Marketing, Sales, Sales Operations, etc). You will support in projects and process optimization. You will maintain and harmonize the data present in different applications. Furthermore, you will be responsible for several Sales reports (in Power BI and Excel) and may be asked to conduct several analyses.

You are currently a student (Data Analytics, Statistics, International Business Management, Marketing, Economical Studies, etc.) and you are interested in Data Analytics and Business Intelligence.

You have excellent analytical and problem solving skills. You are curious and have a positive mindset. You are well-organized, can work independently, efficiently and are self-motivated.

You have practical knowledge of MS Excel and Power BI. Fluency in English is mandatory. Good knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.

We are looking forward to receiving your application by e-mail in English (please mention the exact title of the position). Do not hesitate to contact us if you have any further questions.

If you are a student enrolled in a University/College (or if you are available for a voluntary internship outside a university curriculum) you will be granted an allowance of € 1035,30/month.


If you want to apply for a voluntary internship, you must be a citizen of the EU or have a work permit in Belgium.
In case that you need to do a mandatory internship, your University/College must be located in a member state of the EU.


Starting date: December 2024

Duration: 6 months

Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Belgium is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient language skills may not be considered.

Title: Reporting & Data Analyst
Description:
Als Reporting & Data Analyst maak je deel uit van een dynamisch team dat zich focust op analyse en rapportering voor Indirecte Aankopen binnen Colruyt Group Technics. Jouw bijdrage speelt een belangrijke rol bij besluitvormingsprocessen en het bevorderen van de groei van het bedrijf. Een job met veel impact!




Een greep uit jouw takenpakket:

Als Reporting & Data Analyst binnen Colruyt Group Technics ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, analyseren en rapporteren van gegevens die cruciaal zijn voor onze bedrijfsvoering. Hiervoor ontwikkel, onderhoud en optimaliseer je periodieke rapportages en dashboards met behulp van Power BI.
Je analyseert hierbij data om trends, patronen en inzichten te ontdekken, maar ook knelpunten en verbeterpunten te vinden. Vanuit jouw inzichten doe je voorstellen voor datagedreven verbeteringen en strategische initiatieven.
Je werkt samen met verschillende interne stakeholders om hun noden en rapportagebehoeften te begrijpen en te vervullen.
Je schrijft werkmethodes uit, stelt gedetailleerde opleidingsmappen op ifv. de opgestelde rapporteringen en geeft trainingen aan medewerkers om hen te ondersteunen bij het gebruik van rapportages en data-analysetools.
Je werkt nauw samen met jouw team om gegevensgestuurde oplossingen te ontwikkelen en te implementeren.
Je waakt over de datakwaliteit binnen de verschillende systemen aan de hand van rapporteringen en draagt op die manier actief bij aan de continue verbetering van dataverzamelings- en analyseprocessen.

Je werkt in Halle en kunt tot 2 dagen per week thuiswerken of in een van onze regionale kantoren (Mechelen, Haasrode, Zwijnaarde, …).




Profiel




Ervaring – Je hebt minstens een bachelordiploma in een relevante studierichting zoals Data Science, Statistiek, Wiskunde, … en ervaring met het werken in complexe spreadsheets in Excel. Basiskennis van SAP is een pluspunt.
Analytisch vermogen – Je bent analytisch en kunt complexe informatie vertalen naar begrijpelijke inzichten zonder de details uit het oog te verliezen.
Teamplayer – Je werkt in een multidisciplinair team, je haalt energie uit samenwerken om de beste resultaten te halen.
Initiatief – Je bent gedreven en pakt je werk zelf vast om op een efficiënte manier je doel te bereiken. Zie je dat iets beter kan? Dan ga je daar mee aan de slag.
Communicatie - Je hebt sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe gegevens eenvoudig uit te leggen.
Talenkennis – Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands en Frans en kunt informatie vlot overbrengen aan je collega’s en stakeholders.




Wij bieden




Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket, gecombineerd met extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, winstdeelname en een hospitalisatieverzekering.
Opleidingen en leertrajecten – Wij voorzien opleidingen die aansluiten bij je ervaring en behoeften. Je krijgt alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontplooien, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak.
Eigen verantwoordelijkheden - We geven je de kans om je eigen verantwoordelijkheden op te nemen, maar ook om je eigen ideeën en initiatieven mee vorm te geven.
Werkzekerheid – Colruyt Group is een stabiel bedrijf in volle groei met ruim 32.000 medewerkers. Bij ons kan je dus rekenen op werkzekerheid én een mooie toekomst!
Plezant werken – Een hecht en dynamisch team staat te popelen om jou te leren kennen. Je staat er niet alleen voor, voor vragen kan je altijd bij hen terecht.




Je gaat aan de slag bij Colruyt Group Technics, onze interne technische dienst. We ontwerpen, (ver)bouwen en onderhouden alle winkels, distributiecentra, DATS 24-tankstations, voertuigen en installaties van Colruyt Group. Of je nu technieker, administratief medewerker of architect bent, je merkt meteen de impact van je werk.

Show more

  • Je werkt samen met verschillende interne stakeholders om hun noden en rapportagebehoeften te begrijpen en te vervullen.
  • Je schrijft werkmethodes uit, stelt gedetailleerde opleidingsmappen op ifv. de opgestelde rapporteringen en geeft trainingen aan medewerkers om hen te ondersteunen bij het gebruik van rapportages en data-analysetools.
  • Je werkt nauw samen met jouw team om gegevensgestuurde oplossingen te ontwikkelen en te implementeren.
  • Je waakt over de datakwaliteit binnen de verschillende systemen aan de hand van rapporteringen en draagt op die manier actief bij aan de continue verbetering van dataverzamelings- en analyseprocessen.

Je werkt in Halle en kunt tot 2 dagen per week thuiswerken of in een van onze regionale kantoren (Mechelen, Haasrode, Zwijnaarde, …).


Profiel


  • Ervaring – Je hebt minstens een bachelordiploma in een relevante studierichting zoals Data Science, Statistiek, Wiskunde, … en ervaring met het werken in complexe spreadsheets in Excel. Basiskennis van SAP is een pluspunt.
  • Analytisch vermogen – Je bent analytisch en kunt complexe informatie vertalen naar begrijpelijke inzichten zonder de details uit het oog te verliezen.
  • Teamplayer – Je werkt in een multidisciplinair team, je haalt energie uit samenwerken om de beste resultaten te halen.
  • Initiatief – Je bent gedreven en pakt je werk zelf vast om op een efficiënte manier je doel te bereiken. Zie je dat iets beter kan? Dan ga je daar mee aan de slag.
  • Communicatie - Je hebt sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en het vermogen om complexe gegevens eenvoudig uit te leggen.
  • Talenkennis – Je communiceert vlot in het Nederlands en Frans en kunt informatie vlot overbrengen aan je collega’s en stakeholders.


Wij bieden


  • Aantrekkelijk loonpakket – Je ontvangt een aantrekkelijk loonpakket, gecombineerd met extralegale voordelen zoals een bedrijfswagen, maaltijdcheques, winstdeelname en een hospitalisatieverzekering.
  • Opleidingen en leertrajecten – Wij voorzien opleidingen die aansluiten bij je ervaring en behoeften. Je krijgt alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontplooien, zowel op professioneel als persoonlijk vlak.
  • Eigen verantwoordelijkheden - We geven je de kans om je eigen verantwoordelijkheden op te nemen, maar ook om je eigen ideeën en initiatieven mee vorm te geven.
  • Werkzekerheid – Colruyt Group is een stabiel bedrijf in volle groei met ruim 32.000 medewerkers. Bij ons kan je dus rekenen op werkzekerheid én een mooie toekomst!
  • Plezant werken – Een hecht en dynamisch team staat te popelen om jou te leren kennen. Je staat er niet alleen voor, voor vragen kan je altijd bij hen terecht.


  • Je gaat aan de slag bij Colruyt Group Technics, onze interne technische dienst. We ontwerpen, (ver)bouwen en onderhouden alle winkels, distributiecentra, DATS 24-tankstations, voertuigen en installaties van Colruyt Group. Of je nu technieker, administratief medewerker of architect bent, je merkt meteen de impact van je werk.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
Your role Matters




Keyrus Data Intelligence is currently looking for BI consultants from medior to senior level, with expertise in Microsoft BI (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, DQS, MDS, Power BI, Azure) to join its expanding team. If you’re passionate about business intelligence and would like to join a leader in consulting and solutions integration for business intelligence, big data & analytics and performance management on the Belgian market please read on…

Depending on your seniority and ambitions, you will have different responsibilities which might include:

Helping to build and modify OLAP environments
Building reports using input gathered from either the project managers or business owners
Handling version migrations
Developing the Business Intelligence/Data Warehousing solutions by using the Microsoft BI-Suite (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS, Power BI, Azure)
Collaborating or developing the complete architectural set-up

You will have the opportunity to further develop your knowledge in the latest versions of Microsoft BI applications as well as learn new modules, or to choose a path that interests you. Whether in analysis, other reporting tools, ETL, data warehousing design, implementation or migration, Keyrus will have a project to match your ambition and will help you to build a valuable and successful career.

You will have the opportunity of participating in end-to-end projects in a variety of domains from business intelligence, data warehousing, data quality, data integration and big data to corporate performance management in various industries including banking, retail, manufacturing and distribution.

If you feel you have what it takes to add value to our experienced team, if you want to thrive in a challenging environment of collaboration and flexibility, if you are eager to learn new skills to achieve your full potential and if you are a team player, then Keyrus is the right company for you!




You Matter!




Bachelor or Master degree
Professional experience as a consultant with a first practical hands-on experience in Microsoft BI (Microsoft SQL server Reporting Services, Microsoft SQL Server Analysis Services, Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services, Power BI, Data Quality Services, Master Data Services,…)
Knowledge of other BI tools will be considered a plus
Knowledge in other Microsoft BI modules is a plus
Good understanding of the data warehouse life cycle and its architecture
The ability to think analytically
Strong communication skills both on the business and technical side
Being able to work both independently and as part of a team is very important
Fluent in Dutch and/or French and English

And how we reward you Matters...




Keyrus offers a working environment and projects that attract the best people working in Data, Digital and Business Transformation. Working on diverse and challenging projects, you will have the opportunity to develop multi-disciplinary skills to help you build a strong career path.

To support you in this we have a digital learning platform with access to over 30,000 training courses as well as courses created by our experts. We dedicate a generous training budget that allows you to manage your career path at a pace that suits you.

We have also implemented an Agile Performance Management framework, where strength-based coaching, aligned company goals, alongside regular check-ins and feedback managed throughout the year are at the heart of our people management strategy.

Our generous and flexible salary package gives you the choice between:

A mobility budget that you can utilize for sustainable transportation, housing costs (rent or mortgage) and/or cash
Traditional petrol or electric car and a fuel card

On top of these two options, you will also receive net allowances, eco vouchers, hospitalisation (DKV) insurance & group insurance and a bonus scheme to use on our cafeteria plan.

Keyrus gives you the chance to develop your career alongside leaders in data, digital and management and transformation. Our project and clients at the heart of data and digital transformation changing the world we live in for the better, making data matter.




Keyrus Matters




Keyrus, creator of value in the era of Data and Digital.

Keyrus is dedicated to helping enterprises take advantage of the Data and Digital paradigm to enhance their performance, facilitating and accelerating their transformation, and generating new drivers of growth, competitiveness, and sustainability.

Keyrus in Belgium employs 200 highly skilled consultants and is part of the international Keyrus Group, an international player in consulting and technologies and a specialist in Data and Digital. Created in 1996, listed on Euronext's Eurolist, with consolidated revenues of €351.89m in 2022 and with more than 3500 employees in 26 countries, the Keyrus Group offers the performance, solidity and know-how of a large professional services organisation, whilst preserving the agility of a young company.




#makedatamatter

Title: Internal Controls Data Analyst
Description:
Make your mark for patients

To strengthen our Group Accounting, Tax and Treasury team, based at our HQ, in Brussels, Belgium, we are looking for a talented individual to fill the position of Internal Controls Data Analyst.

About The Role

The Global Internal Control function operates as an independent function but supports the operations/line management in building and maintaining efficient and effective internal control process/system. It also monitors compliance of finance processes, systems, and its operations in accordance with UCB policies and procedures in coordination with audit functions. We are expanding our scope to non-financial reporting (namely Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) / Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD)).


Internal Controls Data Analyst will play a critical role in ensuring the integrity, efficiency, and compliance of our financial processes as well as non-financial reporting (ESG/CSRD).
Responsible and accountable for connection of data sources, analysis and answering business questions via consistent and auditable methods.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance our control environment and influence system setups.
Reports to Head of Internal Controls


What You’ll Do


Extract and interpret financial and non-financial data to uncover trends and areas for improvement.
Translate complex data into actionable insights for informed decision-making.
Proactively engage stakeholders to understand business needs and develop meaningful reports.
Create dashboards to provide valuable information for management and audit purposes.
Assess existing controls and processes, identifying gaps and inefficiencies.
Recommend enhancements based on data findings to optimize procedures.


Interested? For this position you’ll need the following education, experience and skills:


Bachelor's degree required; minimum 5 years of finance process experience in a global organization, preferably in pharma/biopharma.
Minimum 3-4 years of relevant experience in data analytics; experience in ESG reporting is advantageous.
Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R) and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, QlikSense).
Knowledge of finance, accounting, and auditing principles; familiarity with industry internal control standards such as COSO.
Understanding of financial processes (S2P, O2C, R2R, Master Data, Tax) and their risks & controls, including interfaces with other functional areas.
Strong analytical skills, proactive mindset, excellent stakeholder management, negotiation skills, and proven leadership ability within a global organization.


Why you should apply

Do you want to contribute in bringing real value to patients living with severe diseases while driving innovation forward?

Join UCB’s dynamic, inspiring and innovative environment and team. You will be recognized for impactful performance via a competitive compensation and benefits package and you will enjoy ample personal development opportunities.

Tell us what makes you the perfect match to our team and join one of the most dynamic & forward looking IT organizations in the world.

Are you ready to ‘go beyond’ to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

Are you ready to ‘go beyond’ to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

About Us

UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

Why work with us?

At UCB, we don’t just complete tasks, we create value. We aren’t afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected, and has equitable opportunities to do their best work. We ‘go beyond’ to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that’s on our patients, our employees, or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.

UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity and inclusion in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity.

Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on on EMEA-Reasonable_Accommodation@ucb.com . Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments; we will not be able to support you through this channel.

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
HTML:
My client is looking for a BI Consultant for a 2 year mission based 50% brussels and remote working 50%


Skills

  • Excellent knowledge of Business Intelligence tools, design and development of dashboards;
  • Strong analytical skills, ability to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets and create effective data visualisation and dashboards;
  • In depth knowledge of SQL, relational database systems, data warehouse architectures;
  • Excellent command of Excel. Familiarity with data science techniques with Python is considered an asset;
  • Actively engage in disseminating insights to relevant stakeholders in a clear and comprehensible manner;
  • Excellent ability to transfer knowledge and deliver compelling presentations/data stories to both business and technical audience;
  • Excellent, demonstrated ability to deliver presentation to both business and technical audiences;
  • Solution-oriented and accuracy to detail;
  • Ability to cope with fast changing technologies used in application developments;


Specific expertise:

  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience in report and dashboard development (e.g. Power BI);
  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience in Data Warehouse, Oracle RDMBS Database development, Data Modelling and SQL;
  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience in delivering user trainings in the context of BI solutions and self-service analytics;
  • Minimum 2 years of professional experience in deploying machine learning models in BI solutions (e.g. integration Power BI-Python or Power BI-Azure Machine Learning Studio integration);

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Company Description

Inetum is a European leader in digital services. Every day, the Group's 28,000 consultants and specialists aim to make a digital impact for businesses, public sector bodies and society as a whole: solutions that contribute to performance, innovation and the common good.

Present in 19 countries, close to the regions, and with its major software publisher partners, Inetum meets the challenges of digital transformation with proximity and flexibility.

Driven by its ambition to grow and industrialize, Inetum generated sales of €2.5 billion in 2023.

In response to a market that has been growing steadily for over 30 years, Inetum has made the deliberate choice to refocus on 4 core businesses in order to gain strength and offer customized solutions tailored to the specific needs of its customers: consulting (Inetum Consulting), infrastructure and application management (Inetum Technologies), software implementation (Inetum Solutions) and its own software publishing business (Inetum Software). Inetum has forged strategic partnerships with 4 of the world's leading software publishers - Salesforce, ServiceNow, Microsoft and SAP - and is pursuing a dedicated acquisition strategy to become one of Europe's top 5 in these technologies, and offer the best expertise to its customers.

At Inetum Belgium, we offer more than just a job; we provide an inspiring environment and opportunities for growth and development. We strive to create a workplace where you can harness your talents, contribute to challenging projects, and be part of a leading IT consultancy group.

Job Description

Within the Digital Connected Company & Innovation we focus on helping our clients unlock the value within data. In order to support our unit, we are looking for Big Data / Analytics/ AI consultants who are able to implement an End-2-End data platform.

A data platform designed and driven by business value, is able to ingest data in a proper way, can manage the data quality, can store data securely and offers possibilities for integration with client-specific platforms.

As a Data & Analytics Consultant you have experience with multiple aspects of data: from (master)data management, over big data, data lakes, data visualization to data science and machine learning. You can use data in both a traditional data context (dashboard and reports), but also use it within the modern era of big data solutions, artificial intelligence and advanced analytics.

You have experience in one or more of these domains:


You are able to listen to business people, understand their challenge and shape a data solution that brings value.
Set up data platforms and the data management (the data model, integration, authorization), with all the components needed to support the data strategy of the customer (AI capabilities, Visualization, MDM,..)
Build data science or machine learning solutions that will bring business value. Build and optimize the best possible algorithm but also a webservice or application that can be used in an operational environment
Visualize the data on the best possible way: from a cooperate dashboards, an interactive report to a full self-service environment
Set up processes and governance that will be enabler for a data-driven culture (data stewardship, golden record, data lineage,..)


Qualifications


You obtained a master’s degree in applied statistics, computer science, engineering or similar by experience
You are passionate about data and analytics technology and trends
Have at least 3 years’ experience in implementing data solution and analytics
You are fluent in Python or R
Have knowledge about data architecture, data integration, big data, data lakes, data visualization, computer vision, natural language processing, machine learning
You have experience with different data consumption techniques from traditional to more advanced analytics and AI perspective. (Power BI, Tableau, PyTorch, TensorFlow…)
Or you have hands-on experience with data platforms (e.g Azure, AWS, Google, Databricks, Boomi, Collibra, snowflake…) and are not afraid to dive into something you don’t know.
Have at least 1 year experience with Relational database technology
Have at least 1 year experience with NoSQL database technology
You have a good understanding of clustering, predictive modeling techniques and recommender systems
You have a pro-active, can-do mindset
You communicate clearly in Dutch and/or French and English (both written and spoken).


You Get Bonus Points If


You can present and defend your solutions in front of clients
You are able to organize, facilitate and lead workshops


Additional Information

Discover Your Future with Inetum Belgium


Make a Difference with a Meaningful Career: step into a role where your work truly matters. At Inetum Belgium, you’ll have the chance to impact lives and drive meaningful change every day.
Grow and Evolve Professionally: embrace a culture of continuous learning and development. We offer a range of training opportunities designed to help you expand your skills and advance your career.
Unlock Relevant Career Opportunities: pursue the career path you’ve always dreamed of with tailored opportunities and the IT expertise you need to succeed.
Achieve Work-Life Balance: we value your well-being. Enjoy flexible working hours, the convenience of satellite offices, the comfort of home working, and an informal, no-nonsense environment.
Enjoy Generous Annual Leave: life is more than just work. Take advantage of 32 days of annual leave to relax and recharge.
Travel in Comfort: forget the hassle of commuting. We provide a company car and a national fuel/charging card to keep you on the move. Prefer a different option? You can choose a mobility allowance instead.
Comprehensive Insurance Coverage: your health and security are our priorities. Benefit from group insurance and hospitalization insurance that show we care.
Attractive Compensation Package: we offer a competitive gross salary to recognize and appreciate your hard work.

Title: BI & Data Analysis Expert DIGI
Description:
At the forefront of the telecom revolution, our mission is to innovate and lead with a customer-centric, data-driven approach. As we evolve from startup to scale-up, we're enhancing our team with a Data Analyst position to support all domains of our organization from our offices in Brussels (and in some occasions in Oostkamp).

The BI & Data Analysis Expert will be crucial in supporting strategic decision-making & customer behavior through ad-hoc analysis and insights. This role is tailored for a professional skilled in translating complex business questions into data-driven solutions using a variety of internal and external data sources.

Your Key Responsibilities as a BI & Data Analysis Expert will include:


Build a data pipeline to collect data from third party applications into SQL databases.
Utilize Python and SQL to conduct comprehensive data analyses, translating business needs into actionable insights.
Create meaningful visuals to illustrate insights.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand and fulfill their data analysis needs.
Employ advanced analytical techniques to model and predict future trends (e.g. sales, finance & inventory forecasting).
Ensure data integrity and accuracy in all analyses.


Job requirements

Must Haves Qualities & Talents


Ability to cope with uncertainty and to establish foundations in a context of scaling up, demonstrating flexibility and resilience.
Experience using Looker Data Platform (not Looker Studio) is a plus.
Expertise in Python and SQL, with a proven track record in data analysis and visualization.
Strong analytical skills, capable of capturing complex requirements and delivering meaningful insights.
Excellent consulting skills, including stakeholder management, effective communication, and the flexibility to adapt to a rapidly changing environment.
Bachelor's degree in Economics, Business engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field; Master's degree is a plus.
At least 3 years of relevant experience, preferably in telecom, ecommerce, consulting or technology industries.
Proficient in English and in Dutch or French.
Demonstrated problem-solving abilities, critical thinking, and a commitment to providing actionable insights.
Ability to work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams and articulate complex data concepts in a clear, understandable manner to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience leveraging digital, logistics, geo spatial, sales, marketing, customer care and/or infrastructure data.
Skills in building data driven automation processes (e.g. module processing inputs & outputting predictions/estimations) is a plus.
Data engineering skills is a plus but can be a differentiator.
Specific experience in building Marketing Campaign & customer behavior insights (linking campaign data, Google Analytics, sales & customer care data) is a huge plus.


What We Offer

At Digi Belgium you will be part of an enthusiastic and ambitious team in which we greatly value your own input and believe in the growth of each of our employees. We offer you a great opportunity to work for a fast-growing and innovative employer that operates as a challenger in the Belgian telecom market. Next to this, we also offer a wide range of benefits, including:


Dynamic Work Environment: Dive into the bustling world of telecom at our startup! Expect a workplace that thrives on challenges and growth opportunities.
Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a rewarding package including competitive salary and different interesting benefits
Permanent Contract: Secure your future with us – enjoy the stability of a permanent contract.
Invest in Yourself: We provide ample resources for your personal and professional development. Use our generous budget to level up your skills and become even more awesome.
Contemporary Workspace: Immerse yourself in a cutting-edge office environment where innovation and collaboration reign supreme. Our central locations in Oostkamp and Brussels ensure easy accessibility.
Extra Time Off: Work hard and reap the rewards! Enjoy an extra 12 days off per year for full-time employees, making those 40-hour weeks fly by.


Application Process

Candidates are invited to send their CV along with examples of projects they have worked on by the 6th of September 2024. Be part of our mission to revolutionize the telecom industry, leveraging innovation and data to drive success. The recruitment process will include hands-on business and analytics cases to assess your skills and fit for the role.

Title: Associate Specialist, Analytics and Business Insights (Rosetta)-R-230613
Description:
Our Purpose

We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.

Title And Summary

Associate Specialist, Analytics and Business Insights (Rosetta)

Overview

The Associate specialist will be in charge of analytic and operational support of the team leader and other team members in their work. Further the candidate will own the data research and analysis in the selected areas.

The candidate will be part of the team at the heart of Mastercard Europe’s data. Analytics and Business Insights team seeks to empower everyone in Europe to use data to drive outstanding results. Main stakeholders of the team are sales and business development functions as well as European Management.

The position will enable the candidate to develop deep understanding of Mastercard’s data, data analysis and visualization, business insight creation as well as how analytics and business insights are leveraged in different areas of Mastercard’s business. As part of the team you will have exposure to Mastercard’s global network of data and analytics teams and individuals.

Role

In This Position, You Will


Perform data research and analysis at both operational and strategic levels as well as insight generation
Preparation of business insight snippets and presentations
Conduct data testing and data reconciliation
Data tools and capabilities research and study
Educate various stakeholders on data tools and capabilities
Support design, development and deployment of new data capabilities
Support and own maintenance, update and enhancement of existing data capabilities (dashboards, ETL flows, sematic models, etc)
Conduct data ETL (extract, transform, load) for various projects
Conduct operational support of Analytics and Business Insights team (e.g. intranet communications, confluence and mailbox handling, access management, stakeholders communications management, etc)
Prepare data capabilities documentation
Prepare presentations and other communications



All About You

The ideal candidate for this position should have the below profile and key requirements:


MA/MSc in math, physics, engineering, finance, economy, or computer science
Fluency in math and passion for numbers (knowledge of business statistics is a plus)
Agile and proactive thinker with curiosity to learn and eagerness to crack complex topics
Good analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to understand, create and explain complex concepts
Attention to details and diligence
Responsible and reliable
Ability to exercise ownership over assigned tasks (perception of the tasks in a broader context, ability to offer new approaches, respect of deadlines, ability to anticipate and address risks)
Good at defining problems and opportunities and finding solutions
Out of box thinking, ability and eagerness to look for non-trivial solutions
Good communication skills in all situations
Ability to work with both high level concepts and applied data points
Ability to work independently and handling different projects at the same time, stress resistant
Good team player
Experience with any of the following tools is a plus: Power BI, Alteryx, SSIS, SQL, Python
Software development experience is a plus (either professionally or as a hobby)
Strong PC User (Excel (with modelling), PowerPoint, etc)
Fluency in English



Corporate Security Responsibility

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:


Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.



R-230613

Title: Data Analyst (Product)
Description:
Who we are:

Omni Calculator is a Polish tech company that helps solve real-life problems using science, numbers, and equations, thus making rational decisions. Our main product, the web application omnicalculator.com, contains over 3700 custom-built calculators co-created by experts in various fields of science. It is visited over 20 million times a month. Media outlets such as The New York Times, National Geographic, The Guardian, and The Washington Post featured our calculators.

Role overview:

We are looking for a Data Analyst (Product) who will play a key role in driving data-driven decision-making across the product teams and senior leadership. By employing GA4 and Looker, you will create and produce data visualizations and reports that will be instrumental in reporting important metrics like traffic, revenue, and product success, as well as metrics that influence the product.

You will take responsibility and ownership of the company’s data analysis structure policy, effective event tracking on all products, and working out event tracking requirements with Product Managers and Engineering teams.

Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain data visualizations and reports in GA4 and Looker to support Product Managers and Senior Leadership Team in decision-making.
Oversee and enhance the company's data analysis framework to ensure accuracy and efficiency.
Manage key reports such as traffic, revenue, and other business-critical metrics.
Maintain a comprehensive data dictionary detailing metrics, sources, and definitions for easy reference.
Educate the organization on fundamental data analytics concepts.
Collaborate with the Data Engineer on technical requirements for data source integration within Looker.
Ensure comprehensive event tracking coverage across all products.
Partner with Product Managers to define and refine tracking requirements.
Work closely with Engineering teams to clarify event tracking needs.
Assist Product Managers in building reports that measure and track the success of product launches.

Requirements:

Skilled in GA4, Looker, and SQL for data analysis and reporting.
Knowledge of A/B test design, with a focus on determining statistical significance, audience size, and experiment duration.
Experience supporting Management with data-driven insights and strategic decision-making.
Strong collaboration with engineering teams to implement and optimize data tracking and reporting solutions.
Due to GDPR, you must be located in the EU

Employment terms:

Contract type of your choosing - B2B or Contract of Employment (available only for candidates based in Poland)
The first contract will be signed for six months
Salary (monthly):
EURO: 2 340 - 3 740 net B2B
PLN (Poland-located employees): 10 000 - 16 000 net B2B or 8 500 - 13 500 gross CoE
Work equipment such as a laptop or headphones
Flexible working schedule, fully remote or hybrid, with the possibility of working from our office location in Poland: Mikołajska St. in Kraków

Benefits:

Multisport card (if you are in Poland)
Training budget of 5000 PLN per year
Private medical care (if you are in Poland)

Recruitment process:

We will ask you to complete a recruitment task.
An introduction call with the recruiter during which you will learn more about the position (30-40 mins).
A 90-minute call with the Head of Product and a Senior Product Analyst to learn about your experience and tech skills required for the position (90 minutes).
A 90-minute call with the Head of HR and COO to delve deeper into your background and assess cultural alignment (90 minutes).
Finally, we may ask you for a reference from your former supervisors.

If that sounds interesting, do not hesitate to apply! If you have any questions, contact us at careers@omnicalculator.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Roles & Responsibilities




In the context of a data migration project, DynaFin, is currently seeking a Data Analyst to be the bridge between business stakeholders and data engineers. In this role, you will play a critical part in ensuring data-driven decision-making and optimizing data processes within the organization.




Why DynaFin?




At DynaFin, you will thrive in an environment that values innovation and continuous growth. You will take part in a wide range of projects at different financial institutions, gaining invaluable experience and developing professionally.




Your Missions:




Conduct comprehensive data analysis in a dynamic and complex environment, ensuring accuracy and relevance.
Document analysis findings clearly and communicate them effectively to relevant stakeholders and team members.
Elicit and gather user requirements, balancing both user needs and technical constraints of the target application, while also considering the data available in source systems.
Write a feasibility study: high-level architecture of how data will be delivered, what the requirements are, service level agreements, etc.
Describe functional mapping to objectives.
Model and define transformation rules to meet organizational needs and requirements.
Assist and participate in data validation and cleansing to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the chain.
Provide reports that enable the 'business' to make decisions.







Profile




• You have a Master's degree in economics, finance, mathematics, law, or computer science,

• You have between 3 and 5 years of experience in analysing data (such as customer-centric data, reference data, transactional data, accounting data,...).

• You are fluent in English and French.

• Knowledge of the (private) banking sector.

• Very good knowledge of SQL and database objects.

• Knowledge of Data Modeling

• Experience with Agile methodologies.

• Python/Pyspark, PowerBI/Tableau, Excel

• Soft Skills: motivated, excellent communicator, autonomous, analytical mind, time management skills, team spirit, proactive.




Offer




• Start date: mid-November 2024.

• Homeworking: 2 days per week and 3 days in the Brussels office.




Interested? Join our team of experts and become a pillar of our success in the banking and insurance sector. Apply now to start a rewarding adventure at DynaFin.







About Dynafin Consulting




DynaFin Consulting is a human-sized, flexible consulting company delivering services in the Financial Services Industry. Our company consists of more than 200 committed consultants in several business domains: Invest – Payments – Credits – Insurance – Data - Risk & Compliance.

In 14 years, we have become a reference in the Belgian Financial Services landscape. In July 2017, we joined the Alan Allman Associates ecosystem, adding the international dimension to our ambitions.

Title: BUSINESS DATA ANALYST
Description:
Dark Light specializes in the temporary deployment of talented professionals for data and business intelligence projects. We are currently seeking a Business Data Analyst for one of our major clients, a key player in the Financial landscape.

Tasks


Ability to perform in-depth data analyses in a dynamic and complex environment
Ability to document and communicate analysis results with colleagues
Gather user needs, considering the requirements of the target system and the data present in the source systems
Assignments with both functional and technical aspects
Knowledge of private banking
Thorough knowledge of SQL
Proficiency in French and English
Team player
Good communication skills with IT colleagues and users


Requirements


1-4 years of experience (junior/medior)
Experience in the banking sector (understanding of the banking industry & CRM – customer data)
SQL & Excel proficiency
Ability to communicate with technical profiles
Must be able to work independently


Benefits


Hybrid work
Freelance contract of one year (plus extensions)
Remuneration in line with experience

Title: BI & Data Analysis Expert DIGI
Description:
At the forefront of the telecom revolution, our mission is to innovate and lead with a customer-centric, data-driven approach. As we evolve from startup to scale-up, we're enhancing our team with a Data Analyst position to support all domains of our organization from our offices in Brussels (and in some occasions in Oostkamp).

The BI & Data Analysis Expert will be crucial in supporting strategic decision-making & customer behavior through ad-hoc analysis and insights. This role is tailored for a professional skilled in translating complex business questions into data-driven solutions using a variety of internal and external data sources.

Your Key Responsibilities as a BI & Data Analysis Expert will include:


Build a data pipeline to collect data from third party applications into SQL databases.
Utilize Python and SQL to conduct comprehensive data analyses, translating business needs into actionable insights.
Create meaningful visuals to illustrate insights.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand and fulfill their data analysis needs.
Employ advanced analytical techniques to model and predict future trends (e.g. sales, finance & inventory forecasting).
Ensure data integrity and accuracy in all analyses.


Job requirements

Must Haves Qualities & Talents


Ability to cope with uncertainty and to establish foundations in a context of scaling up, demonstrating flexibility and resilience.
Experience using Looker Data Platform (not Looker Studio) is a plus.
Expertise in Python and SQL, with a proven track record in data analysis and visualization.
Strong analytical skills, capable of capturing complex requirements and delivering meaningful insights.
Excellent consulting skills, including stakeholder management, effective communication, and the flexibility to adapt to a rapidly changing environment.
Bachelor's degree in Economics, Business engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field; Master's degree is a plus.
At least 3 years of relevant experience, preferably in telecom, ecommerce, consulting or technology industries.
Proficient in English and in Dutch or French.
Demonstrated problem-solving abilities, critical thinking, and a commitment to providing actionable insights.
Ability to work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams and articulate complex data concepts in a clear, understandable manner to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience leveraging digital, logistics, geo spatial, sales, marketing, customer care and/or infrastructure data.
Skills in building data driven automation processes (e.g. module processing inputs & outputting predictions/estimations) is a plus.
Data engineering skills is a plus but can be a differentiator.
Specific experience in building Marketing Campaign & customer behavior insights (linking campaign data, Google Analytics, sales & customer care data) is a huge plus.


What We Offer

At Digi Belgium you will be part of an enthusiastic and ambitious team in which we greatly value your own input and believe in the growth of each of our employees. We offer you a great opportunity to work for a fast-growing and innovative employer that operates as a challenger in the Belgian telecom market. Next to this, we also offer a wide range of benefits, including:


Dynamic Work Environment: Dive into the bustling world of telecom at our startup! Expect a workplace that thrives on challenges and growth opportunities.
Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a rewarding package including competitive salary and different interesting benefits
Permanent Contract: Secure your future with us – enjoy the stability of a permanent contract.
Invest in Yourself: We provide ample resources for your personal and professional development. Use our generous budget to level up your skills and become even more awesome.
Contemporary Workspace: Immerse yourself in a cutting-edge office environment where innovation and collaboration reign supreme. Our central locations in Oostkamp and Brussels ensure easy accessibility.
Extra Time Off: Work hard and reap the rewards! Enjoy an extra 12 days off per year for full-time employees, making those 40-hour weeks fly by.


Application Process

Candidates are invited to send their CV along with examples of projects they have worked on by the 6th of September 2024. Be part of our mission to revolutionize the telecom industry, leveraging innovation and data to drive success. The recruitment process will include hands-on business and analytics cases to assess your skills and fit for the role.
Show more

Title: Internal Controls Data Analyst
Description:
Make your mark for patients

To strengthen our Group Accounting, Tax and Treasury team, based at our HQ, in Brussels, Belgium, we are looking for a talented individual to fill the position of Internal Controls Data Analyst.

About The Role

The Global Internal Control function operates as an independent function but supports the operations/line management in building and maintaining efficient and effective internal control process/system. It also monitors compliance of finance processes, systems, and its operations in accordance with UCB policies and procedures in coordination with audit functions. We are expanding our scope to non-financial reporting (namely Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) / Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD)).


Internal Controls Data Analyst will play a critical role in ensuring the integrity, efficiency, and compliance of our financial processes as well as non-financial reporting (ESG/CSRD).
Responsible and accountable for connection of data sources, analysis and answering business questions via consistent and auditable methods.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance our control environment and influence system setups.
Reports to Head of Internal Controls


What You’ll Do


Extract and interpret financial and non-financial data to uncover trends and areas for improvement.
Translate complex data into actionable insights for informed decision-making.
Proactively engage stakeholders to understand business needs and develop meaningful reports.
Create dashboards to provide valuable information for management and audit purposes.
Assess existing controls and processes, identifying gaps and inefficiencies.
Recommend enhancements based on data findings to optimize procedures.


Interested? For this position you’ll need the following education, experience and skills:


Bachelor's degree required; minimum 5 years of finance process experience in a global organization, preferably in pharma/biopharma.
Minimum 3-4 years of relevant experience in data analytics; experience in ESG reporting is advantageous.
Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R) and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, QlikSense).
Knowledge of finance, accounting, and auditing principles; familiarity with industry internal control standards such as COSO.
Understanding of financial processes (S2P, O2C, R2R, Master Data, Tax) and their risks & controls, including interfaces with other functional areas.
Strong analytical skills, proactive mindset, excellent stakeholder management, negotiation skills, and proven leadership ability within a global organization.


Why you should apply

Do you want to contribute in bringing real value to patients living with severe diseases while driving innovation forward?

Join UCB’s dynamic, inspiring and innovative environment and team. You will be recognized for impactful performance via a competitive compensation and benefits package and you will enjoy ample personal development opportunities.

Tell us what makes you the perfect match to our team and join one of the most dynamic & forward looking IT organizations in the world.

Are you ready to ‘go beyond’ to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

Are you ready to ‘go beyond’ to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!

About Us

UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.

Why work with us?

At UCB, we don’t just complete tasks, we create value. We aren’t afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected, and has equitable opportunities to do their best work. We ‘go beyond’ to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that’s on our patients, our employees, or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.

UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity and inclusion in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race/color/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity.

Should you require any adjustments to our process to assist you in demonstrating your strengths and capabilities contact us on on EMEA-Reasonable_Accommodation@ucb.com . Please note should your enquiry not relate to adjustments; we will not be able to support you through this channel.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Roles & Responsibilities




In the context of a data migration project, DynaFin, is currently seeking a Data Analyst to be the bridge between business stakeholders and data engineers. In this role, you will play a critical part in ensuring data-driven decision-making and optimizing data processes within the organization.




Why DynaFin?




At DynaFin, you will thrive in an environment that values innovation and continuous growth. You will take part in a wide range of projects at different financial institutions, gaining invaluable experience and developing professionally.




Your Missions:




Conduct comprehensive data analysis in a dynamic and complex environment, ensuring accuracy and relevance.
Document analysis findings clearly and communicate them effectively to relevant stakeholders and team members.
Elicit and gather user requirements, balancing both user needs and technical constraints of the target application, while also considering the data available in source systems.
Write a feasibility study: high-level architecture of how data will be delivered, what the requirements are, service level agreements, etc.
Describe functional mapping to objectives.
Model and define transformation rules to meet organizational needs and requirements.
Assist and participate in data validation and cleansing to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the chain.
Provide reports that enable the 'business' to make decisions.







Profile




• You have a Master's degree in economics, finance, mathematics, law, or computer science,

• You have between 3 and 5 years of experience in analysing data (such as customer-centric data, reference data, transactional data, accounting data,...).

• You are fluent in English and French.

• Knowledge of the (private) banking sector.

• Very good knowledge of SQL and database objects.

• Knowledge of Data Modeling

• Experience with Agile methodologies.

• Python/Pyspark, PowerBI/Tableau, Excel

• Soft Skills: motivated, excellent communicator, autonomous, analytical mind, time management skills, team spirit, proactive.




Offer




• Start date: mid-November 2024.

• Homeworking: 2 days per week and 3 days in the Brussels office.




Interested? Join our team of experts and become a pillar of our success in the banking and insurance sector. Apply now to start a rewarding adventure at DynaFin.







About Dynafin Consulting




DynaFin Consulting is a human-sized, flexible consulting company delivering services in the Financial Services Industry. Our company consists of more than 200 committed consultants in several business domains: Invest – Payments – Credits – Insurance – Data - Risk & Compliance.

In 14 years, we have become a reference in the Belgian Financial Services landscape. In July 2017, we joined the Alan Allman Associates ecosystem, adding the international dimension to our ambitions.
