Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

As a Data Analyst at Sopra Steria, you will play a pivotal role in guiding clients from various industries through their dynamic data journey. You will assist clients in transforming their data processes. By thoroughly analysing and understanding customer needs, you’ll match their requirements with meaningful data solutions. Your innovative approach will enable you to generate impactful analyses that deliver efficient, user-focused solutions. Through your expertise and advice across the data value chain, you’ll ensure the successful implementation and support of Sopra Steria’s diverse portfolio of data services.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:


You help customers in their data transformation, focusing on data architecture, data strategy and governance, data transformation, data foundation, and more
You engage with customers about their needs and understand their business requirements
You collect and analyze data
You match customer demand with meaningful data
You create analyses which generate efficient and effective user solutions
Based on your advice across the entire data value chain, you ensure that Sopra Steria’s portfolio of relevant data services is implemented and supported
You have at least 2 years of data analysis and design experience
You are proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.


What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe’s largest digital solutions providers, you’ll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you’ll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You’ll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.  

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

  • Support ing data/reporting governance roll-out and operations (e.g. DQ monitoring, supporting stewards/power users, SLA discussion) .

Additional information: If you are interested, for further information, please contact the point of contact for this offer.

VECTOR SYNERGY sp. z o.o., ul. Marcelińska 90, 60-324 Poznań, NIP PL7811857270, REGON 301575740, KRS: 0000369575

Rejestr Przedsiębiorców KRS prowadzony przez Sąd Rejonowy Poznań – Nowe Miasto i Wilda w Poznaniu, VIII Wydział Gospodarczy KRS, kapitał zakładowy wynosi: 73.852,80 złotych wpłacony w całości, TEL +48 616684500, FAX +48 616684501, www.vectorsynergy.com , info@vectorsynergy.com

Title: Data-analist (M/V/X)
Description:
Fedasil kent materiële hulp toe aan verzoekers om internationale bescherming en aan andere vreemdelingen die recht hebben op opvang (‘Opvangwet’ van 12 januari 2007). Het Agentschap organiseert, rechtstreeks of via zijn partners, kwaliteitsvolle opvang en begeleiding en staat ook in voor de observatie en oriëntatie van niet-begeleide minderjarige vreemdelingen (de 'NBMV'). Fedasil coördineert de organisatie van vrijwillige terugkeer naar de herkomstlanden. Het Agentschap ondersteunt de uitwerking en voorbereiding van het opvangbeleid en wil bijdragen aan een correcte beeldvorming, de maatschappelijke aanvaarding en de uitvoering van een rechtvaardig migratiebeleid.

Fedasil zoekt een:

Data-analist (M/V/X)

voor de directie Strategie & Organisatie

Interne & externe/ werfreserve selectie

Referentienummer: 9110/164

FUNCTIE

Doel

Als data-analist bij de dienst Data & Analyse (D&A) sta je mee in voor de ontwikkeling, de uitvoering en de opvolging van rapporten aangaande de begeleidingstrajecten van de verzoekers om internationale bescherming. Het is de taak van D&A om aan de hand van analyses trends, patronen en risico’s te identificeren en te signaleren. Op deze manier ondersteunt Data & Analyse de verschillende beslissingsorganen binnen Fedasil bij het nemen van data-drive beslissingen.

Context

De dienst Data & Analyse controleert, rapporteert en analyseert kwantitatieve en kwalitatieve gegevens over het opvangnetwerk en de andere opdrachten van Fedasil. D&A levert rapporten en analyses op, zowel ‘gestandaardiseerde’ op geregelde tijdstippen als ‘ad-hoc’ op vraag van stakeholders binnen en buiten de organisatie. Binnen het team is er differentie tussen teamleden zowel op vlak van inhoudelijke vragen als op vlak van technische specialiteiten (azure, powerBi, python). Het team van data-analisten werkt in nauw contact met elkaar om zowel voor de verdeling van vragen en taken als om complexe vragen te beantwoorden. Elke data-analist onderhoudt contacten met verschillende actoren binnen het netwerk. Elke data-analist neemt deel en draagt bij aan het opstellen van opvolgingstools en helpt de medewerkers van de verschillende diensten binnen Fedasil om de werking van deze diensten te verbeteren en dit in functie van de behoeften van het opvangnetwerk.

Inhoud

Je takenpakket als A1 data-analist valt uiteen in twee luiken: databeheer & verwerking, dienstverlening naar klanten toe en team organisatie.

Databeheer:


Je staat in voor het goede beheer van data en zorgt ervoor dat ze beschikbaar en toegankelijk zijn.
Je werkt mee aan verschillende projecten inzake de verbetering van databases en kernprocessen in samenspraak met de collega’s van de diensten Data & Analyse.
Je behandelt en bestudeert de gegevens die werden verzameld. Je analyseert de verbanden tussen de variabelen om tendensen en hun potentiële impact vast te stellen.
Je maakt voorspellingen aan de hand van statistische modellen.
Je signaleert hiaten in de dataverzameling/dataprocessen.



Dienstverlening:


Je stelt rapporten en presentaties op en geeft hierbij indien nodig de vereiste toelichting.
Je antwoordt op vragen van interne en externe klanten, je begrijpt of probeert het kader van waaruit de vragen komen te begrijpen.



PROFIEL

Je hebt een bijzondere interesse voor Fedasil, zijn werking, waarden en doelgroep. Voor meer info: raadpleeg www.fedasil.be

Diploma en ervaring


Je bezit een master/licentiaatsdiploma (universitair of hoger onderwijs van het lange type van 2de cyclus).
Je hebt reeds minimaal 1 jaar werkervaring als data-analist, liefst in de context van migratie.



Vereisten

Technische competenties


Een goede kennis van MS Excel is noodzakelijk.
Ervaring met Microsoft PowerBI is absoluut noodzakelijk.
Algemene kennis over de werking van relationele databanken, SQL is absoluut noodzakelijk.
Kennis over Azure is een meerwaarde.
Kennis over Python is een meerwaarde.



Troeven


Je beheerst één van de landstalen en je kan je uitdrukken in de andere landstaal.



Kennis


Je hebt uitgebreide kennis over asiel, migratie en opvang van asielzoekers.
Uitgebreide kennis over Fedasil is een meerwaarde (vervangingscontract)



Generieke competenties


Informatie integreren: leggen van verbanden tussen verschillende gegevens, genereren van alternatieven en trekken van sluitende conclusies.
Medewerkers motiveren: erkennen van de kwaliteiten van de medewerkers, hen stimuleren in het nemen van initiatieven door hen verantwoordelijkheden toe te kennen en de eigen leiderschapsstijl aan hen aan te passen.
Objectieven behalen: beschikken over de inzet, de wil en de ambitie om resultaten te boeken en de verantwoordelijkheid op zich nemen voor de correctheid van ondernomen acties.
Adviseren: advies geven aan zijn/haar gesprekspartners en een vertrouwensband met hen opbouwen op basis van zijn/haar expertise.
Je bent in staat om verbanden te leggen tussen verschillende gegevens, alternatieven te bedenken, gepaste conclusies te trekken en gerichte acties te ondernemen om genomen beslissingen uit te voeren. Je werkt bovendien zorgvuldig en nauwkeurig.
Je hebt goede communicatievaardigheden. Je bent in staat een netwerk uit te bouwen en te onderhouden.
Je handelt integer, overeenkomstig de verwachtingen van de organisatie, je respecteert de vertrouwelijkheid en je vermijdt elke vorm van partijdigheid.



Troeven

Je bent vertrouwd met het werken in een multidisciplinair team en/of in een residentiële setting.

Je hebt ervaring met projectbeheer en procesverbetering.

Je spreekt Engels en/of andere vreemde talen, je spreekt Frans in geval van vacature in Brussel.

AANBOD

Type overeenkomst

Een voltijds vervangingscontract (38u/week). Er wordt telkens een werfreserve aangelegd voor alle type arbeidsovereenkomsten voor de duur van minstens 2 jaar. De aangelegde werfreserve kan ook door andere opvangcentra gebruikt worden.

Categorie A: Administratief uurrooster met vaste en variabele uren en prestaties van 7u36 per dag, van maandag tot vrijdag.

Plaats van tewerkstelling

FEDASIL - Hoofdzetel

21 Kartuizersstraat

1000 Brussel

Loon

Je wordt aangeworven op het niveau NA11 met de loonschaal die voor jou van toepassing is. Het minimum bruto maandsalaris bedraagt €3. 793, 81 (startsalaris zonder anciënniteit op basis van een voltijdse arbeidsovereenkomst, aan de huidige index). Dit bedrag kan variëren in functie van uw nuttig geachte beroepservaring (startloon zonder anciënniteit op basis van een voltijdse arbeidsovereenkomst, aan de huidige index). Voor meer inlichtingen, raadpleeg https://bosa.belgium.be/nl

Voordelen

26 vakantiedagen per jaar (direct bij indiensttreding en in verhouding tot de prestaties en het werkregime).

Gratis openbaar vervoer voor woon-werkverkeer.

Mogelijkheid tot fietsvergoeding voor woon-werkverkeer.

Maaltijdcheques en voordelige aanbiedingen met een Federale kortingskaart.

Voordelige hospitalisatieverzekering en diverse sociale voordelen.

Valorisatie van nuttige werkervaring.

Heel wat opleidingsmogelijkheden (te volgen tijdens de werkuren).

Aanvullend pensioen in de vorm van een groepsverzekering.

Mogelijkheid tot telewerken.

ZIN OM TE SOLLICITEREN?

Solliciteer tegen ten laatste 13/10/2024 voor MIDDERNACHT door het kandidatenformulier in te vullen via de link "solliciteren" onderaan de vacature. Om in overweging genomen te worden, moet uw kandidatuurdossier het volgende bevatten:


een motivatiebrief
een gedetailleerd CV (waarmee we diplomavoorwaarden en ervaring kunnen beoordelen)
een kopie van het vereiste diploma



Buitenlands diploma

Indien je het vereiste diploma in het buitenland hebt behaald, moet je een gelijkwaardigheidsattest toevoegen, uitgereikt door NARIC-Vlaanderen. Voor meer informatie, raadpleeg www.naricvlaanderen.be. Voor vacatures in Brussel, zie ook www.equivalences.cfwb.be

Kennis van het Nederlands

Je hebt een diploma in het Nederlands, uitgereikt door een Belgische onderwijsinstelling of van een ander land in zoverre het onderwijs in het Nederlands verliep. Zoniet, moet je het bewijs toevoegen dat je geslaagd bent voor een taalexamen Nederlands van Bosa. Voor meer informatie, raadpleeg www.werkenvoor.be

Juridische attesten

Als je weerhouden bent voor de functie, zullen we een bewijs van goed gedrag en zeden (uittreksel van het strafblad) algemeen model en model 2 vragen.

Je moet voldoen aan de wetgeving inzake de toegang tot het Belgische grondgebied en de arbeidsvergunningen. Indien je geen Belgisch staatsburger bent, moet je de gepaste documenten voorleggen wanneer je weerhouden bent voor de functie.

Diversiteit

Fedasil wil diversiteit bevorderen en wil onder andere personen met een handicap aanmoedigen om te solliciteren. Indien je een handicap hebt, kan je een redelijke aanpassing vragen van de selectieprocedure. Gelieve in dit geval vooraf de selectieverantwoordelijke te informeren.

SELECTIEPROCEDURE

Voorselectie

De selectiecommissie bestudeert alle kandidaturen. De preselectie gebeurt op basis van je kandidatuurdossier (CV en motivatiebrief, diploma + gelijkstelling en attest indien nodig). Alleen de kandidaten waarvan het profiel het meest aansluit bij de functievereisten zullen worden uitgenodigd voor een selectiegesprek.

Selectie

De selectie bestaat uit een schriftelijke test en een gesprek en zal plaatsvinden op 18/10/24. Van de kandidaten die geschikt worden bevonden, wordt de kandidatuur voor de duur van 2 jaar in een wervingsreserve bijgehouden. Deze wervingsreserve kan door andere opvangcentra geraadpleegd worden. Kandidaten die niet geslaagd zijn, kunnen gedurende 6 maanden niet meer deelnemen aan een nieuwe procedure voor een gelijkaardige functie op hetzelfde niveau.

Alle bijkomende informatie kan verkregen worden bij mateus.bontor@fedasil.be (selectieverantwoordelijke).

Title: Data Mining Analyst
Description:
Description




En tant que Data Mining Analyst, vous fournissez, au management, des solutions basées sur des données destinées à faciliter la prise de décision (via le machine learning et le data mining).




Vous transformez, enrichissez et archivez des données business opérationnelles.




Vous participez à la définition des objectifs business du data mining. Vous pouvez ainsi guider les Information/Business Analysts dans leur traduction des besoins business.




Vous êtes également en charge de l'implémentation d'un modèle de data mining : vous transformez les données et faites de l'exploration de données.




Vous développez des modèles et assurez leur implémentation, leur maintenance, leur évaluation et leur optimisation.




Enfin, vous êtes impliqué dans des projets spécifiques (ex. : environnement de travail cloud) ou dans l'analyse de la fraude, en collaboration avec le service Concurrence loyale.




Profil




Titulaire d’un diplôme de master, vous disposez de plusieurs années d'expérience dans une fonction similaire.
Vous avez une bonne connaissance des techniques de machine learning et d'IA (cf. analyse de données). Vous possédez également un bon bagage en matière de statistiques, avec une connaissance active des modèles analytiques.
Vous êtes passionné par SQL et les bases de données. Vous maîtrisez Python.
Votre connaissance de KNIME ou d'applications similaires constitue un plus.
Vous avez le sens de la communication et êtes capable de communiquer aisément avec différents interlocuteurs.
Vous avez un esprit analytique et privilégiez une approche structurée.
Vous pouvez travailler efficacement de manière autonome, mais appréciez également le travail en équipe.
Enfin, vous possédez une connaissance passive du néerlandais.
Show more

Title: Onderzoeker en data-analist
Description:
De studiedienst volgt de evolutie van de gezondheidstoestand van de bevolking op en analyseert het socialezekerheidsstelsel. Binnen CM draagt ze bij aan de ontwikkeling van een langetermijnvisie op het gebied van gezondheid en (maatschappelijk) welzijn. De Studiedienst is verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren van de evoluties in de gezondheidszorg door middel van verkennende studies en ad-hoc analyses.




Dit zoeken we




Jouw opdrachten als onderzoeker en data-analist :

Je volgt thema’s op gerelateerd aan de economische aspecten van de gezondheidszorg en kan de vragen van de organisatie hierover beantwoorden.
Je bent in staat om gegevensextracties te doen en kwantitatief onderzoek uit te voeren op basis van deze gegevens.
Je voert budgettaire en economische gezondheidsgerelateerde analyses uit.
Je draagt bij aan de kennisopbouw van CM op het gebied van gezondheid.
Je werkt mee aan de onderzoeksprojecten van CM, in functie van de noden.
Je analyseert je onderzoeksresultaten kritisch en synthetiseert ze in een wetenschappelijk rapport. Je formuleert ook concrete aanbevelingen voor de directie.
Je deelt de resultaten van de studies op overtuigende wijze mee aan de verschillende doelgroepen (beleidsmakers, zorgverleners, burgers, enz.).
Je werkt je kennis en vaardigheden bij en werkt mee aan de ontwikkeling van de onderzoeksprocessen van CM.




Dit ben jij




Je hebt minimum een masterdiploma. Ervaring op het gebied van economie, volksgezondheid, gezondheidsbeleid, sociologie of statistiek is een troef.
Je beschikt over relevante werkervaring inzake kwantitatief onderzoek.
Je beschikt over relevante werkervaring inzake economische of budgettaire analyses, bij voorkeur in het domein van gezondheid.
Een kennis van de wetgeving op het vlak van gegevensbeheer is een troef.
Je bent in staat om gegevens te analyseren: kennis van SAS of python is een troef.
Je bent bereid om je kennis over de invaliditeits- en ziektekostenverzekering en over de verschillende aspecten van het gezondheidsbeleid te verdiepen.
Je bent een dynamische collega die ideeën aanbrengt en zich inzet voor de projecten van de dienst. Je hecht veel belang aan de resultaten van teamwerk.
Je bent ervan overtuigd dat solidariteit en universele toegang tot zorg belangrijke waarden zijn van het gezondheidsstelsel van ons land.
Je bent in staat om zelfstandig te werken en initiatief te nemen.
Je kan analytisch en kritisch denken.
Je hebt een uitstekende kennis van het Nederlands of het Frans, en je hebt een goed begrip van de andere taal.
Je hebt minimum een passieve kennis van het Engels.




Dit bieden we je




We bieden jou een voltijds contract van onbepaalde duur.

Je werkplaats bevindt zich in het hoofdkantoor van de Christelijke Mutualiteit (Haachtsesteenweg 579 – 1031 Schaarbeek).




Bij CM heeft je werk een belangrijke maatschappelijke impact. Je maakt immers dagelijks het verschil voor onze leden. Zo kan je rekenen op een competitief en veelzijdig loonpakket. Bovendien krijg je de kans om werk en privé mooi in evenwicht te houden. Maar er is meer. Want wie dat wil, kan hier heel wat kansen grijpen. We bieden je tal van opleidingen en ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden. Je krijgt de ruimte om initiatief te nemen. En je werkt mee aan uitdagende projecten. Wees er maar zeker van dat je nooit ter plaatse zult blijven trappelen. Zoals elke CM-collega zal je al snel tot de conclusie komen: Bij ons leeft het!

Show more
HTML:
De studiedienst volgt de evolutie van de gezondheidstoestand van de bevolking op en analyseert het socialezekerheidsstelsel. Binnen CM draagt ze bij aan de ontwikkeling van een langetermijnvisie op het gebied van gezondheid en (maatschappelijk) welzijn. De Studiedienst is verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren van de evoluties in de gezondheidszorg door middel van verkennende studies en ad-hoc analyses.

  • Je beschikt over relevante werkervaring inzake kwantitatief onderzoek.

  • Je bent in staat om zelfstandig te werken en initiatief te nemen.

Je werkplaats bevindt zich in het hoofdkantoor van de Christelijke Mutualiteit (Haachtsesteenweg 579 – 1031 Schaarbeek).

Title: Freelance Data Engineer
Description:
WHAT WOULD YOU DO?




In your role as a Data Engineer you provide insights and solutions for complex data problems in order to implement end-to-end data solutions. You are responsible for the implementation and maintenance of the Data Warehouse and ETL infrastructure, where you will transform data into useful data formats for analysis. As a Data Engineer you will come across many varied and challenging projects: ranging from the design and implementation of the data warehouse and the development of ETL to the implementation and maintenance of reports and dashboards.




WHO ARE YOU?




You understand the needs of the customer and can easily handle complex data environments.
You are focused on collaboration, innovation and continuous improvement.
You have strong communication skills and always strive for the best solution.
You have an inquisitive mind and eager to learn.
You are fluent in Dutch or French and have a strong knowledge of English.




WHAT ABOUT YOUR TECHNICAL SKILLS?




Knowledge and hands-on experience with ETL and Data pipelines to integrate multiple data sources
Experience with Data Warehouse environments
Insights in setting up ETL processes and Data Flows
Development and testing of ETL jobs
Solid programming skills and SQL querying experience
Hands-on experience with ETL tools is a plus
Knowledge of Data Vault, Kimball is a plus
Knowledge of Oracle, Google BigQuery or Microsoft Azure is a plus




ls dedicated freelance-resource contact zorgen we voor een snelle, flexibele en persoonlijke aanpak. Onze samenwerking is gebaseerd op respect, vertrouwen en continuïteit.

We hebben steeds rechtstreeks contact met de opdrachtgever, een project wordt altijd op voorhand besproken met de freelancer.




Wil je meer info of gewoon een gesprek?

Neem snel contact op.




recruitment@fieldside.be of diana.dierckx@fieldside.be

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Your responsibilities and skills include:

Contributing to the design and implementation of the Azure data platform.
Developing and deploying end-to-end data applications using the Azure data platform.
Demonstrating experience with Azure data analytics services such as Data Factory, ADLS, Synapse, SQL Server, Databricks, and ML.
Proficiency in data technologies like Spark, Python/Pandas, and SQL.
Applying knowledge of modern software engineering practices and tools (e.g., Git, CI/CD, testing, Pipelines, Bitbucket, Jenkins, Azure DevOps).
Familiarity with Infrastructure-as-Code tools such as Terraform.
Collaborating with Data Architects and Platform Architects to ensure alignment with requirements and architecture.
Coordinating with Security & Infrastructure teams to ensure data assets and products are well-integrated and secure.
Working independently, effectively managing priorities across multiple stakeholders and tasks.
Contributing to the establishment of standards, guidelines, and best practices, ensuring adherence to them.
Staying informed of the latest trends and technologies, and assessing their potential impact on your work.

Show more

Your responsibilities and skills include:

  • Contributing to the design and implementation of the Azure data platform.
  • Developing and deploying end-to-end data applications using the Azure data platform.
  • Demonstrating experience with Azure data analytics services such as Data Factory, ADLS, Synapse, SQL Server, Databricks, and ML.
  • Proficiency in data technologies like Spark, Python/Pandas, and SQL.
  • Applying knowledge of modern software engineering practices and tools (e.g., Git, CI/CD, testing, Pipelines, Bitbucket, Jenkins, Azure DevOps).
  • Familiarity with Infrastructure-as-Code tools such as Terraform.
  • Collaborating with Data Architects and Platform Architects to ensure alignment with requirements and architecture.
  • Coordinating with Security & Infrastructure teams to ensure data assets and products are well-integrated and secure.
  • Working independently, effectively managing priorities across multiple stakeholders and tasks.
  • Contributing to the establishment of standards, guidelines, and best practices, ensuring adherence to them.
  • Staying informed of the latest trends and technologies, and assessing their potential impact on your work.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
My client a large organisation based in Anderlecht are looking for a Data Engineer for a pivitole role within there team.

As Data Engineer within our Data & Analytics team, you play an instrumental role in the realization of this vision by building our data platform.




Main responsibilities and skills are the following:

• You contribute to the design and implementation of the Azure data platform.

•You develop and deploy end-to-end data applications leveraging the Azure data platform.

• You have experience with Azure data analytics services (Data Factory, ADLS, Synapse, SQL Server, Databricks, ML).

• You are familiar with data technologies (spark, python/pandas, SQL).

• You have knowledge of state-of-the-art software engineering best practices and tools (Git, CI/CD, tests, Pipelines, Bitbucket, Jenkins, Azure DevOps).

• You are familiar with Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform).

• You work with Data Architects and Platform Architects to ensure your work is aligned with the requirements and architecture.

• You work with the Security & Infrastructure teams to ensure data assets and data products are integrated and secured.

• You work independently, prioritize multiple stakeholders and tasks, and manage work time effectively.

• You participate to the definition of standards, guidelines and best practices and make sure to respect them.

• You remain up to date with latest trends and technologies and identify potential impact of market trends in your tasks




For more info please send cv to george.diangelo@regensolutions.co.uk

Description:

Ben jij een senior business analyst met affiniteit voor de financiële sector en data-gerelateerde projecten? Heb je sterke communicatieve vaardigheden in Nederlands, Frans én Engels en ben je op zoek naar je volgende uitdaging?

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Data Engineer to join our team in the financial industry on a full-time, permanent contract (CDI). You will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing scalable data pipelines and infrastructure that support critical data solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain efficient data pipelines to support analytics and reporting functions.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and stakeholders to ensure smooth data flow across systems.
Ensure data quality, security, and compliance with financial industry regulations.
Optimize data architectures for performance and scalability.
Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines to ensure uninterrupted operations.
Implement ETL processes and contribute to the development of data warehousing solutions.




Qualifications:

At least 2-5 years experience as a Data Engineer, ideally within the financial sector.
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and other relevant programming languages.
Experience with cloud-based data platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
Familiarity with ETL tools, data warehousing, and big data technologies like Hadoop or Spark.
Strong problem-solving skills with a focus on performance optimization and security.
Understanding of data governance and compliance in a financial environment is a plus.
Languages: Fluency in English and French or Dutch is required.




Offer:

Full-time, CDI contract
Competitive salary and benefits
Opportunity to work on impactful projects in the investment banking industry




Ready to take your Data Engineering career to the next level in the banking sector? Apply today!

Title: Power BI Consultant
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

As a PowerBI consultant, you will help our clients solve complex BI issues. You collect data from different sources,build sustainble datamodels, optimize datasets for reporting and develop user-friendly PowerBI dashboards. Based on your own expertise and the Sopra Steria BI methodology, you increase the quality of reporting and visualization at our customers. In addition, your input will contribute to the vision and development of our Data Visualization team.

Understanding data is important. With the Sopra Steria solution for Data visualization, we help organizations do just that. We do this by visualizing information and data. We make abstract information accessible and understandable. Based on the right insights, we can then make data driven decisions about next actions Microsoft technologies such as PowerBI, Fabric, Azure, ... hold no secrets for us.

Within our Data Visualization team we want to help each other and keep learning from each other. We do this by working closely together within the team. So are you looking for new challenges with great colleagues and a steep learning curve? Then the Data Visualization team at Sorpa Steria is the right place for you.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:


You have at least 3 year of experience with data visualization and can demonstrate this with a demo or portfolio
You have at least 3 year demonstrable experience with PowerBI
You have experience with performance tuning of PowerBI solutions
You dare to be creative, but do not lose sight of the details
Knowledge of best practices and visual design principles
You act as an expert and coach people
You communicate fluently, both with your colleagues and the customer
A good knowledge of data modeling and dimensional modeling concepts..
Knowledge of HTML/CSS and programming languages such as javascript, python, C# is also a plus
Data visualization is your passion
Adding your dashboards or portfolio in the application is a plus
Knowledge of exernal tools like Tabular editor are a plus
You are proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus


What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe’s largest digital solutions providers, you’ll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you’ll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You’ll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.  

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Job | Data Analyst Technology | Bruxelles
Description:
Description

Le Corporate Office de CTO est responsable de l’orientation stratégique et du support opérationnel de toutes les divisions Technology au sein du groupe Belfius.

Au sein du Corporate Office de CTO, nous sommes à la recherche d’un analyste data qui peut améliorer le niveau du reporting corporate. Grâce à votre traitement & analyse des données, à votre contrôle minutieux, à votre suivi des KPI et à vos tableaux de bord clairs, la direction de Technology peut évaluer les résultats effectivement et prendre plus rapidement de meilleures décisions.

Votre job en deux mots

Vous faites partie d’une équipe dynamique qui travaille sur des sujets variés tels que HR, finance, planning, communication, entreprise, architecture IT, etc. Votre rôle consiste à concevoir, développer et gérer des reportings & tableaux de bord dans PowerBI portant sur ces différents thèmes.

En étroite collaboration avec les directeurs et les équipes, vous veillez à un apport correct des données et vous développez des reportings globaux, des tableaux de bord KPI et des analyses visant à soutenir la technologie Operations et la stratégie.

Vous veillez à un apport correct des données et vous développez des reportings globaux & des tableaux de bord KPI. En outre, vous pouvez vous épanouir et enrichir vos connaissances en soutenant les différentes équipes au sein de Technology, qui utilisent le reporting & les tableaux de bord, et en participant à la réflexion sur la manière de pouvoir les améliorer.

Une journée de travail typique se présente comme suit :


Vous discutez avec différentes équipes de Belfius Technology afin de comprendre les informations dont elles ont besoin et vous effectuez une analyse fonctionnelle
Vous synthétisez les sources de données et les exigences de reporting en un modèle de données qui soutient le reporting requis
Vous collectez et analysez les données
Vous créez des customized BI reportings et des tableaux de bord dans PowerBI
Vous êtes responsable du traitement et du téléchargement des données



Pas besoin d’être un oiseau rare

Pas besoin d’être un oiseau rare. Mais vous pouvez en devenir un, parmi nous. Nous cherchons surtout une forte personnalité dotée d’un learning mindset.

Chez nous, vous pourrez déployer pleinement vos ailes si :


vous êtes passionné par la technologie, l’innovation et/ou les données et vous êtes prêt à mettre vos connaissances en pratique dans le monde bancaire et des assurances.
vous possédez un diplôme de bachelier ou de master, de préférence en Informatique, Engineering, Sciences ou une orientation économique et/ou vous avez déjà une expérience IT.
vous avez au minimum 2 ans d’expérience avérée dans l’analyse des données, le modelage des données et la création de tableaux de bord dans PowerBI.
vous avez une bonne dose de curiosité dans le domaine des analyses, des chiffres et de l’optimalisation des processus.
vous maîtrisez Excel tout en suivant de près comment nous pouvons travailler encore plus efficacement à l’aide des analyses des données/BI.
vous avez une bonne connaissance du français ou du néerlandais et de l’anglais.



Vous marquerez encore plus de points si :


vous avez de l’expérience en analyse fonctionnelle ou business.
vous avez de l’expérience dans le levelling up d’Excel en PowerQuery et/ou PowerBI.
vous avez un esprit axé sur l’optimalisation, ce qui vous permet de discuter avec vos collègues, notamment sur la manière de les aider à effectuer leur tâche plus efficacement et effectivement.



Belfius prend soin de ses talents

Outre la possibilité de faire votre chemin dans un job qui vous plaît, nous vous offrons un contrat à temps plein à durée indéterminée avec :


Un salaire attractif complété par une offre innovante vous octroyant un budget à utiliser selon vos préférences personnelles (p. ex. voiture, vélo, PC, smartphone, tablette, loyer ou crédit hypothécaire sous certaines conditions) et des avantages extralégaux, tels que des chèques-repas, des avantages sur les produits et services internes, une assurance hospitalisation et une assurance groupe.
Des possibilités de développement par le biais d'un large éventail de formations et des opportunités de carrière dans l’ensemble du groupe Belfius.
Un bon équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à des horaires flexibles, à la combinaison du travail au bureau et à domicile et un nombre attractif de jours de congé.
Un lieu de travail moderne au cœur de Bruxelles, avec une salle de sport branchée, un délicieux restaurant sain et des espaces de réunion confortables, le tout à quelques pas de la rue commerciale, de la gare Bruxelles-Nord et de la station métro Rogier.

Title: SAS Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst/Programmer to join our team. The successful candidate will play a key role in analyzing and improving existing R and SAS programs, as well as documenting the changes. This position is ideal for someone who is passionate about optimizing program performance, increasing efficiency, and collaborating with various stakeholders across the organization.




Key Responsibilities:




Program Analysis:

Analyze current R and SAS programs, identify areas for improvement, and document the findings.

Program Optimization:

Implement adaptations and improvements to existing SAS or R programs to enhance performance.
Identify and execute quick wins to improve program efficiency.
Thoroughly document all changes made to the programs for future reference.




Collaboration:

Work closely with multiple stakeholders across departments to gather requirements and ensure that program improvements align with business needs.
Provide clear and detailed communication to stakeholders regarding program enhancements and performance updates.




Documentation:

Maintain excellent documentation of all work, including detailed descriptions of changes, test plans, and results.

Testing:

Define and execute test plans to ensure the reliability and effectiveness of program improvements.




Requirements:

Strong programming skills in R, Python, SAS, Power BI, and SQL.
Fluent in NL & EN or FR & EN
Proven experience in analyzing and optimizing existing programs.
Strong attention to detail, particularly in documenting technical processes and program changes.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Ability to define and execute test plans to ensure program improvements are functioning as intended.




Preferred Qualifications:

Previous experience working with data analytics, performance optimization, or program improvement.
Ability to work independently, take initiative, and manage multiple tasks effectively.
Strong problem-solving skills and a focus on delivering results.




If you have a passion for data, program optimization, and efficient processes, and you enjoy working in a collaborative environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Title: Business Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Koda Staff are currently partnered with a number of clients in Belgium who are searching for additional Business Intelligence support.




We are seeking freelance BI Engineers to design and implement data solutions that drive business insights. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining data models, reports, and dashboards to support business decision-making. As a freelancer, you’ll collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure efficient data processes and deliver high-quality BI solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

BI Solution Development: Build and maintain dashboards and reports using BI tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.
Data Modelling: Design and optimize data models to support efficient reporting and analysis.
Data Integration: Collaborate with data engineers to ensure smooth data flow from various sources to BI tools.
Performance Optimization: Ensure BI tools and reports perform efficiently as data volumes grow.
Data Quality: Implement checks and validation for accurate and reliable data reporting.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work with business teams to understand needs and deliver actionable insights.




Your Profile:

5+ years in a Business Intelligence/Data Role
Senior knowledge of BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, Looker, etc.).
Strong proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques.
Familiarity with ETL/ELT processes and integration with data warehouses like Snowflake or BigQuery.
Experience in designing and delivering clear, impactful data visualizations.
English speaking (Dutch or French preffered)




The Offer:

Hybrid working (Brussels, Ghent, Antwerp)
Long-term freelance contract
Up to €650 per day
Start date ASAP




If you are interested in this position, please apply now!

Title: Wind Energy Data Analyst
Company: Oil and Gas Job Search Ltd
Description:
Linkebeek, Brussels suburbs, Belgium - Renewables and Urban Expertise

Are you excited about embarking on a journey with us towards a carbon-neutral world?

We are seeking a collaborative colleague who is passionate about making a positive impact on ENGIE Laborelec's success and overall performance. If you have a deep interest in the energy transition, power generation and technology, we urge you to explore this opportunity.

Bring your expertise, grow with us and build your career in a safe and diverse environment.

Who are we?

ENGIE Laborelec is a research and expertise centre focused on electrical power technology, with a team of over 380 employees from different backgrounds. We are part of the ENGIE Group, and more particularly the entity ENGIE Research & Innovation. We support the entire electricity value chain, providing customized solutions to a diverse range of customers from various fields and industries. We are dedicated to achieving a net zero carbon future and finding sustainable solutions.

About The Team

The Renewables & Urban Business Line of Laborelec provides business-focused research and expertise services to energy operators worldwide in the fields of solar, wind, hybrid and flexible assets, future home and collective communities, e-Mobility, lighting and energy storage.

What You'll Be Doing

Your responsibilities as Wind Energy Data Analyst (F/M/X)


Monitoring the performance of operating wind parks using SCADA systems and specific measurement tools to ensure optimal functionality.
Optimizing wind farm operations through advanced wind farm control techniques, utilizing real-time data and control algorithms.
Managing wind assets throughout their lifecycle, combining real-time measurements and advanced analytics to ensure structural health and performance.
Developing methodologies and tools to evaluate the impact of control actions on performance and structural health, using versatile analyses of operational data.
Interpreting and reporting findings from operational data analyses to colleagues and external research sponsors, and lead small to medium-sized R&I projects in wind farm control, including participation in international initiatives such as EU projects.



You will work alongside a supportive team and will have access to professional development opportunities to help you grow in your own career.

If you identify with any of the following, we encourage you to apply!

We are looking for a highly motivated and enthusiastic person with a passion for applied Research & Innovation, able to work well independently as well as part of a team. Strongly interested in renewable energy, and wind energy specifically

Do you?


Have a Master's degree in engineering with a strong background in renewable energies.
Have 3-4+ years of experience in data analytics related to renewable energy assets.
Have strong programming skills in Python, and knowledge of Fortran, C++, or R, along with expertise in data analytics.
Have proficiency in English, both spoken and written, with knowledge of Dutch and/or French being advantageous but not required.
Consider yourself self-motivated and organized, with strong communication skills allowing you to interact with various stakeholders, including Engie R&I sponsors and European research partners.



Additionally, experience in any of the following areas is highly desirable:


Wake modeling using CFD or engineering wake models (e.g., Floris or PyWake).
Aeroelastic computations with the OpenFAST wind turbine simulation tool.
Long-term energy yield assessment studies using WRF, meso-micro, or standard industrial models.
Control system design and testing.
Field measurement campaigns monitoring of environmental conditions, wind turbine performance, and/or loads on wind turbine components, including data interpretation.



Here's a Taste Of What Laborelec Offers You


Flexible Working Environment: A green campus and hybrid workspace (3 days home working/week) offering flexibility for a good work/life balance.
Employee Resource Groups: An exciting position in a prominent research and expertise center, with the possibility of further career development within ENGIE.
An inspiring work environment: Shared with bold colleagues from different backgrounds.
Learning & Development: Growth is a big reason people choose to join our team. We provide opportunities through "lunch and learn" programs, training, coaching, mentorship programs, and other workshops.
Benefits: 34 leave days, 5 days free care for sick children, linen ironing service...
Wellness: You will have access to our fun room and fitness space for your enjoyment and well-being.



Where we work

Our headquarters is based in Belgium (Linkebeek, near to Brussels), and we have several branches in Europe (France, Germany & the Netherlands), LATAM (Chile) and MESCAT (KSA & UAE).

Our values : The 4B's

Be You, at Laborelec, we encourage you to be yourself and allow your skills and knowledge to shine through.

Be Safe, keeping our employees safe is our top priority.

Become, as a Laborelec employee, you can build your career.

Belong, join our dynamic community at Laborelec and become an integral part of our team.

Our commitment

At ENGIE Laborelec, we are committed to building a team that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve, including people of all genders, ages, religions, disabilities, and sexual orientations.

We'd love to hear from you if this opportunity sparks your interest.

Your HR Contact

Isabelle Croiset

E-mail: isabelle.croiset@external.engie.com

We believe any recruitment decision should be a sustainable one, taken by both parties and with full transparency. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have specific questions you want to get answered before applying.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
En tant que data engineer, vous jouez un rôle clé dans la construction, la gestion et l'optimisation de notre infrastructure de données. Vous serez chargé de concevoir et de développer des pipelines de données robustes, de transformer des données brutes en formats exploitables et de soutenir nos analystes de données et data scientists dans la réalisation de leurs analyses.

Missions


Concevoir, développer et maintenir des pipelines de données fiables et des processus ETL.
Intégrer différentes sources de données internes et externes dans notre plateforme de données.
Optimiser les performances des bases de données et garantir la qualité et l'intégrité des données.
Collaborer avec des analystes de données et des data scientists pour modéliser et analyser des ensembles de données complexes.
Aider à la mise en œuvre de modèles de Machine Learning dans des environnements de production.
Documenter les solutions techniques et les processus.


Profil recherché


Diplôme de Bachelor ou Master en Informatique, Data Engineering ou domaine similaire.
Minimum de 2 à 3 ans d'expérience dans un rôle similaire.
Expérience avec des technologies de Big Data telles que Hadoop et Spark.
Maîtrise des langages de programmation comme Python et Java.
Bonne connaissance de SQL et expérience avec des bases de données relationnelles comme PostgreSQL ou SQL Server.
Expérience dans la conception d'entrepôts de données et de lacs de données.
Familiarité avec Dbt (Data Build Tool) pour le modélisation et la transformation de données.
Compétence dans la mise en place et la maintenance de modèles de données Snowflake.
Expérience dans l'intégration de données dans des outils BI tels que Qlik Sense et Qlik NPrinting.
Connaissance de la gestion et de l'orchestration des processus via Airflow pour les pipelines de données.
Solides compétences analytiques et en résolution de problèmes.
Vous êtes capable de travailler aussi bien de manière autonome qu'en équipe.
Vous possédez de bonnes compétences en communication, en néerlandais et en anglais, le français étant un atout.
Une attitude proactive et axée sur les solutions est souhaitée.


Ce que nous offrons


Un salaire compétitif et des avantages extra-légaux attrayants.
Horaires de travail flexibles et possibilité de télétravail.
Opportunités de développement personnel.
Un environnement de travail stimulant et innovant.
Accès facile par les transports en commun.
Show more
HTML:
En tant que data engineer, vous jouez un rôle clé dans la construction, la gestion et l'optimisation de notre infrastructure de données. Vous serez chargé de concevoir et de développer des pipelines de données robustes, de transformer des données brutes en formats exploitables et de soutenir nos analystes de données et data scientists dans la réalisation de leurs analyses.

Missions

  • Concevoir, développer et maintenir des pipelines de données fiables et des processus ETL.
  • Intégrer différentes sources de données internes et externes dans notre plateforme de données.
  • Optimiser les performances des bases de données et garantir la qualité et l'intégrité des données.
  • Collaborer avec des analystes de données et des data scientists pour modéliser et analyser des ensembles de données complexes.
  • Aider à la mise en œuvre de modèles de Machine Learning dans des environnements de production.
  • Documenter les solutions techniques et les processus.

Profil recherché

  • Diplôme de Bachelor ou Master en Informatique, Data Engineering ou domaine similaire.
  • Minimum de 2 à 3 ans d'expérience dans un rôle similaire.
  • Expérience avec des technologies de Big Data telles que Hadoop et Spark.
  • Maîtrise des langages de programmation comme Python et Java.
  • Bonne connaissance de SQL et expérience avec des bases de données relationnelles comme PostgreSQL ou SQL Server.
  • Expérience dans la conception d'entrepôts de données et de lacs de données.
  • Familiarité avec Dbt (Data Build Tool) pour le modélisation et la transformation de données.
  • Compétence dans la mise en place et la maintenance de modèles de données Snowflake.
  • Expérience dans l'intégration de données dans des outils BI tels que Qlik Sense et Qlik NPrinting.
  • Connaissance de la gestion et de l'orchestration des processus via Airflow pour les pipelines de données.
  • Solides compétences analytiques et en résolution de problèmes.
  • Vous êtes capable de travailler aussi bien de manière autonome qu'en équipe.
  • Vous possédez de bonnes compétences en communication, en néerlandais et en anglais, le français étant un atout.
  • Une attitude proactive et axée sur les solutions est souhaitée.

Ce que nous offrons

  • Un salaire compétitif et des avantages extra-légaux attrayants.
  • Horaires de travail flexibles et possibilité de télétravail.
  • Opportunités de développement personnel.
  • Un environnement de travail stimulant et innovant.
  • Accès facile par les transports en commun.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Sigma Suisse recherche pour son client, une organisation économique privée, un(e) Data Analyst / BI Analyst à Genève, en Suisse. La position est ouverte uniquement aux résidents Suisses (Vaud/Genève).




Descriptif du poste :




Etablir des rapports de gestion ainsi que sur l'expression des besoins métiers.
Produire des restitutions de données en utilisant des outils comme SAP BO ou Crystal Reports, ainsi que d'autres solutions potentielles.
Décrire et améliorer les processus liés à la qualité.
Poste axé sur la partie CRM & BI avec expertise en visualisation de données.
Former et assister les utilisateurs métiers, en créant des formations engageantes, support L1 / L2.
Maintenir et ajuster les configurations du système de gestion interne pour son bon fonctionnement.
Être autonome dans l’extraction de données, leur mise en forme et la création de rapports pour la prise de décision.
Poste orienté Data et Business Analysis, pas développement requis.
Identifier et résoudre les problèmes techniques liés au système en proposant des solutions innovantes.




Profil recherché :




Formation universitaire en informatique ou ingénierie.
Expérience confirmée en Business Intelligence et en conseil/formation.
Maîtrise du langage SQL.
Expérience en migration (ERP ou CRM)

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Description du poste :

CONTEXT:

L’Occitane Group Travel Retail team is looking for an Intern, based in Geneva (Switzerland). Reporting to RGM (Revenue Growth Management) Global Travel Retail Director, your mission will be to drive data-centric decisions for Pricing, Promotion and Assortment within the Travel Retail environment (airports, airlines, cruises and ferries).

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

Collaborate in the gathering, refining and structuring of data sourced from diverse channels
Design and implement new dashboards tailored to meet the evolving requirements of the Management team, focusing on aspects such as sell-out and sell-in performance
Support brands including L’Occitane, Sol de Janeiro, ELEMIS, Erborian, and Melvita in formulating annual pricing strategies
Take charge of regular monitoring and analysis of competitor pricing dynamics
Ensure the precision and reliability of collected data through rigorous quality control measures
Leverage data-driven insights to deliver actionable analyses aimed at enhancing both sales performance and profit margins

HOW YOU CAN FIT:

Student with Bachelor ou Masters' Degree within University or Business School (an internship agreement provided by your school is mandatory)
A first professional experience in Data Analytics is a plus
Proficiency in Excel
Fluent in English and French
Proactiveness and working autonomously, with excellent organization and project management skills
Entrepreneurial, solution oriented, with ability to adapt
Strong team spirit, good coordination skills
At ease in a fast-paced and multi task environment, working with short-term deadline

 

STARTING DATE: January 2025 for 6 months (full-time position)LOCATION: Geneva (Plan-les-Ouates), Switzerland

If you are selected, we will have the pleasure to meet you during an online recruitment day

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
For one of our clients we are looking for a Data Analyst




CONTEXT

The mission is to assist in creating Dashboards using the data from several applications. The idea is to establish consolidated dashboards to share with stakeholders at different levels.

RESPONSIBILITIES

• Collaborate with different team members and stakeholders to establish dashboards that track the status and action plans per entity using the data in one of existing tools.

• Work with the business to understand their needs.

• Set up an easy to template for the monthly reporting of project status, risk results, mitigation measure tracking etc.

• Help the team set the roadmap and priorities for the future needs.







QUALIFICATIONS

• 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst

• Solid working experience with Power BI, Tableau and other data analytics tool. Experience with Domo would be an advantage.

• Ability to quickly adapt to the context and make the project from scratch.

• Fluent English




OTHER INFORMATION

• Duration 2-3 months

• Possibility of partial workload

• Location: Geneva

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
Pour notre division Production, nous recherchons un Data Analyst (H/F) dont la mission principale sera la récolte, l'analyse et l'interprétation des données afin d’élaborer des stratégies d'amélioration pour le site de Production des Acacias.

Responsabilités


Contribuer activement à différentes initiatives du site en établissant les indicateurs clés pour le suivi efficace du projet
Récupérer puis traiter des données issues de sources variées telles que ERP, PLM, MES, LES, ou directement des équipements
Présenter les résultats analysés en utilisant des outils de visualisation de données pour faciliter la compréhension
Comprendre les problématiques métier et les traduire de manière analytique
Collaborer avec le département informatique pour automatiser le traitement des flux de données.
Garder une veille technologique active sur les nouveaux outils et méthodes d'analyse de données


Profil


Ingénieur HES, EPF ou équivalent
Connaissance des outils de traitement et d’analyse de données (Python, Dataiku, Tableau PREP, KNIME ou équivalent), de visualisation (TABLEAU) et base de données
Fortes compétences organisationnelles et autonomie
Aisance relationnelle, écoute, capacité de synthèse et communication efficace
Dynamisme, flexibilité et esprit d'équipe


Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Who We Are

DLG (Digital Luxury Group) is an international agency with offices in Geneva, Shanghai, and New York that offers social media, e-commerce, CRM, consulting, and creative services to luxury brands. It has developed a unique expertise in defining and implementing impactful digital strategies targeting sophisticated consumers through technological know-how, creativity, and luxury savoir-faire. DLG is also the publisher of Luxury Society, a trusted intelligence resource for luxury executives.

What You’ll Do


Data Cleaning and Data Analysis: you should have skills in data cleaning and analysis. This includes data manipulation and database management (such as Google BigQuery). The ability to handle large datasets from various sources and prepare them for analysis is essential.
Business Specifications Writing: you need to be capable of understanding project requirements and writing clear, detailed business specifications.
BI and Reporting Skills: Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools (such as Google Looker Studio or other reporting tools) is crucial for visualizing data and creating dashboards. You should have some experience in connecting data sources, creating dynamic reports, and using visualization tools to convey insights.
Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Knowledge: Since your infrastructure uses tools like Google Cloud Functions, BigQuery, and Google Cloud Storage, understanding these cloud technologies would be very beneficial. Skills in managing databases in BigQuery and using cloud functions to automate data workflows are key technical skills.
Keyword Research and Analysis Skills: As your project involves creating and analyzing keyword lists, experience with SEO tools or Google Ads would be advantageous. This includes the ability to perform keyword research, clean and categorize these lists, and update keyword mappings.


WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO BE GREAT IN THIS ROLE


Currently studying for a Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Familiarity with data cleaning and manipulation tools like Google Sheets, BigQuery, or other database management platforms.
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to handle and interpret large datasets.
Understanding of Business Intelligence (BI) tools such as Looker Studio or similar platforms.
Basic knowledge of cloud technologies, especially Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Excellent communication skills for business specification writing.
SEO and keyword research experience would be an advantage.
An eagerness to learn, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently on projects.
English fluent with a good level of French.


HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?


DLG welcomes you to discover the allure of joining one of Europe's top work environments, distinguished as a Great Place to Work in 2022. Our ethos is founded on efficiency, trust, innovation, transparency, and a deep-seated culture of care.
We offer you the opportunity to create some of your life's best work for some of the world’s most admired brands.
Experience the flexibility our work-from-home policy offers. You can work remotely up to two days a week. Our Creative Space, strategically located opposite the Eaux-Vives train station, is designed to spark creativity and foster collaboration among our team members.
At DLG, we are committed to recognizing and nurturing talent, ensuring that your journey with us is filled with opportunities for growth and career progression. Embrace a healthier lifestyle with our Wellbeing & Sport Incentives, designed to support your wellness and sporting endeavors.
Equality and inclusivity are the cornerstones of our recruitment philosophy. We champion diversity and inclusivity, not just in words but through meaningful actions. In line with our ethical standards and values, we consciously choose not to engage with tobacco companies, military organizations, or governments.


We are looking forward to meeting you!

This opportunity is offered as a 6-month internship position.

Title: Data Analyst - Intern (Remote Internship - Data Analysis)
Description:
Delve into the dynamic world of data analysis with an exclusive internship opportunity offered by Kreativstorm, a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and unlock your career aspirations in data analysis!

If you're passionate about data analysis and equipped with problem-solving skills, this internship is perfect for you. Under the guidance of industry experts, you'll tackle diverse data analysis projects, exploring concepts like data visualization, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and data mining. Gain hands-on experience in uncovering insights and informing decisions, all from the comfort of your home.

Internship Overview and Details:

Location: Fully Remote

Schedule: Part-Time Internship

Duration: 3 months with the possibility of permanent employment after the internship period

Requirements

Ideal Candidates:


Students pursuing a degree or recent graduates in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Aspiring data analysts keen on unraveling complex datasets and extracting meaningful insights.
Analytical thinkers adept at translating data into actionable recommendations.
Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team settings.
Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, analytical environments.
Enthusiastic learners committed to honing their skills in data analysis.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL) highly valued.
Familiarity with statistical techniques, data visualization, and database management advantageous.
Some initial industry experience is a big plus.


Your Contribution:


Contribute to data collection, cleaning, and analysis processes.
Collaborate with the data analysis team to develop analytical models and insights.
Aid in interpreting data trends and patterns to inform strategic decision-making.
Bring fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to tackle data challenges.
Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in data analysis.
Assist in documenting and presenting analysis results and recommendations.


Benefits

Why Join Us?

Kreativstorm is a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Our team of experienced consultants brings a diverse range of talents and backgrounds, allowing us to provide tailored solutions to businesses of all sizes and industries. As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in data analysis today!

Apply now and pave the way for your future in data analysis!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
For One Of Our Clients Based In Geneva, a Leading International Company In The Manufacturing Industry, We Are Looking For a

Business Data Analyst

As Junior Business Data Analyst, you will join a team which focuses on discovering market growth through analytics. You will be responsible for providing analysis and insights which help your division grow their business profitability.

You should have business and communication skills and be able to explain complex solutions to people from various functions and hierarchical levels. You are comfortable working in challenging environments with a contagious passion for data analytics and how it drives change.

Responsibilities


Gather and implement business requirements for leads development
Analyze feedback information to improve leads quality
Provide business recommendations to internal partners based on quantitative and qualitative data
Improvement, enhancement, and development of specific datasets based on opportunities
Drive process improvement and automation of lead generation applications
Coordination with Data & BI Team
User data support and training


Minimum Requirements


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Finance, Accounting, Business Management or equivalent
2+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or Data Analyst
Business knowledge in a specific area or dealer exposure
Excellent analytical skills: ability to interpret data to solve business issues and communicate results to a large and diverse audience
Ability to manipulate data and create meaningful visualizations
Understanding of aftermarket services
Experience with Alteryx, Tableau, and any data visualization software
Advanced programming skills in any language such as Python


Contract type: Employed by Arobase - 2 year mission - renewable

Interested in knowing more?

Feel free to apply!

Title: Data Analyst (Processes) 100%
Description:
To strengthen our IT and product teams, we are looking for a Data Analyst (Processes) to lead initiatives focused on process improvements and process mining. The ideal candidate should have strong skills in data analysis, ideally previous experience in process mining, and general business process management knowledge. This is a full-time, permanent position based in our office in Basel.

Tasks & Responsibilities

As the Data Analyst (Processes), you will be responsible for:


Collaborating with business stakeholders to distil and analyze business requirements.
Performing process analysis using data from log files and databases (process mining).
Documenting processes, including creating process models using standard notations (such as BPMN, can be easily learned on-the-job).
Managing and coordinating business process change projects.


Additionally, you will:


Support business stakeholders (editorial, production, finance) in process optimization discussions.
Provide consultancy to editorial, production, and other departments on process-related matters.
Act as a key collaborator with the development teams that are working on workflow-related software.
Advocate for best practices in process management and continuous improvement.


Requirements


Education and Work Experience: A university degree (Master’s preferred) in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field. Alternatively, a business degree with significant relevant work experience. 3-5 years of experience as a business analyst, data analyst, or similar role (or equivalent experience in workflow-related enterprise applications).
Process Mining & Data Analysis: Strong ability to gather, analyze, and interpret data (from logs, databases, or data sets) to identify patterns and trends and support data-driven process improvements. SQL and data analysis skills are required for this role: you have experience in a general-purpose programming language suitable for data analysis (Python, R), or alternatively previous experience with process mining tools.
Problem-Solving and Critical Thinking: Strong aptitude for identifying process inefficiencies, diagnosing root causes, and developing practical solutions.
Process Mapping and Documentation: Proficiency in business process management and experience with BPMN 2.0 process flows are a plus. (BPMN is not a must and can be learnt on the job.)
Project & Change Management: Familiarity with project and change management principles to manage process improvement initiatives and meet deadlines.
Continuous Improvement Mindset: A solid understanding of agile and lean methodologies.


What We Offer


The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
Flexible working hours;

About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

HTML:
To strengthen our IT and product teams, we are looking for a Data Analyst (Processes) to lead initiatives focused on process improvements and process mining. The ideal candidate should have strong skills in data analysis, ideally previous experience in process mining, and general business process management knowledge. This is a full-time, permanent position based in our office in Basel.

Tasks & Responsibilities

As the Data Analyst (Processes), you will be responsible for:

  • Collaborating with business stakeholders to distil and analyze business requirements.
  • Performing process analysis using data from log files and databases (process mining).
  • Documenting processes, including creating process models using standard notations (such as BPMN, can be easily learned on-the-job).
  • Managing and coordinating business process change projects.

Additionally, you will:

  • Support business stakeholders (editorial, production, finance) in process optimization discussions.
  • Provide consultancy to editorial, production, and other departments on process-related matters.
  • Act as a key collaborator with the development teams that are working on workflow-related software.
  • Advocate for best practices in process management and continuous improvement.

Requirements

  • Education and Work Experience: A university degree (Master’s preferred) in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field. Alternatively, a business degree with significant relevant work experience. 3-5 years of experience as a business analyst, data analyst, or similar role (or equivalent experience in workflow-related enterprise applications).
  • Process Mining & Data Analysis: Strong ability to gather, analyze, and interpret data (from logs, databases, or data sets) to identify patterns and trends and support data-driven process improvements. SQL and data analysis skills are required for this role: you have experience in a general-purpose programming language suitable for data analysis (Python, R), or alternatively previous experience with process mining tools.
  • Problem-Solving and Critical Thinking: Strong aptitude for identifying process inefficiencies, diagnosing root causes, and developing practical solutions.
  • Process Mapping and Documentation: Proficiency in business process management and experience with BPMN 2.0 process flows are a plus. (BPMN is not a must and can be learnt on the job.)
  • Project & Change Management: Familiarity with project and change management principles to manage process improvement initiatives and meet deadlines.
  • Continuous Improvement Mindset: A solid understanding of agile and lean methodologies.

What We Offer

  • The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Support for a healthy lifestyle;
  • Team bond strengthening through team-building events;
  • Professional growth opportunities with our global training system;
  • Working in a collaborative, diverse, and socially responsible team;
  • Company retreat facility;
  • Full-coverage insurance for accidents/daily sickness;
  • Prime location near Basel train station and city center;
  • And more

If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving:

  • A motivational letter(EN) that briefly describes your motivations for joining MDPI
  • A resume(EN) including personal information, past & current education,
  • If available: reference letters and certificates.

About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst (Remote)
Description:
Start your career in business intelligence with Kreativstorm, a leading management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and transform data into actionable insights!

Are you passionate about data and eager to uncover insights that drive business decisions? Kreativstorm is looking for a Junior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team. You will analyze business data, create reports, and provide insights that help shape strategies. This role offers an excellent opportunity to develop your analytical skills and make a significant impact.

Job Overview and Details:


Location: Fully Remote
Position: Full-Time


Requirements

Ideal Candidates:


Pursuing or having a degree in Data Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Junior business intelligence analysts with a strong interest in data analysis.
Proficiency in BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Strong analytical and communication skills.


Your Role:


Analyze business data to identify trends and opportunities.
Develop BI reports and dashboards.
Collaborate with the data team to improve data quality.
Document and present business insights.
Support in implementing BI solutions.


Benefits

Why Join Us? Kreativstorm offers a dynamic and innovative environment. You will work with a team of data experts, gaining hands-on experience in business intelligence. We value creativity, collaboration, and data-driven decision-making. Join us to enhance your BI skills and contribute to the success of our clients.

Apply now and pave the way for your future in business intelligence!
