Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Missions principales

Vous êtes passionné(e) par l'analyse de données et la Business Intelligence ? Vous avez un esprit d'équipe et êtes reconnu(e) pour votre dynamisme et votre bienveillance ? Rejoignez notre équipe en tant que Data Analyst GRC et participez à la transformation digitale de notre entreprise !

Au Cœur De Notre Département Marketing, Vous Jouerez Un Rôle Clé Dans L'optimisation De Notre Gestion De La Relation Client (GRC) En Collaborant Étroitement Avec Les Équipes Métiers. Vos Missions Consisteront à


Créer et faire évoluer les extractions de données et tableaux de bord interactifs et intuitifs
Contrôler la qualité des données clients & membres, analyser et corriger les erreurs
Décrire et améliorer nos processus de qualité
Supporter et former les utilisateurs métiers, en préparant et animant des formations captivantes et en apportant un support de premier et second niveaux aux utilisateurs
Maintenir et faire évoluer les paramétrages de notre outil SGI, garantir sa bonne configuration
Communiquer efficacement sur le projet SGI en travaillant étroitement avec le Département des Systèmes d’Information et les administrateurs fonctionnels
Évaluer et résoudre les risques techniques dans le SCI en apportant des solutions innovantes


Profil Recherché


Formation universitaire en informatique ou génie informatique
Solide expérience en Business Intelligence et en conseil/formation
Expérience dans un environnement CRM
Maîtrise du langage SQL
Connaissance de l'outil SAGE X3, un atout
Orientation clients, pédagogie et capacité à travailler en équipe.


Vos Avantages


Un environnement de travail bienveillant et stimulant
Des opportunités de développement professionnel continue
Un rôle où votre expertise fait réellement la différence


Prêt(e) à relever le défi dans un environnement stimulant ? Alors postulez dès maintenant pour rejoindre une équipe dynamique et contribuez activement à l'amélioration continue de notre GRC !

Seules les candidatures complètes (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats de travail, diplômes) correspondant parfaitement au profil recherché seront étudiées.

Title: Data Analyst – Bio-Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to support our bio-pharmaceutical manufacturing operations. The ideal candidate will be responsible for assembling and managing data from multiple systems, contributing to cutting-edge analytics and ensuring the accuracy of data for key projects.




Responsibilities include:

Assemble and manage data for advanced analytics in bio-pharma manufacturing.
Ensure smooth data flow by transferring process data to the Global Data Mart (GDM
Collaborate with MSAT to assess process data and enhance decision-making.
Assist in preparing validation reports and Product Quality Reviews (PQRs).
Identify and resolve data discrepancies, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.




Requirements:

Identify and resolve data discrepancies, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Experience in data analysis within a manufacturing or bio-pharmaceutical environment is highly desirable.
Proficiency with data management tools and systems such as Excel, SQL, or other relevant data analysis software.
Experience with dashboard development and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.




To find out more, please contact Noah Coombes (noah.coombes@lifescirecruitment.com)

At Life Sciences Recruitment Ltd (LSR), we are a Global Life Science recruitment firm that specialises in partnering with start-ups, fast-growing biotech and pharmaceutical organisations.

Founded in 2021, we recognised the need for a company with the insights, knowledge and credibility of a search firm but offering a contingent service.

As one of the most competitive and fast-paced industries globally, succeeding and growing in the life sciences business requires a combination of creativity, technical expertise, and business savvy. At LSR, to find the best talent for your organisation, our dynamic recruitment consultants tap into our unparalleled network of contacts and apply a quality-based approach to a contingent search model tailored to your needs. We provide the most sought after candidates to fit your requirements ranging from temporary placement to Fortune 500 companies!

LSR is a privately owned and independent recruitment company focused on the Life Sciences industry. We are a subsidiary of Morgan Prestwich (MP), Europe's leading boutique Life Sciences executive search and advisory firm.

At Life Sciences Recruitment Ltd (LSR), we are a Global Life Science recruitment firm that specialises in partnering with start-ups, fast-growing biotech and pharmaceutical organisations.

Founded in 2021, we recognised the need for a company with the insights, knowledge and credibility of a search firm but offering a contingent service.

As one of the most competitive and fast-paced industries globally, succeeding and growing in the life sciences business requires a combination of creativity, technical expertise, and business savvy. At LSR, to find the best talent for your organisation, our dynamic recruitment consultants tap into our unparalleled network of contacts and apply a quality-based approach to a contingent search model tailored to your needs. We provide the most sought after candidates to fit your requirements ranging from temporary placement to Fortune 500 companies!

LSR is a privately owned and independent recruitment company focused on the Life Sciences industry. We are a subsidiary of Morgan Prestwich (MP), Europe's leading boutique Life Sciences executive search and advisory firm.

Title: Junior Payroll Data Analyst
Description:
Mercuria is one of the world’s leading independent energy and commodity groups. Our purpose is to connect markets and to advance the energy transition. We bring markets together to support the world’s energy needs of today by trading, structuring finance, and investing into strategic assets, whilst generating over $170 billion in turnover. We are committed to advancing the transition to a more sustainable, affordable and reliable energy system for tomorrow. We are well ahead of the pledge we made in 2021 that over half of our investment capital will go into sectors that are advancing the energy transition by 2025, to contribute to global efforts to combat climate change.




As a Junior Payroll Analyst for Mercuria Energy Trading, your primary role will be to assist in the collection, preparation, and provision of payroll information to our payroll team; focusing on finding ways to automate and optimize the process. You will work to ensure accuracy and confidentiality in all payroll data, while also providing exceptional payroll services and support. Your advanced analytics and data science skills will be relevant to enhance our processes and act as an agent of change.




Key Responsibilities:




Assist the payroll team with the timely collection and preparation of payroll variables on a monthly basis.
Verify the accuracy of payroll information by collecting, computing, and entering data into the payroll system.
Assist in preparing payroll reports for audits and management review.
Update payroll records by entering changes in exemptions, insurance coverage, deductions, job titles, and department/division transfers.
Respond to payroll queries by providing required information timely and accurately, while maintaining the confidentiality of payroll operations.
Liaise with human resources for new hires, terminations, and benefits updates.
Participate in relevant projects that require cross-departmental collaboration when required.
Utilize advanced analytics and numeric skills to improve payroll processes.
Apply business analysis capabilities to identify and implement process automation.
Engage in data science and coding tasks to support payroll and broader business functions.







Qualifications and Skills:




Bachelor’s Degree in a numerical field of studies;
Minimum 2 years of experience in a function where you are responsible for collecting variables, reconciling and analyzing data.
Strong numerical skills and attention to detail.
Proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel, with advanced analytics skills.
Proficiency in French and English. Additional language skills would be a plus.
Tech-savvy with a strong interest in data science and coding.
Strong drive for process enhancements and automation.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The hiring company is in financial services & data analytics sector. As part of their activity they are looking for a Data Analyst to integrate into their teams in Geneva, Switzerland.




Your tasks:

Define and refine data extraction methods
Assist in the migration of the current CRM tool to a new one for a long-term goal
Identify and resolve technical risks within the CRM
Monitor and ensure the quality of customer and member data, analyzing and correcting errors.
Provide some trainings and ongoing support to our business userts for first and second-hand level support
Collaborate closely with the IT department to communicate project updates effectively




Your profile:

French (C1+, fluent/native)
MUST: previous working experience in Switzerland!!!
min 3+ years of experience as a technical Data Analyst
3+ years of experience with Power BI/Data Visualization
3+ years of experience working with a CRM
Strong experience with SQL




This career opportunity is based in Geneva area, Switzerland.




The salary range for this position is CHF85-130k/year (depending on the years of experience).

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PLEASE NOTE: The only thing you need to do is create your account on TieTalent and that's it 🙂 + IT'S FREE for talents! You won’t specifically apply for this position, but if there's a match for this opportunity, you will be contacted and receive more details about it.

Title: Data & Analytics Intern
Description:
Description du poste :

CONTEXTE & MISSION: 

Intégré(e) au sein de l’équipe Analytics, tu mèneras à bien des projets BI depuis le recueil du besoin jusqu’à la construction des dashboards, en passant par la modélisation du flux de données ainsi que les phases de tests nécessaires. Tu seras également impliqué(e) dans les projets de migration de nos outils de transformation de données vers DBT. Les périmètres fonctionnels abordés seront variés et incluront entre autres : la connaissance client, l’analyse de nos performances sur les différentes canaux de ventes (boutiques, e-commerce, marketplace,…) et bien d’autres. Cette variété sera d’autant plus renforcée par notre contexte international, chaque région ayant ses spécificités et besoins.

 

PRINCIPALES MISSIONS: 

Participation à la migration de nos outils Data (Talend/BODS vers DBT),
Pilotage de projets data :             
Recueil du besoin (conduire des ateliers avec les équipes)
Développement de la solution
Recette
Support
Accompagner une équipe de Data Analysts en fournissant les données/dashboards nécessaires à une étude de cas (Tableau/Snowflake).

 

HOW YOU CAN FIT:

Bachelor ou Master en Business Intelligence / Ingenieur Informatique (convention de stage tripartite obligatoire),
Une première expérience en stage dans le domaine de la business intelligence et/ou informatique,
Français et Anglais courant,
Idéalement une expérience dans des projets liés à l'analyse des données au cours des études,
A l'aise avec les outils informatiques ainsi qu'une certaine appétence pour le domaine,
Curieux(se), autonome et entreprenant(e),
Bonnes capacités relationnelles et de présentation.

 

DATES DE STAGE: Janvier 2025 pour 6 mois (temps plein)LOCALISATION: Genève (Plan-les-ouates), Suisse

Si ta candidature est sélectionnée, nous aurons le plaisir de te rencontrer au cours de notre journée de recrutement en ligne

Title: Customer Insights Analyst
Description:
Customer Insights & Analytics, Senior Director




The Senior Director of Customer Insights & Analytics will report to the Head of Global Marketing and will spearhead the Customer Insights & Analytics strategy and execution across the clients portfolio.

A primary focus will be on building the Customer Insights & Analytics capability and team in preparation for upcoming product launches.




Build and Lead: Develop a robust Customer Insights & Analytics team. Implement a focused, business-oriented strategy to evolve the team and enhance its impact through strong strategic capabilities.
Thought Leadership: Provide expertise and advanced frameworks for understanding customer engagement and behavior (segmentation, cohort modeling, behavior analysis, message/activity testing, etc.).
Champion Analysis Adoption: Promote the use of analysis and insights in decision-making. Ensure customer insights are accessible across the organization, helping everyone understand and act on customer needs and values.
Commercial Translation: Convert commercial questions from various business units into research and analysis plans to support proposition development, segmentation, customer retention, and customer experience optimization.
Data Analysis: Analyze data, identify trends and gaps, make recommendations, and enhance the customer experience through insights.
Model Development: Create analytical and forecasting models to estimate product portfolio value, aiding the business decision-making process.
Innovative Approaches: Utilize innovative methods, such as big data and AI, to gain deeper consumer/customer insights.
Collaborative Agenda Setting: Work with internal stakeholders to establish the insight and analytics agenda, answering key business questions and co-creating insights that shape strategies and their execution with autonomy and proactivity.
Annual Planning: Lead the development of annual Global Customer Insights & Analytics plans and budgets.
Market Research: Conduct Primary and Secondary Market Research activities, delivering high-quality, clear syntheses to inform product strategy and decision-making.
Process Improvement: Continuously enhance processes to meet stakeholder needs, providing effective, high-quality reports and communications that make insights readily available for decision-making and strategic processes.




Required Experience:

12+ years of market insights and analytics experience, including working in a pharmaceutical or biotech environment.

5 + years experience managing people.

Experience collaborating within a global, cross-functional environment.

Proven record in bridging business priorities with relevant global insights and solutions.

Specific Expertise:

Primary and secondary competitive intelligence
Global & US market analytics & forecasting
Experience supporting new product launches.




Education:

Life Sciences and or Economics/Social Sciences/Business Master's Degree.




Skills:

Pro-active, bringing ideas in a self-driven manner
Ability to blend strategic thinking with genuine interest in tactical execution
Strong business acumen and sense of urgency in sharing critical information with relevant stakeholders
A proactive and results-driven leader focused on bringing strategic solutions to the team
Driven, successful market insights expert with a passion for delivering best practices
Ability to successfully interact with senior management
Flexibility to manage in a fast-changing environment
Strategic thinker with superior problem-solving skills
Proven ability to perform complex international market research, competitive intelligence, analysis and forecasting projects
Solid knowledge and understanding of market insights and analytics methodologies
Excellent written/verbal communication, presentation and project management skills
English: fluent, spoken and written (essential), additional languages are an advantage

Title: Data Analyst (Processes) 100%
Description:
To strengthen our IT and product teams, we are looking for a Data Analyst (Processes) to lead initiatives focused on process improvements and process mining. The ideal candidate should have strong skills in data analysis, ideally previous experience in process mining, and general business process management knowledge. This is a full-time, permanent position based in our office in Basel.

Tasks & Responsibilities

As the Data Analyst (Processes), you will be responsible for:

Collaborating with business stakeholders to distil and analyze business requirements.
Performing process analysis using data from log files and databases (process mining).
Documenting processes, including creating process models using standard notations (such as BPMN, can be easily learned on-the-job).
Managing and coordinating business process change projects.

Additionally, you will:

Support business stakeholders (editorial, production, finance) in process optimization discussions.
Provide consultancy to editorial, production, and other departments on process-related matters.
Act as a key collaborator with the development teams that are working on workflow-related software.
Advocate for best practices in process management and continuous improvement.

Requirements

Education and Work Experience: A university degree (Master’s preferred) in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field. Alternatively, a business degree with significant relevant work experience. 3-5 years of experience as a business analyst, data analyst, or similar role (or equivalent experience in workflow-related enterprise applications).
Process Mining & Data Analysis: Strong ability to gather, analyze, and interpret data (from logs, databases, or data sets) to identify patterns and trends and support data-driven process improvements. SQL and data analysis skills are required for this role: you have experience in a general-purpose programming language suitable for data analysis (Python, R), or alternatively previous experience with process mining tools.
Problem-Solving and Critical Thinking: Strong aptitude for identifying process inefficiencies, diagnosing root causes, and developing practical solutions.
Process Mapping and Documentation: Proficiency in business process management and experience with BPMN 2.0 process flows are a plus. (BPMN is not a must and can be learnt on the job.)
Project & Change Management: Familiarity with project and change management principles to manage process improvement initiatives and meet deadlines.
Continuous Improvement Mindset: A solid understanding of agile and lean methodologies.




What we offer

The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
Flexible working hours;
Support for a healthy lifestyle;
Team bond strengthening through team-building events;
Professional growth opportunities with our global training system;
Working in a collaborative, diverse, and socially responsible team;
Company retreat facility;
Full-coverage insurance for accidents/daily sickness;
Prime location near Basel train station and city center;
And more

If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving:

A motivational letter(EN) that briefly describes your motivations for joining MDPI
A resume(EN) including personal information, past & current education,
If available: reference letters and certificates.

About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

Initiatives

At MDPI, we develop and maintain various platforms in order to better serve the scientific community. Please find here-below a list of our main platforms:

https://www.mdpi.com
https://www.mdpi.com/books/
https://sciprofiles.com
https://sciforum.net
https://www.scilit.net
https://www.preprints.org
https://encyclopedia.pub

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d) 30-40%
Description:
Marketing, Kommunikation / Bern / Mitarbeiter / Unbefristet / 30-40%

Das Grand Casino Bern bietet seinen Gästen ein Maximum an Spiel, Spass und Unterhaltung. Die spannende Atmosphäre und das tolle Ambiente bieten beste Voraussetzungen, um einen Abend der besonderen Art zu erleben.

Ihr Aufgabenbereich


Sammeln und Aufbereiten von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen
Durchführen von Datenanalysen mit statistischen Methoden und Tools
Erstellen von Berichten und Dashboards zur Visualisierung der Daten für unsere Stakeholder
Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Teams, um datengeschützte Lösungen zu entwickeln
Unterstützung bei der Wartung der Datenqualität.
Identifizieren von Optimierungsmöglichkeiten und Erarbeiten von Verbesserungsvorschlägen basierend auf Datenanalysen


Was Sie mitbringen


Student*in Informatik, Statistik, Mathematik, Wirtschaftswissenschaft oder einem ähnlichen Feld
Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse und im Umgang mit Datenanalysetools (z.B. SQL, Excel, R, Python)
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit komplexe Daten zu interpretieren
Erfahrung in der Erstellung von Berichten und Dashboards (Kenntnisse in BI- Tools wie Tableau oder Power BI sind ein Plus)
Ausgezeichnete Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, technische Informationen verständlich zu machen
Selbständigkeit, Detailorientierung und Organisationstalent
Einwandfreier Leumund (Straf- und Betreibungsregisterauszüge werden vor Vertragsabschluss eingefordert)
Mindestalter 18 Jahre


Was wir bieten


Abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit in einem nicht alltäglichen Umfeld
Zukunftsorientierte Unternehmenskultur und moderne Infrastruktur
Marktgerechte Entlöhnung, Personalrestaurant und weitere Fringe Benefits
Kollegiales und multikulturelles Team
Mitarbeiter Social Club mit regelmässigen Anlässen
Beteiligung an gesundheitsfördernden Aktivitäten und weitere Anerkennungen
Berufsspezifische Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten


Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung.

Ihr Kontakt

Lucia Mattova

031 339 55 71

#J-18808-Ljbffr

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
Pour notre division Recherche & Développement, nous recherchons un Business/Data Analyst (H/F) dont la mission principale sera d’analyser des données de la division afin de permettre le pilotage des activités au travers d’indicateurs.

Responsabilités


Garantir la maîtrise de la structure des données (contenant et contenu)
Animer le réseau Gouvernance des Données de la division et promouvoir la démarche
Définir les règles d'utilisation, de codification et de maintenance de la structure des données de base
Rédiger et communiquer les règles définies
Piloter et planifier des actions de nettoyage et/ou de maintenance en collaboration avec le réseau Gouvernance des Données
Assurer et consolider une surveillance de l'application des règles au travers d'indicateurs
Assurer la cohérence de processus avec les autres divisions et l'Informatique


Profil


Formation universitaire ou Ingénieur EPF
Expérience confirmée dans la gestion de données (ERP, PLM, Data Mining)
Maitrise des outils Office et de SAP, Windchill, Tableau constitue un atout
Expérience confirmée dans les méthodes agiles (rôle de Product Owner)
Personne dynamique, autonome, rigoureuse, ouverte d'esprit, apte à travailler en équipe et ayant le sens de la communication et du leadership


Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d'excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificat et diplômes).

#J-18808-Ljbffr

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst with expertise in Veeva CRM and Power BI to join one of our clients in Biotech. This role is crucial in supporting commercial excellence through effective data integration, insightful visualizations, and upskilling internal teams on optimizing the use of Veeva CRM. You will collaborate closely with marketing, sales, IT, and executive teams to drive impactful business decisions.

Key Responsibilities


Data Integration: Lead the integration of commercial and CRM data into Veeva CRM, ensuring accurate and seamless data flow.
Upskilling Teams: Provide informal training and support to internal teams on maximizing the use of Veeva CRM software.
Power BI Visualization: Analyze complex datasets and create meaningful visualizations using Power BI to aid decision-making for internal stakeholders.
Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, sales, IT, and executive teams to support commercial excellence through data-driven insights.
Performance Reviews: Assist in preparing monthly performance reviews for different countries by extracting and analyzing CRM and sales data.


Required Skills And Experience


5+ years of experience in data analysis, with a strong focus on Veeva CRM and Power BI.
Expertise in Veeva CRM, including experience with data integration and process optimization.
Proven ability to create insightful, actionable visualizations in Power BI.
Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work across multiple departments (marketing, sales, IT, and executives).
Biotech, rare diseases, or product launch experience preferred.
Multilingual capabilities (German or French) are a plus but not required.
A go-getter attitude, with a passion for data and driving business results.


Position: Data Analyst

Contract: 12 months

Location: Switzerland (EU remote options)

Start Date: Immediately or by agreement

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Are you eager to play a pivotal role in satisfying customer needs and contributing to business success, all while leveraging data? Join our Migros Online team in Ecublens as a Business Data Analyst and combine your passion with a great work environment to simplify our customers’ lives.

What impact do you have?


Support the Category Management team by collecting and providing relevant data and carrying out analyses to further develop our business and assortment
Provide easy to understand visualizations for KPIs and relevant business metrics to monitor our business performance
Identify opportunities and use data to define the best strategy to tackle them and optimize our core processes
Analyze a wide variety of data from different sources and collaborate with the other member of the Data Analytics and Science team
Have a direct impact on our team processes and best practices applying your agile mindset to continuously improve our way of work
You share relevant insights to raise awareness about ongoing projects and challenges


What do you offer?


Education: Master's degree (university / university of applied science) University degree (Uni/ETH, FH, HF) with focus on Analytics / Economics/ Informatics / Logistics / Engineering or related topics
Experience: 3-5 years in a similar or related field
You are a curious, open, well-organized team player, with a can-do attitude for solving interesting and complex problems
You have a passion for numbers and your business acumen allows you to quickly identify solutions and provide back of the envelope estimations
Writing clean codes, sharing, and maintaining them, is a core part of your values
Experience with Google Cloud (BigQuery, Vertex AI, Looker, Power BI), Python (most common packages and ML packages)
You have experience in the retail industry or related fields
You are familiar with Agile methodologies or worked in a group adopting them
French (C2)
German (ADVANTAGEOUS)
English (B2)


What do we offer you?


Mobile flexible working model: Work at home or in different locations with flexible schedule based on your position
Maternity/paternity leave: 18-week maternity leave paid at 100% and 4-week paternity leave paid at 100%
Mobility: Participation in the costs of purchasing a public transport pass
Mobile phone subscription: Cell phone subscription at attractive rates
Catering: A company restaurant is available for employees to eat at preferential rates
Cumulus points: Benefit from additional Cumulus points
Employee offers: Various offers at attractive rates: Migros Online delivery subscription, Migros Bank, Migrol, Mobility, Axa Winterthur, etc
Sports and fitness offers: We value your health and offer CHF 250.- per year when taking out a sports subscription
Individual continuing training: We value your development and participate in your growth and offer a budget for it
Informal culture: We stand for respectful cooperation on the same level
Personal responsibility & freedom: We value direct communication and involve our employees in the decision-making process
Additional holidays: We encourage a good work-life balance with the possibility to purchase 2 weeks of holidays per calendar year or take unpaid leave for a longer time


Only online applications can be accepted on the applications portal.Recruitment process


Personal video or telephone call
Interview with HR & specialist department
Technical interview with case presentation
Getting to know the team


Contact

Ms. Lisa Walther

HR Business Partner

No suitable vacancies?

Set up a search subscription to ensure you receive suitable job vacancies conveniently by e-mail. Set up a job subscription

Title: Data Analytics Intern
Description:
Position Snapshot

Location: Vevey, Switzerland

Company: Société des Produits Nestlé S.A.

Act. Rate: At least 50% - Flexible

Type of contract: Internship, 6 months

What We Offer At Nestlé

International, diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment : Read more about our Nestlé Community

Opportunities to have an impact and contribute to your team’s success!

Endless learning opportunities and enriching experiences!

Strong mentorship for your professional growth

Professional network and route to entry level position

Position Summary

As a Data Analytics Intern, you will be part of the Data Analytics team at Nestlé's Internal Audit (NIA) unit, located in the Nestlé HQ in Vevey.

We offer a dynamic, inclusive, and international working environment with many opportunities across different businesses, functions, and regions. Don’t miss the opportunity to join us and work with different teams in an agile and diverse context.

A Day in the Life of a Data Analytics Intern

60% of the time:


Collaborate on a day-by-day basis with your managers, in providing data analytics support to internal auditors, updating documentation, and developing ad-hoc solutions in Databricks (R) and MS Power BI


40% of the time:


Expand Analytical Packages (Deep Dive)
Engage with internal auditors and subject matter experts to design the scripts
Test scripts during audits
Develop new scripts in the area of Sales and Supply to complement existing solutions


What Will Make You Successful


Student in Master degree in Management or equivalent
A strong interest to work in a multinational environment, and in the world of control and audit. Being interested to join Nestlé as an Operational Internal Auditor is a plus
Good R knowledge as well in Microsoft Excel
Previous experience in MS Power BI Desktop a plus
Fluent in English


At Nestlé, we want to help shape a better and healthier world, inspire people to live healthier lives and deliver impact at a scale and pace that makes a difference. We do this by fostering a diverse, friendly, supportive, and collaborative environment, that creates positive disruption, embraces innovation, and empowers people and teams to win.

We aim to hire friendly, respectful, inspiring people who care about the people’s lives that we touch every single day.

Be a force for good. Join Nestlé and visit us on www.nestle.com.

Title: Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst 40%
Description:
At Endress+Hauser, progress happens by working together. As the global leader in measurement instrumentation, our ~17.000 employees shape the future in the field of process automation. Whether developing and realizing new technology as a team, collaborating to build instrumentation, or strengthening vital relationships with countless global industries, we work to create trusted relationships that help everyone thrive. As a family-owned company, we look beyond short-term moves and work to create a vision that is forward-thinking for our people, our clients, and the world at large.   

We are looking for a Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst with 40% workload to join our Group and and contribute to our cross-functional project team. The position is located in Reinach, BL, Switzerland.

What is the role about? 

Are you passionate about data analysis and creating solutions that drive business decisions? Do you enjoy working collaboratively in a dynamic team environment? Are you eager to take on challenges and make an impact through your work? If so, you are the type of person who would excel in our Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst role. Join us in leveraging data to optimize our demand planning processes, contributing to the success of our integrated business planning initiatives.

Which tasks will you perform? 


You will analyze data as a member if the Integrated Business Planning Data Team, contributing to informed decision making
You will autonomously find solutions to given tasks regarding data analysis, demonstrating resourcefulness and initiative
You will develop diagrams to visually represent complex data sets and analysis results
You will interpret and document data analysis results, providing clear insights for stakeholders


What do we expect from you?  


Enrolled student
Advanced statistics knowledge
Experience with business warehouse (bw) and business application programming (bap)
Advanced knowledge of Excel, including SAP Analysis for Microsoft Office Plug-in
Collaborating effectively within cross-functional teams
Knowledge of demand planning and analysis of market-related figures is an advantage


What can you expect from us? 


We are a family-owned, highly committed company with a sustainable vision.
We prioritize Work-Life Balance, offering flexible working hours and remote work opportunities to support our employees in maintaining a healthy balance.
We promote lifelong learning with versatile training and further education opportunities, internal knowledge transfer and e-learning.  


How do you apply?

To apply we kindly ask you to upload your documents on our career page.

Applications sent to us by E-Mail cannot unfortunately be considered due to Data Privacy considerations.

Agencies, HR service providers, or similar entities are kindly requested to refrain from unsolicited submission of profiles and inquiries regarding potential collaboration. Currently, we do not engage with external service providers for this role. Any unsolicited applications will be disregarded and deleted without further consideration. We appreciate your understanding.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 1884, Bulgari’s name has today become emblematic of Italian excellence. Perfectly blending tradition and modernity, Bulgari uses its rich history to inspire audacious designs and produce truly colorful creations making us unique. Internationally renowned, from our roots in jewelry and watches we have branched out into accessories, perfumes and luxury resorts. Excellence, enthusiasm and passion are the chemistry of everything we do.

In order to strengthen our Data, Business Intelligence, and AI team, we are recruiting our next :




Senior Data Analyst




As a key member of our Data and BI team, you will play a pivotal role in maintaining ongoing Power BI reports and projects while developing new insights that directly impact the business. Your strong analytical skills, combined with a passion for transforming business requirements into actionable insights, will support multiple departments and contribute to the company's success.

You will ensure a seamless transition of projects from the previous Senior Data Analyst, while continuously evolving our data reporting landscape. You will collaborate closely with various stakeholders across departments, from High Management to Operations, ensuring the accuracy and efficiency of our data processes.




Job responsibilities




Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide business insights using Power BI.
Ensure the smooth transition of current reports and projects from the existing Senior Data Analyst.
Develop and maintain Power BI reports for departments including High Management, Marketing, Operations, and AFSS.
Create dataflows and semantic models within Power BI to enhance reporting capabilities.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into clear, actionable reporting metrics.
Train and support internal teams in the effective use of Power BI and establish a Power BI users' community.
Work closely with the Data Engineering team to optimize ETL pipelines and data transformation processes within the Microsoft Azure environment.
Stay updated on data analysis tools, techniques, and industry trends to continuously improve the data strategy.




Profile




With a Master’s degree in computer science, data science, business intelligence, or a related field, you possess a strong analytical mindset and a proactive approach to solving complex problems. You excel in communicating technical insights to non-technical stakeholders, helping drive performance across the business.




You bring a wealth of experience with a minimum of 5 years in Business Intelligence, specifically focusing on Power BI. Your expertise in data transformation processes within Power BI (Dataflows, Semantic Models, and access management) is essential to this role. Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Data Engineering practices, particularly in ETL and pipeline management within the Microsoft Azure ecosystem, are key requirements.




As a Senior Data Analyst, your role is crucial in providing the tools and insights necessary to enhance business performance while contributing to the ongoing evolution of our data-driven strategies.




Fluency in both French and English is mandatory; knowledge of Italian is a plus.

Title: Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Profil du candidat


You hold a master’s degree in engineering / finance or an equivalent.
You have 2-3 years’ experience in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component.
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender. Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Activités

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst with the Deputy Head of Energy Data Management on the team is responsible for the reconciliation, P&L explanation and invoice-able amount of nearly 1.8 billion Euros from these group affiliated contracts a year with growth expected. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub.

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeters, is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst as part of the Trading Support department is responsible to ensure reconciliations with group affiliates.

Energy Data Portfolio Analyst will work with Trading Systems team to ensure systems can manage contracts that fits the needs of all departments such as Front Office, Middle Office, Back Office and Finance departments. Contracts can include but not limited to Power Purchase Agreements, Procurement of Gas and Power for industrial sites of the affiliates, Energy Mechanisms, and Gas Sales Agreements

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:


Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Reconciling group affiliated contracts and booking of actualization of contract into trading system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Produce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.



Contexte et environnement

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.
Show more
HTML:
Profil du candidat

  • You hold a master’s degree in engineering / finance or an equivalent.
  • You have 2-3 years’ experience in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component.
  • Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
  • Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
  • A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
  • Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
  • Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.


At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender. Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Activités

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst with the Deputy Head of Energy Data Management on the team is responsible for the reconciliation, P&L explanation and invoice-able amount of nearly 1.8 billion Euros from these group affiliated contracts a year with growth expected. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub.

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeters, is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst as part of the Trading Support department is responsible to ensure reconciliations with group affiliates.

Energy Data Portfolio Analyst will work with Trading Systems team to ensure systems can manage contracts that fits the needs of all departments such as Front Office, Middle Office, Back Office and Finance departments. Contracts can include but not limited to Power Purchase Agreements, Procurement of Gas and Power for industrial sites of the affiliates, Energy Mechanisms, and Gas Sales Agreements

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:

  • Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
  • Reconciling group affiliated contracts and booking of actualization of contract into trading system ahead of settlements.
  • Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
  • Produce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
  • Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
  • Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
  • Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
  • Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.


Contexte et environnement

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Title: Business (insights) Data Analyst
Description:
In 2013, while living abroad, our founders set out to create an online tool that could turn huge PDFs into small, easy-to-send versions in order to send updates to their families. As it turns out, they weren't the only ones with this problem. 10 years later, Smallpdf is one of the most popular PDF tools in the world and among the most visited websites globally. With products available in 24 languages, the site has visitors from every single country in the world, plus Antarctica, and processes millions of documents each day.

In 2022, we took a big step forward by acquiring PDF Tools, a Zurich-based pioneer for products that help to create, manipulate, and validate PDF- and PDF/A- files to support and improve our customers’ document workflows.

As a team of over >100 people from 34 nationalities in our offices in Zurich, Belgrade, and Barcelona, we're proud to have made PDFs and life a little bit easier for over a billion customers across our web, mobile, and desktop applications. Our reputation for Swiss engineering standards has made us a trusted choice for industry leaders like Lufthansa, UBS, Swiss Life, and millions of people worldwide.




Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly analytical and strategic Business Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing large datasets, deriving actionable insights, and driving commercial initiatives to enhance business performance. You will collaborate with Product, Monetization, Marketing, Finance and Data teams to develop data-driven strategies that improve decision-making and foster business growth.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with teams (Product, Monetization, Marketing, Finance) to understand data needs.
Build and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to track key business metrics and performance.
Translate data into actionable business insights, presenting clear and compelling recommendations to stakeholders to guide strategy, decision-making, and commercial initiatives.
Drive the execution of commercial initiatives based on data insights, ensuring measurable impact on business outcomes.
Formulate and test data-driven hypotheses through experimentation, designing and analyzing A/B tests for pricing, product, and marketing to optimize revenue, profitability, and user engagement.
Continuously monitor and report on the ROI of implemented strategies, recommending iterative improvements.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Data Science, Statistics, Economics, or a related field. A Master’s degree is a plus.
Fluent English skills (oral and written)
2-5 years of experience in a data analytics role, preferably within a commercial or business-focused environment.
Proficiency in developing, optimizing and validating SQL queries.
Strong data visualization skills using tools like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
A keen understanding of business strategy and how data can influence decision-making.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Strong problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
The capacity to examine business requirements across various functional areas and translate them into KPIs, insights, data models and dashboards.
Effective communication and presentation skills to convey complex data findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Nice to Have:

Experience building advanced data models and data models using Python, R or similar.
Experience with predictive analytics, machine learning, or advanced statistical methods.
Past experience working in a tech-driven company with direct-to-consumer (D2C) sales through a digital platform or website.




Why Smallpdf?

Here, every task and challenge is an opportunity to innovate and make a genuine impact. We're a driven team - pragmatic, goal-focused, and always eager to solve the next big problem. This isn’t a place for mere management or grand visions detached from reality; it’s a ground for hands-on champions ready to roll up their sleeves. If you're someone who's willing to dive deep into the action, someone who's more about the journey than just the title, Smallpdf is your destination.




Our benefits

🌍 You get to impact how over 60 million people get work done monthly.

🚀 Push boundaries and dare to fail—that’s how we learn!

🏝️ 30 vacation days—yep, you read that right— you can take them whenever you need them.

🧳 Need a long break? We offer sabbatical leave to employees who’ve been with us for over two years.

👶 16 weeks parental leave—100% of your salary—for all new parents.

🐶 Don’t leave your four-legged friends at home; our offices are pet-friendly.

📚 A personal development budget of up to 2,000 CHF every year, plus days off for courses or training.

🥧 Possibility of a Phantom stock option plan (PSOP). (Conditions apply.)

🧑‍🏫 We offer 1-1 coaching sessions to individual contributors and employees in leadership positions through our external partner 'BetterUp'.

👩‍💻 Hack days to challenge you and your team, plus build amazing things.




Smallpdf is an equal-opportunity employer. We believe our greatest strength is a talented, diverse, and inclusive workforce. We strongly oppose any form of hiring or workplace discrimination against candidates or employees on any basis, including race, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, philosophy, nationality, disability, or genetic information. We’re committed to fostering a safe, supportive environment where everyone can come to work as their full selves and reach their greatest potential.

Submitting your application allows Smallpdf to handle and store your data.

Smallpdf does not seek or accept unsolicited applications or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for and will not pay any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited applications or CVs except as required in a written contract between Smallpdf and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.

Title: Data Analyst SEO (f/m/d)
Description:
Galaxus culture finds its origin in our values: cooperative, innovative, piratesque, responsible, and ambitious. We give feedback straight-up granting everyone the power to own their actions and grow through epic wins and rough patches. “Grow with us. Be brave, stay true" is the mantra that inspires transparency, boosting a culture of openness and knowledge-sharing.

As the top Swiss e-commerce platform, with a crew of over 3,000 across Switzerland, Germany, and Serbia, Galaxus is on the move to new markets. We're on the lookout for characters who know that it’s diversity that gets us to grow and succeed. Being bold and out-of-the-box isn't just encouraged — it's basically our brand.

In this role, you'll use data to improve traffic strategies and work closely with teams on SEO and email marketing. You'll also help refine agile processes, with the freedom to innovate and shape your work.

Your responsibilities


Manage, maintain, and enhance our existing data warehouse to ensure optimal data availability and integrity.
Conduct in-depth data analysis to uncover valuable insights and trends that can drive our traffic acquisition strategy.
Work with developers and product owners to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Identify and capitalize on growth opportunities within the search landscape to improve website visibility and ranking.
Develop visualizations for stakeholders and the team, providing a clear view of our performance and strategic direction.
Regularly monitor and analyze the impact of Google's search algorithm updates on our projects.
Thrive in an open feedback, blameless environment and contribute to our pair programming culture.


Your skills


Higher education degree in computer science (ETH/UNI/FH) or equivalent relevant professional experience.
3+ years of experience analyzing complex data sets, preferably in e-commerce.
Advanced skills in data extraction and processing using SQL and Python/R.
Proficient in data visualization with business intelligence tools like Tableau or Looker Studio.
Competence in statistics, including statistical modeling and A/B testing.
English proficiency is a must.
Familiarity with SEO and technical SEO principles
Understand which data points are critical and how these can impact website traffic
Prioritizing empathy and compassion in decision-making.
Maintaining resilience and agility while adjusting strategies as needed.


Why start with us?


Culture is Everything: Our values – cooperative, innovative, piratesque, responsible, and ambitious – form the foundation of our journey. Culture isn't just part of what we do; it's the essence of who we are.
Courage and Unconventionality: Your courage and innovative spirit are valued here. We challenge conventional wisdom, embracing those who dare to think differently.
Uncomplicated: Simplicity is at our core. We avoid the unnecessary, focusing on what truly matters – your development, our collective achievements, and tackling challenges with adaptability and resilience.
Flexibility and Freedom: We believe that innovation and creativity thrive in an environment where flexibility and freedom are prioritized. We offer home office options, up to 8 weeks of workation, and every position is available from 80-100%.
Fast Lane Growth: With us, growth is a continuous journey. You'll have opportunities to expand your horizons, both personally and professionally. To support this, we offer all employees up to 2'000 EDU-Points.
Other Benefits: Enjoy discounted employee conditions in our shops and much more.


We team up for Success

At Galaxus, we grow talent by teaming up with people from diverse backgrounds to build the best team out there. We stand for equal treatment and opportunities for everyone, no matter your ethnic or national origin, religion, sexual orientation, marital status, gender, gender identity, age, disability, or any other status. Diversity is our fuel for innovation and a culture of openness and collaboration. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.

Title: Data & Business Analyst (80-100%, all genders)
Description:
As we continue to push the boundaries of innovation, this crucial position is at the forefront of our mission to harness the power of Data and bring the company towards a data driven future.

Stand at the crossroads of business and technology fostering the development of new Data products.

Starting date: December 01, 2024

You may apply in English or German.

Tasks

In this position at SWISS IT, your primary focus will be on data.

Your mission: Empower business units to take data driven decisions.

You also contribute to create a modern data landscape, apply governance principles and promote systematic use of data catalogs.


Collaborate with cross functional teams to design, develop and deploy data solutions
Enforce the use of a common data catalog and proactively engage with business stakeholders across SWISS
Provide guidance and support to the IT teams to develop data products, fostering a culture of learning and innovation
You join our SWISS Data Warehouse Migration team to migrate existing data products to Microsoft Fabric
Work closely with the data architect to develop a pragmatic, scalable, and secure cloud data infrastructure that ensures easy data access and aligns with business objectives
Be an active player in the Data Democratization campaign at SWISS
Support stakeholders into analyzing their data and create information from it


Benefits


Paid maternity and paternity leave
Attractive company pension scheme
13th monthly salary
25 days of annual vacation
Diversity programmes
Subsidized parking or public transport
Company health management
Flight benefits
Flexible workhours and part-time working models


Requirements

This role requires a self-motivated Business Analyst to lead data initiatives and assist business units in advancing toward a data-driven approach.


University degree in a quantitative field, with a focus on Computer Science or Data.
1-3 years of relevant experience in business analysis, data governance, or data architecture.
Strong leadership skills in driving data adoption within business units.
Experience with cloud computing (Google Cloud or Azure) is an advantage.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Knowledge of Databricks is a plus.
Entrepreneurial mindset and self-driven approach are essential.
Familiarity with or previous experience in the airline industry would be beneficial.
Ability to quickly and independently adapt to new domains.
Fluency in written and spoken English; proficiency in German is preferred.


For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Company

It’s the little differences that make working at SWISS so appealing. The fact, for example, that we treat every detail with care, see quality in terms of hospitality and view nationality through an international lens. In a similar way, we see variety as richness, a job as an experience and SWISS as a world of inspiration. You, too, will be stimulated in our special working environment – one in which, wherever you are, you’ll always feel: Truly SWISS .... where people matter.

Contact

Yannick Gramfort

recruiting.services@swiss.com

Title: Data Warehouse Analyst
Description:
Über das Unternehmen: Führendes Schweizer Unternehmen im Energiesektor. Das Unternehmen betreibt mehr als 100 Energieproduktionsanlagen, ist die grösste Produzentin von Wasserkraft in der Schweiz und dank Investitionen in Solar- und Windparks sowie in Biomasse-Anlagen auch die grösste Produzentin von erneuerbaren Energien.

Wir suchen:




Data Analyst (w/m/d)




Die Aufgaben:

Zusammenführen von strukturierten und unstrukturierten Datenbeständen unterschiedlicher Formate aus unterschiedlichen Datenquellen
Aufbereiten zusammengeführter Daten für ihre Auswertung in Analyse-Werkzeugen
Erkennen von relevanten Mustern in Daten
Analysieren von Zusammenhängen in Daten
Erstellen von Datenanalysen mit modernen Methoden des Data Mining und Machine Learning
Entwickeln von komplexen Algorithmen (z.B. Clustering, lineare Regression, neuronale Netze, Entscheidungsbäume) für das Ermitteln von Ursache-Wirkungs-Zusammenhängen sowie für das Erstellen von quantitativen Prognosemodellen
Anwenden komplexer Algorithmen für das Ermitteln von Ursache-Wirkungs-Zusammenhängen sowie für das Erstellen von quantitativen Prognosemodellen
Definieren von Anforderungen an Datenanalyse-Systeme
Konzipieren, Realisieren und Betreiben von ICT-Analyse-Infrastrukturen und -Werkzeugen
Integrieren automatisierter Datenanalysen in ICT-Prozesse
Beraten bei der Durchführung von Auswertungen sowie bei der Optimierung von Datenanalysen
Erstellen von Daten-, Funktions- und/oder Objektmodellen
Implementieren von Schnittstellen zu Datenbanken und anderen Applikationen
Pflegen der Dokumentation von ICT-Analyse-Infrastrukturen und -Werkzeugen




Notwendige Kenntnisse:

Fähigkeit, Geschäftsanforderungen in technische Spezifikationen zu übersetzen.
Kenntnisse über bewährte Verfahren der Datenvisualisierung und des Berichtswesens.
Kenntnisse über Datenbankmanagementsysteme und Data-Warehousing-Konzepte.
Vertrautheit mit Back-End-Technologien (z. B. Java, Python, C#, C++).
Vertrautheit mit den Prinzipien der Datenmodellierung, Datenintegration und Data Governance.
Vertrautheit mit Tools zur Datenvisualisierung (z.B. Power BI, Tableau, QlikView)




Kenntnisse von Vorteil:

Kenntnisse von Databricks
optional Kenntnisse von Kafka




Bei Interesse an dieser herausfordernden Position melden Sie sich direkt bei : thomas.geiger@flexsis.ch




Ich freue mich auf Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen.

Show more
HTML:
Über das Unternehmen: Führendes Schweizer Unternehmen im Energiesektor. Das Unternehmen betreibt mehr als 100 Energieproduktionsanlagen, ist die grösste Produzentin von Wasserkraft in der Schweiz und dank Investitionen in Solar- und Windparks sowie in Biomasse-Anlagen auch die grösste Produzentin von erneuerbaren Energien.

Wir suchen:


Data Analyst (w/m/d)


Die Aufgaben:

  • Zusammenführen von strukturierten und unstrukturierten Datenbeständen unterschiedlicher Formate aus unterschiedlichen Datenquellen
  • Aufbereiten zusammengeführter Daten für ihre Auswertung in Analyse-Werkzeugen
  • Erkennen von relevanten Mustern in Daten
  • Analysieren von Zusammenhängen in Daten
  • Erstellen von Datenanalysen mit modernen Methoden des Data Mining und Machine Learning
  • Entwickeln von komplexen Algorithmen (z.B. Clustering, lineare Regression, neuronale Netze, Entscheidungsbäume) für das Ermitteln von Ursache-Wirkungs-Zusammenhängen sowie für das Erstellen von quantitativen Prognosemodellen
  • Anwenden komplexer Algorithmen für das Ermitteln von Ursache-Wirkungs-Zusammenhängen sowie für das Erstellen von quantitativen Prognosemodellen
  • Definieren von Anforderungen an Datenanalyse-Systeme
  • Konzipieren, Realisieren und Betreiben von ICT-Analyse-Infrastrukturen und -Werkzeugen
  • Integrieren automatisierter Datenanalysen in ICT-Prozesse
  • Beraten bei der Durchführung von Auswertungen sowie bei der Optimierung von Datenanalysen
  • Erstellen von Daten-, Funktions- und/oder Objektmodellen
  • Implementieren von Schnittstellen zu Datenbanken und anderen Applikationen
  • Pflegen der Dokumentation von ICT-Analyse-Infrastrukturen und -Werkzeugen


Notwendige Kenntnisse:

  • Fähigkeit, Geschäftsanforderungen in technische Spezifikationen zu übersetzen.
  • Kenntnisse über bewährte Verfahren der Datenvisualisierung und des Berichtswesens.
  • Kenntnisse über Datenbankmanagementsysteme und Data-Warehousing-Konzepte.
  • Vertrautheit mit Back-End-Technologien (z. B. Java, Python, C#, C++).
  • Vertrautheit mit den Prinzipien der Datenmodellierung, Datenintegration und Data Governance.
  • Vertrautheit mit Tools zur Datenvisualisierung (z.B. Power BI, Tableau, QlikView)


Kenntnisse von Vorteil:

  • Kenntnisse von Databricks
  • optional Kenntnisse von Kafka


Bei Interesse an dieser herausfordernden Position melden Sie sich direkt bei : thomas.geiger@flexsis.ch


Ich freue mich auf Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen.

Title: Data Analyst – Metals Sector @ ecoinvent ecoinvent
Description:
We are looking for an ambitious data analyst who is passionate about sustainability and data-driven business. In this role, you will work with ecoinvent users and data providers to enhance the metals sector of the ecoinvent database.

Our mission is to promote and support the availability of high-quality environmental data which is used extensively in the LCA space.

Responsibilities


Provide technical support for diverse projects aimed at improving and developing the core structure of the ecoinvent database and the expansion of its coverage.
Conduct desk research tasks, deep dives into metal production processes, and provide analyses to the sector manager. Review datasets for data provision projects.
Collaborate with external stakeholders, such as data providers, to guide them through the data preparation and submission process.
Support the communication efforts of ecoinvent, reinforcing support for users of the ecoinvent database.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Mining, Metallurgy, Materials Science and engineering or a related field is a must.
Preferably a minimum of one year of industry experience in mining, metal processing, or a related field.
Experience in LCA, practical or theoretical, and the ecoinvent methodology and data is a plus.
Proficiency in English; any other language is an asset.
Proficiency in MS Office.
Basic programming skills in Python.
Basic modeling skills.
Self-motivated attitude, systematic thinking, and strong attention to detail.


#J-18808-Ljbffr

Title: Data & Business Analyst (80-100%, all genders)
Description:
As we continue to push the boundaries of innovation, this crucial position is at the forefront of our mission to harness the power of Data and bring the company towards a data driven future.

Stand at the crossroads of business and technology fostering the development of new Data products.

Starting date: December 01, 2024

You may apply in English or German.

Tasks

In this position at SWISS IT, your primary focus will be on data.

Your mission: Empower business units to take data driven decisions.

You also contribute to create a modern data landscape, apply governance principles and promote systematic use of data catalogs.


Collaborate with cross functional teams to design, develop and deploy data solutions
Enforce the use of a common data catalog and proactively engage with business stakeholders across SWISS
Provide guidance and support to the IT teams to develop data products, fostering a culture of learning and innovation
You join our SWISS Data Warehouse Migration team to migrate existing data products to Microsoft Fabric
Work closely with the data architect to develop a pragmatic, scalable, and secure cloud data infrastructure that ensures easy data access and aligns with business objectives
Be an active player in the Data Democratization campaign at SWISS
Support stakeholders into analyzing their data and create information from it


Benefits


Paid maternity and paternity leave
Attractive company pension scheme
13th monthly salary
25 days of annual vacation
Diversity programmes
Subsidized parking or public transport
Company health management
Flight benefits
Flexible workhours and part-time working models


Requirements

This role requires a self-motivated Business Analyst to lead data initiatives and assist business units in advancing toward a data-driven approach.


University degree in a quantitative field, with a focus on Computer Science or Data.
1-3 years of relevant experience in business analysis, data governance, or data architecture.
Strong leadership skills in driving data adoption within business units.
Experience with cloud computing (Google Cloud or Azure) is an advantage.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Knowledge of Databricks is a plus.
Entrepreneurial mindset and self-driven approach are essential.
Familiarity with or previous experience in the airline industry would be beneficial.
Ability to quickly and independently adapt to new domains.
Fluency in written and spoken English; proficiency in German is preferred.


For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Company

It’s the little differences that make working at SWISS so appealing. The fact, for example, that we treat every detail with care, see quality in terms of hospitality and view nationality through an international lens. In a similar way, we see variety as richness, a job as an experience and SWISS as a world of inspiration. You, too, will be stimulated in our special working environment – one in which, wherever you are, you’ll always feel: Truly SWISS .... where people matter.

Contact

Yannick Gramfort

recruiting.services@swiss.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LocationBinningen, Basel-Landschaft, SwitzerlandBusiness SectorAIContact emailJob ref23614Published30 days ago

We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst with expertise in Veeva CRM and Power BI to join one of our clients in Biotech. This role is crucial in supporting commercial excellence through effective data integration, insightful visualizations, and upskilling internal teams on optimizing the use of Veeva CRM. You will collaborate closely with marketing, sales, IT, and executive teams to drive impactful business decisions.

Key Responsibilities


Data Integration: Lead the integration of commercial and CRM data into Veeva CRM, ensuring accurate and seamless data flow.
Upskilling Teams: Provide informal training and support to internal teams on maximizing the use of Veeva CRM software.
Power BI Visualization: Analyze complex datasets and create meaningful visualizations using Power BI to aid decision-making for internal stakeholders.
Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, sales, IT, and executive teams to support commercial excellence through data-driven insights.
Performance Reviews: Assist in preparing monthly performance reviews for different countries by extracting and analyzing CRM and sales data.



Required Skills And Experience


5+ years of experience in data analysis, with a strong focus on Veeva CRM and Power BI.
Expertise in Veeva CRM, including experience with data integration and process optimization.
Proven ability to create insightful, actionable visualizations in Power BI.
Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work across multiple departments (marketing, sales, IT, and executives).
Biotech, rare diseases, or product launch experience preferred.
Multilingual capabilities (German or French) are a plus but not required.
A go-getter attitude, with a passion for data and driving business results.



Position: Data Analyst

Contract: 12 months

Location: Switzerland (EU remote options)

Start Date: Immediately or by agreement

If interested, please send Gabriel Andrade: g.andrade@panda-int.com, your number/CV ASAP and I'll give you a call. Interviews will start next week.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Zug

Contract: 6-month

Start Date: ASAP

Workload: Full-time

We are seeking a proactive Business Data Analyst for a 6-month project-based role. This position requires a professional with strong strategic insight to shape operational processes, analyze extensive datasets, and provide actionable solutions. The candidate will take initiative to drive strategic discussions and analyses

Your Tasks


Strategic Operations Design: Collaborate with stakeholders to build and refine operational frameworks and processes based on business needs.
Data Inventory & Proposals: Conduct in-depth analysis of overall data inventory, identifying gaps and generating proposals to optimize data usage.
Stakeholder Engagement: Initiate conversations with key stakeholders to gather data requirements, address business questions, and proactively provide insights.
Data Analysis: Analyze large sets of data (around 9000+ tables) using SQL and or Python to determine where to stop, add, or modify processes to meet business objectives.
Project Management: Manage data-focused projects, ensuring timely analysis and communication of results to relevant stakeholders.


Your Profile


5-8 years of experience in strategic data analysis or project-based data operations.
Proficiency in SQL and Python, with experience working with large data sets.
Snowflake Expertise: Utilize Snowflake (or similar data warehousing tools) to manage, analyze, and interpret complex datasets effectively.
Strong analytical mindset with the ability to translate data insights into strategic decisions.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to work independently, take initiative, and proactively address complex business challenges.


Please apply directly online with your CV.


Please only apply if you are eligible to work in Switzerland and the EU*

Title: Internship - Data analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
null

Work Your Magic with us!

Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know you’ve got big plans – so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich people’s lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.

United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.

What we offer: We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We celebrate all dimensions of diversity and believe that it drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!

Apply now and become a part of our diverse team!
