Title: Insights Specialist
Description:
Du bist die treibende Kraft hinter entscheidungsrelevanten Insights, die für unsere Category-Partnerschaften unerlässlich sind. Durch deinen analytischen Scharfsinn und deine Freude an Daten lieferst du den Category Managern das notwendige „Futter“ für Kunden-Workshops. Ob bei der Durchführung von Studien mit Marktforschungsagenturen, der Analyse von Shopper-Trends oder der Aufbereitung kommerzieller Daten – du sorgst stets für eine valide Datenbasis.

Wir suchen per 1. Januar 2025 eine innovative, analytische und verantwortungsvolle Persönlichkeit, welche mit ihrer Expertise in Advanced Analytics, Datenmodellierung und Visualisierung das Team dabei unterstützt, datenbasierte Strategien zu entwickeln und maximale Erfolge zu erzielen.

Hier zählen Erfahrung und bisher erbrachte Leistungen Für die Rolle relevant:


Du besitzt eine betriebswirtschaftliche Ausbildung (FH/Uni) mit Spezialisierung im Bereich Marketing, Marktforschung, Business Analytics oder einem vergleichbaren Bereich; eine Weiterbildung in Data Science, Statistik, Business Intelligence oder Data Engineering ist von Vorteil
Du bringst Erfahrung auf einer ähnlichen Position, in der Marktforschung sowie der Durchführung von Studien mit und bist in der Lage, Trends im Shopper-Verhalten zu erkennen sowie in Strategien umzuwandeln
Du besitzt die Fähigkeit, betriebswirtschaftliche Sachverhalte schnell zu analysieren und gewinnbringend zu nutzen, bist kompetent in der Erarbeitung von Konzepten/Lösungen sowie deren federführender Umsetzung und hast ein Verständnis von Verkaufs- und Aussendienst-Prozessen
Mit deiner Persönlichkeit passt du zur Welt von Red Bull; du bist ziel- und ergebnisorientiert, engagiert, dynamisch und teamfähig
Du hast Erfahrung mit Analyse-Tools wie Python, R, SQL, Snowflake und Microsoft PowerBI, bringst sehr gute Deutsch- sowie Englischkenntnisse mit; Französisch ist von Vorteil


Wir bieten eine äusserst interessante, vielseitige und spannende Tätigkeit sowie eine einzigartige Firmenkultur in einem dynamischen, internationalen Umfeld mit moderner Infrastruktur und einem guten Arbeitsklima.

Lust auf eine Herausforderung? Wir freuen uns auf eine Bewerbung, die Motivation und Kompetenzen enthält – und vor allem auch die Persönlichkeit dahinter erkennen lässt.

Als Arbeitgeber schätzen wir die Diversität und unterstützen Menschen ihre Potenziale und Stärken zu entfalten, ihre Ideen zu verwirklichen und Chancen wahrzunehmen. Die Stellenanzeige richtet sich an alle Menschen gleichermaßen, unabhängig von Alter, Hautfarbe, Religion, Geschlecht, sexueller Orientierung oder Herkunft.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Job Information

Galliker verfügt über ein Netzwerk mit umfassenden Logistikdienstleistungen in all seinen nationalen und internationalen Betrieben. Umso wichtiger ist es, die komplexen Geschäftsprozesse durch eine zeitnahe Bereitstellung relevanter Informationen zu optimieren.

Zum Ausbau unseres Data Analytics Teams in Altishofen (Luzern) suchen wir eine motivierte und verantwortungsbewusste Person als Data Analyst mit Schwerpunkt Power BI. Als Data Analyst übernimmst du Verantwortung bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer cloudbasierten Datenplattform und gestaltest die Business Intelligence und Analytics Strategie proaktiv mit.

Jetzt Bewerben

Aufgabengebiet


Weiterentwickeln der Datenarchitektur basierend auf den Azure Analytics Services
Mitgestalten von Batch sowie Echtzeit Datenpipelines und Datenmodellen, um die korrekte Bereitstellung und Verfügbarkeit von Daten sicherzustellen
Erstellen von Analyse Werkzeugen (z.B. Dashboards und KPIs mit Power BI)
Zusammenarbeiten mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern, um ihre Anforderungen zu erfassen und in Form von sicheren und wertschöpfenden Datenlösungen umzusetzen
Übernehmen von Verantwortung für die Dokumentation, Implementierung und den Betrieb von Dashboards und Datenpipelines


Anforderungsprofil


Abgeschlossenes Studium mit Fachrichtung Informatik oder gleichwertige Aus- oder Weiterbildung
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer ähnlichen Funktion, in der Reports und Dashboards vorzugsweise mit Power BI produktiv umgesetzt wurden
Kenntnisse der neusten Datenarchitektur-Ansätze wie z.B. Data Lakes und Lakehouses
Ausgezeichnetes Verständnis von Datenbanken und Abfragesprachen (SQL)
Ausgewiesene objektorientierte Programmierkenntnisse (z.B. Python) von Vorteil
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift


Angebot


Motiviertes, kollegiales und wachsendes Team
Vielzahl an interessanten Analytics Use Cases mit unternehmensweitem Impact
Kurze Entscheidungswege
Agile Arbeitsweisen und eine topmoderne IT-Infrastruktur
Möglichkeit von Remotearbeit
Breites Einsatzgebiet in der Welt von Transport & Logistik mit internationalen Kontakten

Show more
HTML:
Job Information

Galliker verfügt über ein Netzwerk mit umfassenden Logistikdienstleistungen in all seinen nationalen und internationalen Betrieben. Umso wichtiger ist es, die komplexen Geschäftsprozesse durch eine zeitnahe Bereitstellung relevanter Informationen zu optimieren.

Zum Ausbau unseres Data Analytics Teams in Altishofen (Luzern) suchen wir eine motivierte und verantwortungsbewusste Person als Data Analyst mit Schwerpunkt Power BI. Als Data Analyst übernimmst du Verantwortung bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer cloudbasierten Datenplattform und gestaltest die Business Intelligence und Analytics Strategie proaktiv mit.

Jetzt Bewerben

Aufgabengebiet

  • Weiterentwickeln der Datenarchitektur basierend auf den Azure Analytics Services
  • Mitgestalten von Batch sowie Echtzeit Datenpipelines und Datenmodellen, um die korrekte Bereitstellung und Verfügbarkeit von Daten sicherzustellen
  • Erstellen von Analyse Werkzeugen (z.B. Dashboards und KPIs mit Power BI)
  • Zusammenarbeiten mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern, um ihre Anforderungen zu erfassen und in Form von sicheren und wertschöpfenden Datenlösungen umzusetzen
  • Übernehmen von Verantwortung für die Dokumentation, Implementierung und den Betrieb von Dashboards und Datenpipelines

Anforderungsprofil

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium mit Fachrichtung Informatik oder gleichwertige Aus- oder Weiterbildung
  • Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer ähnlichen Funktion, in der Reports und Dashboards vorzugsweise mit Power BI produktiv umgesetzt wurden
  • Kenntnisse der neusten Datenarchitektur-Ansätze wie z.B. Data Lakes und Lakehouses
  • Ausgezeichnetes Verständnis von Datenbanken und Abfragesprachen (SQL)
  • Ausgewiesene objektorientierte Programmierkenntnisse (z.B. Python) von Vorteil
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift

Angebot

  • Motiviertes, kollegiales und wachsendes Team
  • Vielzahl an interessanten Analytics Use Cases mit unternehmensweitem Impact
  • Kurze Entscheidungswege
  • Agile Arbeitsweisen und eine topmoderne IT-Infrastruktur
  • Möglichkeit von Remotearbeit
  • Breites Einsatzgebiet in der Welt von Transport & Logistik mit internationalen Kontakten

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
In order to strengthen our Data, Business Intelligence, and AI team, we are recruiting our next:

Senior Data Analyst

As a key member of our Data and BI team, you will play a pivotal role in maintaining ongoing Power BI reports and projects while developing new insights that directly impact the business. Your strong analytical skills, combined with a passion for transforming business requirements into actionable insights, will support multiple departments and contribute to the company's success.

You will ensure a seamless transition of projects from the previous Senior Data Analyst, while continuously evolving our data reporting landscape. You will collaborate closely with various stakeholders across departments, from High Management to Operations, ensuring the accuracy and efficiency of our data processes.

Job Responsibilities


Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide business insights using Power BI.
Ensure the smooth transition of current reports and projects from the existing Senior Data Analyst.
Develop and maintain Power BI reports for departments including High Management, Marketing, Operations, and AFSS.
Create dataflows and semantic models within Power BI to enhance reporting capabilities.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into clear, actionable reporting metrics.
Train and support internal teams in the effective use of Power BI and establish a Power BI users' community.
Work closely with the Data Engineering team to optimize ETL pipelines and data transformation processes within the Microsoft Azure environment.
Stay updated on data analysis tools, techniques, and industry trends to continuously improve the data strategy.


Profile

With a Master’s degree in computer science, data science, business intelligence, or a related field, you possess a strong analytical mindset and a proactive approach to solving complex problems. You excel in communicating technical insights to non-technical stakeholders, helping drive performance across the business.

You bring a wealth of experience with a minimum of 5 years in Business Intelligence, specifically focusing on Power BI. Your expertise in data transformation processes within Power BI (Dataflows, Semantic Models, and access management) is essential to this role. Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Data Engineering practices, particularly in ETL and pipeline management within the Microsoft Azure ecosystem, are key requirements.

As a Senior Data Analyst, your role is crucial in providing the tools and insights necessary to enhance business performance while contributing to the ongoing evolution of our data-driven strategies.

Fluency in both French and English is mandatory; knowledge of Italian is a plus.

Title: Data Engineer / Analyst
Description:
In this exciting role, you will be responsible for the development and operation of our end-to-end data streams, from the main source to data visualization. Your main tasks include:


Supporting internal and external stakeholders with data-based questions related to energy economics, as well as micro- and macroeconomic issues.
Data analysis and creation of visualizations based on IT infrastructure principles and self-service management.
Management of dedicated SQL databases, necessary data integration processes, and web visualizations, including documentation of necessary services.


Requirements

For this position, we are looking for a self-reliant, motivated person eager to actively contribute to the environment. You bring the following qualifications:


Higher education (HES/Uni/EPF/EPFL) in business informatics, business administration, economics, data science, or a related field.
Affinity with data science, such as the ability to extract, prepare, visualize, and comment on information from large datasets.
Proficiency in SQL, FME, and Tableau.
Strong team spirit, structured work approach, and willingness to independently and sustainably solve data-related problems.
Excellent command of German and good command of English, both written and spoken; knowledge of French is an asset.


Benefits

We offer you varied and stimulating tasks within a unique company in Switzerland. You will benefit from the following advantages:


A modern working environment within a motivated team, in close proximity to Aarau train station.
Flexible working hours (42 hours per week) with the possibility of remote work.
25 to 30 days of leave as well as collective leave between Christmas and New Year.
Solid social security and attractive retirement plan.
Opportunities for professional development.
Favorable financial and organizational conditions for internal and external training.
Competitive salary and recognition of good performance.

Title: Data Analyst Finance (al genders) 80/100%
Description:
Im Zentrum der Finanzdienstleistungen agieren mit grossem Engagement in die Digitalisierung!

Dafür engagieren sich täglich über 550 kompetente und motivierte Mitarbeitende.

Dabei ist die stete Weiterbildung, um die Voreiterrolle weiterhin zu bekleiden eine Voraussetzung!

Aufgaben


Weiterentwicklung der Tools für datenbasiertes und teilautomatisiertes Controlling
Datenanalyse und Visualisierung mit Fokus auf quantitative Analysen
Mitarbeit bei der Weiterentwicklung der Tools für die simulationsbasierten Berechnungen
Mitarbeit bei der Betreuung von Versicherungsunternehmen
Mitarbeit bei der stetigen Weiterentwicklung und Pflege der Standardmodelle und dazu passender Tools (inklusive IT-Implementierungen) in der Versicherung


Profil


Hochschulabschluss im quantitativen Bereich (Mathematik, Statistik, Data Science, Informatik, Physik)
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Datenbanken (SQL) und in Programmiersprachen im Bereich der Datenanalyse, z.B. R, Python, ggf. Matlab
Erfahrung in der Datenverarbeitung und -analyse sowie in der Aufbereitung und Berichten
Vernetztes Denken sowie zuverlässige, systematische und selbständige Arbeitsweise
Erste Berufserfahrung im quantitativen Risikomanagement, Erfahrung mit dem SST wünschenswert
Ausgeprägte Eigeninitiative und Kreativität sowie Freude an der Zusammenarbeit im Team
Sehr gute Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch oder Französisch (C2) sowie gute Kenntnisse der jeweils anderen Sprache und gute Kenntnisse in Englisch (B2)

Title: Business Analyst - Data Modelling focus
Description:
CONTRACT / FREELANCE ROLE:




Hours: 100%

Location: Bern area, 2 Days on site a month!

Duration: 12 Months with likely extension

Language: German Business Fluent

Start Date: ASAP, no later than November 1st with 50%




Duties:

• You analyze, specify, model, validate and manage technical data requirements of their internal customers.

• In coordination with customers, you convert requirements into technical configurations (Python, YAML, SQL).

• With your professional and technical perspective, you create user stories for the further development of the synthetic data model and support the implementation.

• In the overarching release plan, you generate synthetic data and deliver it to customers.

• You update your own data storage as a basis for mass testing.




PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU ARE NOT A B2+ German speaking




Any questions, please call me +49 89 26201413




Rees Price

Eurobase

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst with expertise in Veeva CRM and Power BI to join one of our clients in Biotech. This role is crucial in supporting commercial excellence through effective data integration, insightful visualizations, and upskilling internal teams on optimizing the use of Veeva CRM. You will collaborate closely with marketing, sales, IT, and executive teams to drive impactful business decisions.

Key Responsibilities


Data Integration: Lead the integration of commercial and CRM data into Veeva CRM, ensuring accurate and seamless data flow.
Upskilling Teams: Provide informal training and support to internal teams on maximizing the use of Veeva CRM software.
Power BI Visualization: Analyze complex datasets and create meaningful visualizations using Power BI to aid decision-making for internal stakeholders.
Collaboration: Work closely with marketing, sales, IT, and executive teams to support commercial excellence through data-driven insights.
Performance Reviews: Assist in preparing monthly performance reviews for different countries by extracting and analyzing CRM and sales data.


Required Skills And Experience


5+ years of experience in data analysis, with a strong focus on Veeva CRM and Power BI.
Expertise in Veeva CRM, including experience with data integration and process optimization.
Proven ability to create insightful, actionable visualizations in Power BI.
Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work across multiple departments (marketing, sales, IT, and executives).
Biotech, rare diseases, or product launch experience preferred.
Multilingual capabilities (German or French) are a plus but not required.
A go-getter attitude, with a passion for data and driving business results.


Position: Data Analyst

Contract: 12 months

Location: Switzerland (EU remote options)

Start Date: Immediately or by agreement

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Are you eager to play a pivotal role in satisfying customer needs and contributing to business success, all while leveraging data? Join our Migros Online team in Ecublens as a Business Data Analyst and combine your passion with a great work environment to simplify our customers’ lives.

What impact do you have?


Support the Category Management team by collecting and providing relevant data and carrying out analyses to further develop our business and assortment
Provide easy to understand visualizations for KPIs and relevant business metrics to monitor our business performance
Identify opportunities and use data to define the best strategy to tackle them and optimize our core processes
Analyze a wide variety of data from different sources and collaborate with the other member of the Data Analytics and Science team
Have a direct impact on our team processes and best practices applying your agile mindset to continuously improve our way of work
You share relevant insights to raise awareness about ongoing projects and challenges


What do you offer?


Education: Master's degree (university / university of applied science) University degree (Uni/ETH, FH, HF) with focus on Analytics / Economics/ Informatics / Logistics / Engineering or related topics
Experience: 3-5 years in a similar or related field
You are a curious, open, well-organized team player, with a can-do attitude for solving interesting and complex problems
You have a passion for numbers and your business acumen allows you to quickly identify solutions and provide back of the envelope estimations
Writing clean codes, sharing, and maintaining them, is a core part of your values
Experience with Google Cloud (BigQuery, Vertex AI, Looker, Power BI), Python (most common packages and ML packages)
You have experience in the retail industry or related fields
You are familiar with Agile methodologies or worked in a group adopting them
French (C2)
German (ADVANTAGEOUS)
English (B2)


What do we offer you?


Mobile flexible working model: Work at home or in different locations with flexible schedule based on your position
Maternity/paternity leave: 18-week maternity leave paid at 100% and 4-week paternity leave paid at 100%
Mobility: Participation in the costs of purchasing a public transport pass
Mobile phone subscription: Cell phone subscription at attractive rates
Catering: A company restaurant is available for employees to eat at preferential rates
Cumulus points: Benefit from additional Cumulus points
Employee offers: Various offers at attractive rates: Migros Online delivery subscription, Migros Bank, Migrol, Mobility, Axa Winterthur, etc
Sports and fitness offers: We value your health and offer CHF 250.- per year when taking out a sports subscription
Individual continuing training: We value your development and participate in your growth and offer a budget for it
Informal culture: We stand for respectful cooperation on the same level
Personal responsibility & freedom: We value direct communication and involve our employees in the decision-making process
Additional holidays: We encourage a good work-life balance with the possibility to purchase 2 weeks of holidays per calendar year or take unpaid leave for a longer time


Only online applications can be accepted on the applications portal.Recruitment process


Personal video or telephone call
Interview with HR & specialist department
Technical interview with case presentation
Getting to know the team


Contact

Ms. Lisa Walther

HR Business Partner

No suitable vacancies?

Set up a search subscription to ensure you receive suitable job vacancies conveniently by e-mail. Set up a job subscription

  • Mobile phone subscription: Cell phone subscription at attractive rates
  • Catering: A company restaurant is available for employees to eat at preferential rates
  • Cumulus points: Benefit from additional Cumulus points
  • Employee offers: Various offers at attractive rates: Migros Online delivery subscription, Migros Bank, Migrol, Mobility, Axa Winterthur, etc
  • Sports and fitness offers: We value your health and offer CHF 250.- per year when taking out a sports subscription
  • Individual continuing training: We value your development and participate in your growth and offer a budget for it
  • Informal culture: We stand for respectful cooperation on the same level
  • Personal responsibility & freedom: We value direct communication and involve our employees in the decision-making process
  • Additional holidays: We encourage a good work-life balance with the possibility to purchase 2 weeks of holidays per calendar year or take unpaid leave for a longer time

Only online applications can be accepted on the applications portal.Recruitment process

  • Personal video or telephone call
  • Interview with HR & specialist department
  • Technical interview with case presentation
  • Getting to know the team

Contact

Ms. Lisa Walther

HR Business Partner

Title: Metals Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for an ambitious data analyst who is passionate about sustainability and data-driven business. In this role, you will work with ecoinvent users and data providers to enhance the metals sector of the ecoinvent database.

Responsibilities


Provide technical support for diverse projects aimed at improving and developing the core structure of the ecoinvent database and the expansion of its coverage.
Desk research tasks, deep dives into metal production processes, and providing analyses to the sector manager. Reviewing datasets for data provision projects.
Collaborate with external stakeholders, such as data providers, to guide them through the data preparation and submission process.
Support the communication efforts of ecoinvent, reinforcing support for users of the ecoinvent database.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Mining, Metallurgy, Materials Science and engineering or a related field a must.
Preferably a minimum of one year of industry experience in mining, metal processing, or a related field.
Experience in LCA, practical or theoretical, and the ecoinvent methodology and data is a plus.
Proficiency in English; any other language is an asset.
Proficiency in MS Office.
Python coding.
Basic modeling skills.
Self-motivated attitude, systematic thinking, and strong attention to detail.


The ideal candidate brings strong critical thinking skills and a problem-solving attitude. You are proactive, structured, and organized. You are enthusiastic about learning and pushing for innovation. You will work independently and alongside internal and external collaborators, so good interpersonal skills, effective communication skills, and a can-do attitude are essential. Managing multiple, diverse tasks simultaneously does not phase you. You enjoy working in a diverse and international team, have a curious mind, and grasp new concepts quickly.

Why ecoinvent?

As a fast-growing team based in Zürich with over twenty nationalities, we embrace diversity and promote a collaborative and adventurous mindset. We are committed to building an inspiring work culture that nurtures creative thinking, transparency, and reliability.

Our benefits include flexible and hybrid work, employee professional growth plans, and our most vital asset: our community. We value transparency, flexibility, and a diverse working environment that encourages learning and continuous improvement. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do. Join us and make an impact.

Our Mission

ecoinvent is an internationally active, mission-driven organization devoted to supporting high-quality, science-based environmental assessments. Its activities include publishing and maintaining the ecoinvent database—a comprehensive life cycle inventory database that provides reliable and transparent information on the environmental impacts of various products and services. It is used by companies, researchers, and policymakers to analyze the environmental impacts of their operations and make informed decisions.

Interested in this unique opportunity?

Please submit your complete application through our LinkedIn posting, including your CV and possible start date.

Please note that immigration sponsorship is not possible for this role.

Description du poste

Pour le département IT de notre partenaire genevois, nous recrutons un ou une Data Analyst GRC.

Responsabilités

En tant que Data Analyst GRC, vous créez et faites évoluer les extractions de données ainsi que les tableaux de bord interactifs et intuitifs. De plus, vous contrôlez la qualité des données (analyse et correction d'erreur). Vous décrivez et améliorez les processus de qualité. Le support et la formation des utilisateurs métier font aussi partie de vos attributions. Par ailleurs, vous maintenez et faites évoluer les paramétrages de l'outil SGI, garantissant sa bonne configuration. D'autre part, vous évaluez et résolvez les risques techniques dans le SCI avec des solutions innovantes.

Profil


Bachelor en IT ou équivalent
Excellente expérience en Business Intelligence
Expérience préalable en environnement CRM
Excellentes connaissances SQL
Bonnes connaissances Sage X3
Français courant obligatoire

Title: Data Analytics Intern
Description:
Position Snapshot

Location: Vevey, Switzerland

Company: Société des Produits Nestlé S.A.

Act. Rate: At least 50% - Flexible

Type of contract: Internship, 6 months

What We Offer At Nestlé

International, diverse, equitable and inclusive work environment : Read more about our Nestlé Community

Opportunities to have an impact and contribute to your team’s success!

Endless learning opportunities and enriching experiences!

Strong mentorship for your professional growth

Professional network and route to entry level position

Position Summary

As a Data Analytics Intern, you will be part of the Data Analytics team at Nestlé's Internal Audit (NIA) unit, located in the Nestlé HQ in Vevey.

We offer a dynamic, inclusive, and international working environment with many opportunities across different businesses, functions, and regions. Don’t miss the opportunity to join us and work with different teams in an agile and diverse context.

A Day in the Life of a Data Analytics Intern

60% of the time:


Collaborate on a day-by-day basis with your managers, in providing data analytics support to internal auditors, updating documentation, and developing ad-hoc solutions in Databricks (R) and MS Power BI


40% of the time:


Expand Analytical Packages (Deep Dive)
Engage with internal auditors and subject matter experts to design the scripts
Test scripts during audits
Develop new scripts in the area of Sales and Supply to complement existing solutions


What Will Make You Successful


Student in Master degree in Management or equivalent
A strong interest to work in a multinational environment, and in the world of control and audit. Being interested to join Nestlé as an Operational Internal Auditor is a plus
Good R knowledge as well in Microsoft Excel
Previous experience in MS Power BI Desktop a plus
Fluent in English


At Nestlé, we want to help shape a better and healthier world, inspire people to live healthier lives and deliver impact at a scale and pace that makes a difference. We do this by fostering a diverse, friendly, supportive, and collaborative environment, that creates positive disruption, embraces innovation, and empowers people and teams to win.

We aim to hire friendly, respectful, inspiring people who care about the people’s lives that we touch every single day.

Be a force for good. Join Nestlé and visit us on www.nestle.com.

Title: Metals Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for an ambitious data analyst who is passionate about sustainability and data-driven business. In this role, you will work with ecoinvent users and data providers to enhance the metals sector of the ecoinvent database.

Responsibilities


Provide technical support for diverse projects aimed at improving and developing the core structure of the ecoinvent database and the expansion of its coverage.
Conduct desk research tasks, deep dives into metal production processes, and provide analyses to the sector manager. Review datasets for data provision projects.
Collaborate with external stakeholders, such as data providers, to guide them through the data preparation and submission process.
Support the communication efforts of ecoinvent, reinforcing support for users of the ecoinvent database.

Experience in LCA, practical or theoretical, and the ecoinvent methodology and data is a plus.
Proficiency in English; any other language is an asset.
Proficiency in MS Office.
Python coding skills.
Basic modeling skills.
Self-motivated attitude, systematic thinking, and strong attention to detail.


The ideal candidate brings strong critical thinking skills and a problem-solving attitude. You are proactive, structured, and organized. Title: Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst 40%
Description:
At Endress+Hauser, progress happens by working together. As the global leader in measurement instrumentation, our ~17.000 employees shape the future in the field of process automation. Whether developing and realizing new technology as a team, collaborating to build instrumentation, or strengthening vital relationships with countless global industries, we work to create trusted relationships that help everyone thrive. As a family-owned company, we look beyond short-term moves and work to create a vision that is forward-thinking for our people, our clients, and the world at large.   

We are looking for a Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst with 40% workload to join our Group and and contribute to our cross-functional project team. The position is located in Reinach, BL, Switzerland.

What is the role about? 

Are you passionate about data analysis and creating solutions that drive business decisions? Do you enjoy working collaboratively in a dynamic team environment? Are you eager to take on challenges and make an impact through your work? If so, you are the type of person who would excel in our Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst role. Join us in leveraging data to optimize our demand planning processes, contributing to the success of our integrated business planning initiatives.

Which tasks will you perform? 


You will analyze data as a member if the Integrated Business Planning Data Team, contributing to informed decision making
You will autonomously find solutions to given tasks regarding data analysis, demonstrating resourcefulness and initiative
You will develop diagrams to visually represent complex data sets and analysis results
You will interpret and document data analysis results, providing clear insights for stakeholders


What do we expect from you?  


Enrolled student
Advanced statistics knowledge
Experience with business warehouse (bw) and business application programming (bap)
Advanced knowledge of Excel, including SAP Analysis for Microsoft Office Plug-in
Collaborating effectively within cross-functional teams
Knowledge of demand planning and analysis of market-related figures is an advantage


What can you expect from us? 


We are a family-owned, highly committed company with a sustainable vision.
We prioritize Work-Life Balance, offering flexible working hours and remote work opportunities to support our employees in maintaining a healthy balance.
We promote lifelong learning with versatile training and further education opportunities, internal knowledge transfer and e-learning.  


How do you apply?

To apply we kindly ask you to upload your documents on our career page.

Applications sent to us by E-Mail cannot unfortunately be considered due to Data Privacy considerations.

Agencies, HR service providers, or similar entities are kindly requested to refrain from unsolicited submission of profiles and inquiries regarding potential collaboration. Currently, we do not engage with external service providers for this role. Any unsolicited applications will be disregarded and deleted without further consideration. We appreciate your understanding.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 1884, Bulgari’s name has today become emblematic of Italian excellence. Perfectly blending tradition and modernity, Bulgari uses its rich history to inspire audacious designs and produce truly colorful creations making us unique. Internationally renowned, from our roots in jewelry and watches we have branched out into accessories, perfumes and luxury resorts. Excellence, enthusiasm and passion are the chemistry of everything we do.

In order to strengthen our Data, Business Intelligence, and AI team, we are recruiting our next :




Senior Data Analyst




As a key member of our Data and BI team, you will play a pivotal role in maintaining ongoing Power BI reports and projects while developing new insights that directly impact the business. Your strong analytical skills, combined with a passion for transforming business requirements into actionable insights, will support multiple departments and contribute to the company's success.

You will ensure a seamless transition of projects from the previous Senior Data Analyst, while continuously evolving our data reporting landscape. You will collaborate closely with various stakeholders across departments, from High Management to Operations, ensuring the accuracy and efficiency of our data processes.




Job responsibilities




Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide business insights using Power BI.
Ensure the smooth transition of current reports and projects from the existing Senior Data Analyst.
Develop and maintain Power BI reports for departments including High Management, Marketing, Operations, and AFSS.
Create dataflows and semantic models within Power BI to enhance reporting capabilities.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into clear, actionable reporting metrics.
Train and support internal teams in the effective use of Power BI and establish a Power BI users' community.
Work closely with the Data Engineering team to optimize ETL pipelines and data transformation processes within the Microsoft Azure environment.
Stay updated on data analysis tools, techniques, and industry trends to continuously improve the data strategy.




Profile




With a Master’s degree in computer science, data science, business intelligence, or a related field, you possess a strong analytical mindset and a proactive approach to solving complex problems. You excel in communicating technical insights to non-technical stakeholders, helping drive performance across the business.




You bring a wealth of experience with a minimum of 5 years in Business Intelligence, specifically focusing on Power BI. Your expertise in data transformation processes within Power BI (Dataflows, Semantic Models, and access management) is essential to this role. Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Data Engineering practices, particularly in ETL and pipeline management within the Microsoft Azure ecosystem, are key requirements.




As a Senior Data Analyst, your role is crucial in providing the tools and insights necessary to enhance business performance while contributing to the ongoing evolution of our data-driven strategies.




Fluency in both French and English is mandatory; knowledge of Italian is a plus.

Title: Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
Description:
Profil du candidat


You hold a master’s degree in engineering / finance or an equivalent.
You have 2-3 years’ experience in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component.
Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.



At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender. Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Activités

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst with the Deputy Head of Energy Data Management on the team is responsible for the reconciliation, P&L explanation and invoice-able amount of nearly 1.8 billion Euros from these group affiliated contracts a year with growth expected. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub.

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeters, is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst as part of the Trading Support department is responsible to ensure reconciliations with group affiliates.

Energy Data Portfolio Analyst will work with Trading Systems team to ensure systems can manage contracts that fits the needs of all departments such as Front Office, Middle Office, Back Office and Finance departments. Contracts can include but not limited to Power Purchase Agreements, Procurement of Gas and Power for industrial sites of the affiliates, Energy Mechanisms, and Gas Sales Agreements

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:


Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
Reconciling group affiliated contracts and booking of actualization of contract into trading system ahead of settlements.
Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
Produce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.



Contexte et environnement

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.
Show more
HTML:
Profil du candidat

  • You hold a master’s degree in engineering / finance or an equivalent.
  • You have 2-3 years’ experience in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component.
  • Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
  • Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
  • A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
  • Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
  • Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.


At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender. Candidates with disabilities are encouraged to apply. We will provide necessary accommodations upon request.

Activités

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst with the Deputy Head of Energy Data Management on the team is responsible for the reconciliation, P&L explanation and invoice-able amount of nearly 1.8 billion Euros from these group affiliated contracts a year with growth expected. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub.

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeters, is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst as part of the Trading Support department is responsible to ensure reconciliations with group affiliates.

Energy Data Portfolio Analyst will work with Trading Systems team to ensure systems can manage contracts that fits the needs of all departments such as Front Office, Middle Office, Back Office and Finance departments. Contracts can include but not limited to Power Purchase Agreements, Procurement of Gas and Power for industrial sites of the affiliates, Energy Mechanisms, and Gas Sales Agreements

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:

  • Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
  • Reconciling group affiliated contracts and booking of actualization of contract into trading system ahead of settlements.
  • Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
  • Produce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
  • Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
  • Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
  • Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
  • Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.


Contexte et environnement

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Title: Business & Data Analyste
Description:
Dans Le Cadre De Ses Activités De Développement, Notre Client, Une Magnifique Manufacture Horlogère, Recherche Pour Son Site Du Locle Son Ou Sa Futur/e

Business & Data Analyste H/F


Éliciter et analyser les besoins pour les interfaces avec l'ERP
Key user ERP ProConcept (et référent pour le consulting)
Piloter et suivre les tickets d'amélioration liés à l'ERP et ses interfaces
Mettre en place les règles de gestion des données de base et des flux logistiques et de production
Documenter les flux, procédures et modes opératoires liés aux fonctionnements de l'entreprise, et garantir la formation des utilisateurs
Créer et améliorer les indicateurs clés (vente, approvisionnements, planification, stock)
Supporter les différents départements dans la création et la modification des données
Participer aux projets en lien avec la gestion et l'optimisation des données de base permettant le bon fonctionnement de la supply-chain et de la production
Participer au déploiement d'outil tels que BI et d'un APS (Advanced Planning and Scheduling) en interface avec l'ERP ProConcept
Garantir une communication fiable et transparente avec nos partenaires internes et externes
Participer à la performance du département Achats & Logistique
Agir et penser dans une démarche de développement durable ainsi que pour l'optimisation des flux logistiques responsables


Vous êtes titulaire d'un Diplôme de Technicien(-ne) ES en exploitation et logistique, ou jugé équivalent

Vous justifiez d'une expérience reconnue d'au moins 5 années dans une fonction similaire, combinée aux métiers de la Supply Chain

Vous maîtrisez les outils bureautiques et de solutions BI (Power BI, Cognos ou Tableau)

Vous avez de l'expérience dans le déploiement de solutions APS (Blue Yonder, Rapide Response)

Personnalité autonome, rigoureuse et orientée solutions, vous avez le sens du détail et possédez un fort esprit d'analyse

De plus, vous êtes force de proposition et doté(e) d'une communication aisée

Title: business e data analyst
Description:
Apprezza una collaborazione di successo?

Tramite l'analisi dei dati e un'ampia comprensione dei nessi immobiliari, contribuirà a sviluppare ulteriormente il nostro portafoglio immobiliare unico nel suo genere. Grazie alla sua capacità di lavorare in modo strategico e concettuale, potrà tradurre i requisiti interdisciplinari derivanti dalla gestione immobiliare e dal settore della sostenibilità in una gestione efficace dei dati. Nel nostro Ufficio avrà la possibilità di realizzare la sua passione per l'elaborazione e l'analisi dei dati a favore di una gestione sostenibile degli immobili.

Le Sue mansioni


Svolgere analisi di dati e modellazioni per riconoscere tendenze e modelli e illustrare previsioni di sviluppo
Acquisire ed elaborare dati e implementare le procedure di controllo della qualità
Valutare dati e fattori ambientali per promuovere la sostenibilità nel settore immobiliare e seguirne gli sviluppi
Fornire supporto allo sviluppo e all'attuazione di strategie aziendali attraverso conoscenze fondate sui dati e la loro visualizzazione
Dirigere progetti d'attuazione dal punto di vista tecnico, organizzativo e del personale


Il Suo profilo


Formazione di livello terziario (università, SUP) in informatica, data science, business analytics o informatica di gestione con esperienza o formazione continua nella gestione sostenibile degli immobili
Grande affinità con i sistemi digitali, capacità di operare in un'ottica economico-aziendale, metodo di lavoro analitico e concettuale
Esperienza professionale nell'analisi aziendale e dei dati nonché nell'ingegneria e nella gestione dei requisiti
Capacità di adattamento in un ambiente in costante evoluzione ed esperienza in diversi settori della gestione del cambiamento
Capacità di fissare priorità e promuovere compiti e progetti in modo efficiente
Buone conoscenze attive di due lingue ufficiali e dell'inglese


Informazioni complementari

Per Ulteriori Informazioni è a Disposizione

Signor Daniel Züger, capo Gestione degli immobili, tel. 058 465 31 28

Ulteriori informazioni sono disponibili sul nostro sito Internet, su LinkedIn e Instagram. La invitiamo a consultare la pagina che indica i vantaggi offerti dall'Amministrazione federale ai suoi collaboratori. #lavorareperlasvizzera

Si prega di candidarsi tramite il nostro sistema di gestione delle candidature. A tal fine, cliccare su «Per candidarsi».

Numero di riferimento: JRQ$540-11673

Per candidarsi

Chi siamo

L'UFCL è sinonimo di tradizione e modernità e conta circa 900 collaboratori di varie professioni. Sostenibile ed esemplare, l'Ufficio si impegna nei confronti delle prossime generazioni. L'individualità dei collaboratori e l'entusiasmo con cui si dedicano al proprio lavoro e alla definizione di nuovi standard fanno dell'UFCL uno degli Uffici federali più interessanti e polivalenti.

+ per saperne di più

L'Amministrazione federale è attenta alle necessità e ai diversi vissuti dei suoi collaboratori e ne apprezza la diversità. La parità di trattamento gode della massima priorità.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Job Information

Galliker verfügt über ein Netzwerk mit umfassenden Logistikdienstleistungen in all seinen nationalen und internationalen Betrieben. Umso wichtiger ist es, die komplexen Geschäftsprozesse durch eine zeitnahe Bereitstellung relevanter Informationen zu optimieren.

Zum Ausbau unseres Data Analytics Teams in Altishofen (Luzern) suchen wir eine motivierte und verantwortungsbewusste Person als Data Analyst mit Schwerpunkt Power BI. Als Data Analyst übernimmst du Verantwortung bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer cloudbasierten Datenplattform und gestaltest die Business Intelligence und Analytics Strategie proaktiv mit.

Jetzt Bewerben

Aufgabengebiet


Weiterentwickeln der Datenarchitektur basierend auf den Azure Analytics Services
Mitgestalten von Batch sowie Echtzeit Datenpipelines und Datenmodellen, um die korrekte Bereitstellung und Verfügbarkeit von Daten sicherzustellen
Erstellen von Analyse Werkzeugen (z.B. Dashboards und KPIs mit Power BI)
Zusammenarbeiten mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern, um ihre Anforderungen zu erfassen und in Form von sicheren und wertschöpfenden Datenlösungen umzusetzen
Übernehmen von Verantwortung für die Dokumentation, Implementierung und den Betrieb von Dashboards und Datenpipelines


Anforderungsprofil


Abgeschlossenes Studium mit Fachrichtung Informatik oder gleichwertige Aus- oder Weiterbildung
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer ähnlichen Funktion, in der Reports und Dashboards vorzugsweise mit Power BI produktiv umgesetzt wurden
Kenntnisse der neusten Datenarchitektur-Ansätze wie z.B. Data Lakes und Lakehouses
Ausgezeichnetes Verständnis von Datenbanken und Abfragesprachen (SQL)
Ausgewiesene objektorientierte Programmierkenntnisse (z.B. Python) von Vorteil
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift


Angebot


Motiviertes, kollegiales und wachsendes Team
Vielzahl an interessanten Analytics Use Cases mit unternehmensweitem Impact
Kurze Entscheidungswege
Agile Arbeitsweisen und eine topmoderne IT-Infrastruktur
Möglichkeit von Remotearbeit
Breites Einsatzgebiet in der Welt von Transport & Logistik mit internationalen Kontakten


Dein zukünftiger Arbeitsort

Schweiz

Hauptsitz Altishofen

Kantonsstrasse 2

CH-6246 Altishofen

Mit direktem Autobahnanschluss zur Hauptverkehrsachse der A2 und Gotthardbahnlinie ist Altishofen verkehrstechnisch optimal gelegen.

Route

mehr erfahren

Benefits

Das erwartet dich bei uns

Mindestens 5 Wochen Ferien

fortschrittliche eigene

Galliker-Pensionskasse

Flache hierarchie & Du-Kultur

kurze Entscheidungswege

Kostenlose Parkplätze

& gute ÖV-Anbindung

Interne Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
In order to strengthen our Data, Business Intelligence, and AI team, we are recruiting our next:

Senior Data Analyst

As a key member of our Data and BI team, you will play a pivotal role in maintaining ongoing Power BI reports and projects while developing new insights that directly impact the business. Your strong analytical skills, combined with a passion for transforming business requirements into actionable insights, will support multiple departments and contribute to the company's success.

You will ensure a seamless transition of projects from the previous Senior Data Analyst, while continuously evolving our data reporting landscape. You will collaborate closely with various stakeholders across departments, from High Management to Operations, ensuring the accuracy and efficiency of our data processes.

Job Responsibilities


Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide business insights using Power BI.
Ensure the smooth transition of current reports and projects from the existing Senior Data Analyst.
Develop and maintain Power BI reports for departments including High Management, Marketing, Operations, and AFSS.
Create dataflows and semantic models within Power BI to enhance reporting capabilities.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into clear, actionable reporting metrics.
Train and support internal teams in the effective use of Power BI and establish a Power BI users' community.
Work closely with the Data Engineering team to optimize ETL pipelines and data transformation processes within the Microsoft Azure environment.
Stay updated on data analysis tools, techniques, and industry trends to continuously improve the data strategy.


Profile

With a Master’s degree in computer science, data science, business intelligence, or a related field, you possess a strong analytical mindset and a proactive approach to solving complex problems. You excel in communicating technical insights to non-technical stakeholders, helping drive performance across the business.

You bring a wealth of experience with a minimum of 5 years in Business Intelligence, specifically focusing on Power BI. Your expertise in data transformation processes within Power BI (Dataflows, Semantic Models, and access management) is essential to this role. Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Data Engineering practices, particularly in ETL and pipeline management within the Microsoft Azure ecosystem, are key requirements.

As a Senior Data Analyst, your role is crucial in providing the tools and insights necessary to enhance business performance while contributing to the ongoing evolution of our data-driven strategies.

Fluency in both French and English is mandatory; knowledge of Italian is a plus.

#J-18808-Ljbffr

In order to strengthen our Data, Business Intelligence, and AI team, we are recruiting our next:

Senior Data Analyst

As a key member of our Data and BI team, you will play a pivotal role in maintaining ongoing Power BI reports and projects while developing new insights that directly impact the business. Your strong analytical skills, combined with a passion for transforming business requirements into actionable insights, will support multiple departments and contribute to the company's success.

You will ensure a seamless transition of projects from the previous Senior Data Analyst, while continuously evolving our data reporting landscape. You will collaborate closely with various stakeholders across departments, from High Management to Operations, ensuring the accuracy and efficiency of our data processes.

Job Responsibilities


Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide business insights using Power BI.
Ensure the smooth transition of current reports and projects from the existing Senior Data Analyst.
Develop and maintain Power BI reports for departments including High Management, Marketing, Operations, and AFSS.
Create dataflows and semantic models within Power BI to enhance reporting capabilities.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into clear, actionable reporting metrics.
Train and support internal teams in the effective use of Power BI and establish a Power BI users' community.
Work closely with the Data Engineering team to optimize ETL pipelines and data transformation processes within the Microsoft Azure environment.
Stay updated on data analysis tools, techniques, and industry trends to continuously improve the data strategy.


Profile

With a Master’s degree in computer science, data science, business intelligence, or a related field, you possess a strong analytical mindset and a proactive approach to solving complex problems. You excel in communicating technical insights to non-technical stakeholders, helping drive performance across the business.

You bring a wealth of experience with a minimum of 5 years in Business Intelligence, specifically focusing on Power BI. Your expertise in data transformation processes within Power BI (Dataflows, Semantic Models, and access management) is essential to this role. Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Data Engineering practices, particularly in ETL and pipeline management within the Microsoft Azure ecosystem, are key requirements.

As a Senior Data Analyst, your role is crucial in providing the tools and insights necessary to enhance business performance while contributing to the ongoing evolution of our data-driven strategies.

Fluency in both French and English is mandatory; knowledge of Italian is a plus.

Our Maison

Founded in 1884, Bulgari’s name has today become emblematic of Italian excellence. Perfectly blending tradition and modernity, Bulgari uses its rich history to inspire audacious designs and produce truly colorful creations making us unique. Internationally renowned, from our roots in jewelry and watches we have branched out into accessories, perfumes and luxury resorts. Excellence, enthusiasm and passion are the chemistry of everything we do.

Title: Esperta/o Power BI
Description:
60-100%, Losanna e home office

Professionista nell'utilizzo di Power BI, arricchirai il nostro team e contribuirai ad affinare ulteriormente le nostre competenze di analisi e visualizzazione dei dati. Ti occuperai della creazione, dello sviluppo e dell'ottimizzazione di soluzioni Power BI e aiuterai il personale a lavorare con questo tool. Con te daremo forma alla Posta di domani!

Ti occuperai delle seguenti attività


Opererai a stretto contatto con partner interni, analizzandone le esigenze e svilupperai o coordinerai soluzioni Power BI a misura d'utente.
In collaborazione con le e i responsabili self-service BI sarai il motore che guiderà l'evoluzione della Posta in un gruppo data driven. Grazie alla preparazione di percorsi didattici e all'organizzazione di formazioni specifiche aiuterai il personale ad acquisire dimestichezza con Power BI.
Occupandoti del coordinamento tecnico di progetti contribuirai in modo significativo al successo della relativa attuazione e assicurerai la soddisfazione delle e dei partner.
La stretta collaborazione con data scientist e data engineer e la formazione di collaboratrici e collaboratori interni ed esterni rientreranno nella tua sfera di competenza. Nei confronti della committenza assumerai un ruolo di consulente e referente esperto.
Opererai in un ambiente collaborativo e lavorerai in modo efficace con team cross-funzionali, tra cui IT, business unit e partner esterni.
Promuoverai lo scambio di conoscenze all'interno del team e garantirai una gestione efficiente delle richieste di supporto.
Supporterai le e i responsabili Power BI nell'ottimizzazione di condizioni quadro e attività specifiche e fornirai assistenza.



Le tue competenze


Hai una laurea in informatica, informatica gestionale o economia aziendale.
Hai una conoscenza approfondita della piattaforma Power BI, delle relative funzioni e potenzialità, tra cui creazione di rapporti, modelli di dati, calcoli DAX e integrazione di dati da diverse fonti.
Sei in grado di comprendere e creare modelli di dati complessi e di trasformare dati da diverse fonti, occupandoti del relativo aggiornamento, collegamento e aggregazione.
Condividi con piacere le tue conoscenze e aiuti il personale a sviluppare report ad hoc.
Sei in grado di ottimizzare i rapporti Power BI al fine di garantire una performance ottimale, in particolare per set di dati di grandi dimensioni.
La conoscenza di altri tool BI come SAP Analytics Cloud, Tableau e SAP Datasphere completa il tuo profilo.
Hai un'ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana, tedesco e inglese che ti permette di comunicare in modo chiaro ed efficace con tutti gli stakeholder. Una buona conoscenza della lingua francese a livello orale costituisce titolo preferenziale.



Se il settore dei dati è la tua passione e possiedi le competenze sopra descritte, inviaci subito la tua candidatura!

Cosa offriamo


6 settimane di vacanze
Congedo parentale
Lavoro mobile e flessibile
Workation



Contatto

Jan Locher Responsabile Business Intelligence

+41 76 367 90 16

Salario annuo lordo al 100%

CHF 126'400-141'400 Il salario effettivo può differire da questa fascia salariale in base all'esperienza e alle competenze

Informatica

L'unità di funzione Informatica/Tecnologia funge da motore della digitalizzazione per tutto il gruppo Posta ed è un partner decisivo per il successo: attraverso le attività chiave dell'IT accompagniamo infatti l'azienda nel processo di trasformazione digitale. Introduciamo le tecnologie più moderne, promuovendo le innovazioni attraverso sistemi IT agili, bimodali ed «embedded». Sviluppiamo nuovi modelli di business sicuri e garantiamo alla Posta un'infrastruttura ICT moderna e performante. In generale, per quanto riguarda la sostenibilità la Posta opera in maniera responsabile: la nostra sede principale di Berna ha ottenuto due certificati in materia e tutti i centri logistici di nuova costruzione devono essere almeno conformi alle cosiddette «regole d'oro» per la sostenibilità.

Title: Data Analyst Finance (al genders) 80/100%
Description:
Im Zentrum der Finanzdienstleistungen agieren mit grossem Engagement in die Digitalisierung!

Dafür engagieren sich täglich über 550 kompetente und motivierte Mitarbeitende.

Dabei ist die stete Weiterbildung, um die Voreiterrolle weiterhin zu bekleiden eine Voraussetzung!

Aufgaben


Weiterentwicklung der Tools für datenbasiertes und teilautomatisiertes Controlling
Datenanalyse und Visualisierung mit Fokus auf quantitative Analysen
Mitarbeit bei der Weiterentwicklung der Tools für die simulationsbasierten Berechnungen
Mitarbeit bei der Betreuung von Versicherungsunternehmen
Mitarbeit bei der stetigen Weiterentwicklung und Pflege der Standardmodelle und dazu passender Tools (inklusive IT-Implementierungen) in der Versicherung


Profil


Hochschulabschluss im quantitativen Bereich (Mathematik, Statistik, Data Science, Informatik, Physik)
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Datenbanken (SQL) und in Programmiersprachen im Bereich der Datenanalyse, z.B. R, Python, ggf. Matlab
Erfahrung in der Datenverarbeitung und -analyse sowie in der Aufbereitung und Berichten
Vernetztes Denken sowie zuverlässige, systematische und selbständige Arbeitsweise
Erste Berufserfahrung im quantitativen Risikomanagement, Erfahrung mit dem SST wünschenswert
Ausgeprägte Eigeninitiative und Kreativität sowie Freude an der Zusammenarbeit im Team
Sehr gute Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch oder Französisch (C2) sowie gute Kenntnisse der jeweils anderen Sprache und gute Kenntnisse in Englisch (B2)

Title: Data Engineer / Analyst
Description:
In this exciting role, you will be responsible for the development and operation of our end-to-end data streams, from the main source to data visualization. Your main tasks include:


Supporting internal and external stakeholders with data-based questions related to energy economics, as well as micro- and macroeconomic issues.
Data analysis and creation of visualizations based on IT infrastructure principles and self-service management.
Management of dedicated SQL databases, necessary data integration processes, and web visualizations, including documentation of necessary services.


Requirements

For this position, we are looking for a self-reliant, motivated person eager to actively contribute to the environment. You bring the following qualifications:


Higher education (HES/Uni/EPF/EPFL) in business informatics, business administration, economics, data science, or a related field.
Affinity with data science, such as the ability to extract, prepare, visualize, and comment on information from large datasets.
Proficiency in SQL, FME, and Tableau.
Strong team spirit, structured work approach, and willingness to independently and sustainably solve data-related problems.
Excellent command of German and good command of English, both written and spoken; knowledge of French is an asset.


Benefits

We offer you varied and stimulating tasks within a unique company in Switzerland. You will benefit from the following advantages:


A modern working environment within a motivated team, in close proximity to Aarau train station.
Flexible working hours (42 hours per week) with the possibility of remote work.
25 to 30 days of leave as well as collective leave between Christmas and New Year.
Solid social security and attractive retirement plan.
Opportunities for professional development.
Favorable financial and organizational conditions for internal and external training.
Competitive salary and recognition of good performance.

Title: Global Graduate Program - Quantitative Analysis/Data Science
Description:
Job Title:

Global Graduate Program - Quantitative Analysis/Data Science

Contract Type:

Permanent

Time Type:

Full time

Job Description:

Are you ready to dive into the dynamic world of commodities trading and data science?

At Gunvor, we're on a mission to empower the next generation of talent in the industry. Our Global Graduate Program is your gateway to an incredible adventure, where you'll build the skills and knowledge that will set you on the path to success.

Your role:

As a Quantitative Analysis/Data Scientist Graduate at Gunvor, you will play a crucial role in our data analytics and research team. This 12-month rotational program will provide you with hands-on experience in quantitative analysis, data science, and market research. You will have the opportunity to work on real projects and gain valuable insights into the commodities trading industry.

Key Responsibilities:


Analyze market data to identify trends and patterns.
Develop quantitative models and algorithms.
Collaborate with our market research team.
Gain exposure to trading strategies and risk management.



Qualifications:


Recent university's degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields.
0-12 months of work experience (ideally in commodities).
Strong numerical aptitude and coding skills (Python, C#).
Proficiency in statistical analysis.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to dynamic market conditions.



What We Offer:


A structured and comprehensive training program.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities for personal and professional development.
A competitive compensation package.



Selection Process:

Our selection process is designed to find the brightest talents who are eager to embark on this incredible journey. Here's how it works:

Application Window: We look forward to receiving your applications between the 1st of October and the 30th of October 2024.

Screening & Assessment (Up until December, 2024): Our recruiters will diligently screen applications as they are submitted and match the information to our selection criteria.


Assessment: If your application passes the initial review, you'll be invited to participate in our online assessments. Here, we get to see your numerical, cognitive, and problem-solving skills.
Initial Interview: Successful candidates from the assessments will proceed to an interview where we'll discuss your qualifications, experiences, and your passion for the commodities trading world.



Selection Days (January 2025): The final stage includes our face-to-face Selection Days, scheduled for January 2025. This is a fantastic opportunity for us to get to know you better, and for you to learn more about Gunvor.

If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our success.
